description:
Coffee: 5/5 
The coffee is GOOD. It's strong, perfectly brewed (espresso too) and their variety caters to all different types of coffee drinkers (the ones like me who like it strong and black and the ones like most of my friends who need it extra milky and sweet).  

Ambience: 4.5/5
It's the perfect study space. There are a plethora of outlets, plenty of seating and the white background noise drowns out any distracting conversations. I personally haven't ever tried their WiFi but I've heard it can be temperamental. However, I have xfinity at home and there is a hotspot in that area. 

Food: 3/5
I haven't tried many of the options on the menu but from what they offer, the options are pretty limited, basic and overpriced (as most of SF is).

Service: 4.5/5 
The people are really sweet and the baristas make great recommendations to people based of what type of coffee they usually like. My only complaint is that their service is a little slow.
author: Nisha I.

description:
I have to give this place a 1.5 star for their nitro brewed coffee. It was one of the most sour tasting brews I have ever had, and definitely was not nearly as smooth as many other places I have been to. I must mention that, for $5 is was the most skimped cup of coffee I have ever been served. It was the size of a small plastic water cup you get at Burger King, and the pour was half foam. So I basically paid $5 for literally 3 sips of coffee. DO NOT ORDER NITRO BREW TO GO. BIGGEST RIP I HAVE EVER HAD! 

I thought I would give this place a try since the reviews seemed decent and the atmosphere is what really drew me into this place. The atmosphere and decor is definitely a 5 star, but doesn't make up for lack of coffee i received. They also have a very nice outdoor patio with succulents and nice greenery that make it very relaxing. Good spot to study.
author: Darren C.

description:
I came here 3 years ago and had the best Cobb salad of my life. However, they changed the menu and now their Cobb salad is not as good. It doesn't come with bacon anymore and doesn't have the perfect taste and texture that it used to. I'm disappointed that it's not as good as it used to be, but neutrally speaking, it was average.

Their Vietnamese iced coffee is really good. This is a good place to do work, but I personally I wouldn't come here for the food.
author: Andrea T.

description:
Finally! A cute coffee shop in the Mission that has good coffee and food options, fast and reliable WIFI, abundance of outlets, and high ceilings for a great study/work spot. Believe it or not, but this combination of basic coffee shop offerings is actually quite rare in SF - most likely because owners want high turnover in a frequently trafficked area.

I got the havana latte (latte with condensed milk) for $5. A pretty average latte that was way too sweet.. even for condensed milk. But I'm willing to give them another shot because everything else about this place is great.

There's one bathroom here, but it's spacious and clean.

Pretty packed on the weekends, so come early to make sure you snag up a spot. Otherwise, you may have to squeeze in at the communal tables or wait until someone leaves.
author: Sally L.

description: 4.5 stars! It's roomy, with more than plenty available seating/tables, ideal for studying. There's an outlet nearby every table. The WiFi works great. It's not hot inside even on the upper level --crucial stuff. And it's super cute inside and they have the usual coffee stuff and the tad more special like nitro cold brew or horchata cold brew. I got the horchata cold brew - they make it with their in-house horchata, it's creamier and sweeter than I expected. They got food and pastries too if you're hungry. With outdoor seating too!
author: Jane K.

description:
As embarrassing as it may be, I'll admit it - I had no idea just how popular Coffee Bar was until I looked up their Yelp page to start writing my review.  Over 1,000 reviews so far?  And here I was, thinking they were just a busy neighborhood spot!  Especially since it's easy to miss; if not for their red signage on the side of the building, I never would've known what this place was!

From the outside, Coffee Bar looks like so many other nondescript warehouses in the neighborhood.  Inside though, the space is actually quite warm and welcoming.  Oh...and LOUD (read: noise cancelling headphones are your friend).  Still, it's a nice spot to get some work done, assuming you can find a seat.  What's more, though their menu isn't large, they have a tasty looking slate of food options to choose from.

-- VIETNAMESE COLD BREW - Cold Brew, Sweetened Condensed Milk...$4.25
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coffee-bar-san-francisco?select=3yI8Niw-3GT9Bxd2cflVEw)
Given the warm weather, I figured this would be pretty refreshing, but it was also legitimately good!  Not only did it have a strong, deep flavor to it, but the condensed milk give it the perfect balance of creaminess and sweetness.  I'd come back for this alone!

-- TURKEY CLUB SANDWICH - Diestel Ranch Turkey, Bacon, Tomato, Avocado, Red Onion, Romaine Lettuce, and Chipotle Aioli on Toasted Multigrain...$13
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/coffee-bar-san-francisco?select=SwNz1vQjr8hVSDUpw97-7A)
While I didn't expect this to be bad, I certainly didn't think it was going to be this good (or filling)!  The sandwich had a lot of veggies, a fair amount of meat, and some tasty bread (though the edges were a bit dry).  As for the salad, it wasn't all that remarkable, but still a welcome addition!

Despite how good the food and coffee was, service here could use some work.  It was fine during my first trip, but flawed during the other two.  The second trip, they forgot to make one of our drinks (too busy socializing, I assume).  The third, the guy at the counter kept interrupting us after every item we ordered to give us our total and take our payment, even though we told him twice our group of five was ordering together.

Even with their flaws in service though, Coffee Bar is still a solid spot to grab a bite, do some work, or to simply grab a cup of coffee (though I've only tried their Vietnamese cold brew so far.  And I'm not even a little bit sorry about that.

FOUR AND A HALF STARS for the food rounded down for the service.
author: Mike L.

description: BEST place to study/work in SF. Lots of space, solid food and coffee, nice light and outdoor seating. Horchata cold brew is my fave!!
author: Tia R.

description: Adorable generously sized coffee shop/place to grab something to eat. They have a large patio and large inside seating area as well. Very industrial look/vibe. Excellent customer service and delicious cold brew. I also ordered banana bread that was extremely fluffy and fresh. Great spot to stop by! There's a sign that says no dogs but I did get away with my little man sitting on the patio this visit.
author: Sahar N.

description:
Coffee Bar is one of my top coffee spots to visit when I need to do work, or catch up with friends. I've been coming here for awhile to do work and highly recommend this place. I love the overall space inside, it's airy, high-ceilings and big warehouse-feel so there's plenty of natural light, (kind of reminds me of an art studio) and quiet with some light ambiance music in the back. There's also plenty of parking outside and a small outdoor space as well! The staff is friendly and the space is clean. 

I'm a huge cold brew fan and I love all the coffee they have here. No doubt their vietnamese cold brew and horchata are fan faves, but they also make good lattes and espressos! I love their avocado toast and they make some great salads. 

Free wifi is always a plus too! Nothing but great things to say about this coffee spot :)
author: Sandra L.

description: A cute place for work and friend gathering. They open on July the 4th, and I came here for a short read and study. They have a variety of coffee and soft drinks. Their chicken salad is very tasty and healthy. The high-ceilings style also feels, to me, spacious and good for work.
author: Xuaner Z.

description: Wanting an espresso with your pup? A cup of coffee after biking? Be aware, your dogs and bikes should stay outside, not even in their patio, really. We drove by this place couple times. One Sunday morning we decided to go with our pups, unfortunately we had to turn around because dogs are not allowed in their patio - 4signs at the entrance telling you no.
author: Roy S.

description: Great coffee shop to setup and work for the day with really personable baristas, especially Melissa Rose! She's typically there when I pop in, always in an awesome mood serving up great drinks.
author: Monique W.

description:
Spent a Sunday morning here writing. Sat on the balcony level since it was too cold to be outside. I ordered oatmeal. It was ginormous! Or maybe I was full, but I slowly ate away as I worked on one of my manuscripts. 

But then the wifi kept going in and out. So I had to use LTE. Which all matters since I had to access the cloud. 

Yes the cloud. So besides the cool SF vibe in the coffee bar, the wifi going out started to get annoying. Which affected my writing flow. Which now affects this Yelp review.

Hopefully they fix the Wifi issue if I stop by next time. 3 stars for now!
author: Reno U.

description: Love and love this little gem! The design is modern & there are plenty of free street parking a block away from here  The food was great and I was so encouraged by everyone around me studying or working  Guess I'm graduating with my master's from here lol
author: Celine B.

description: As far as vanilla lattes go, coffee bar will probably change your life. The coffee here is amazing, they make their own vanilla syrup in house, which makes the latte even more special. The food here is also great, I'm partial to the egg sandwich, which has tomato and this amazing mayo on it. The service is sometimes a bit slower, but it's always well worth the wait! I will be back many times to come.
author: Paul P.

description:
I came here last Saturday morning and did some light reading. The location is not that nice, but inside was very cute. Ordered the bagel with veggies (sprouts, tomatoes and avocado) and an americano. I forgot to add the cream cheese and the cashier cane upstairs and asked if I wanted it, added it for free. Best service.

Good number of tables. Outlets available.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Stumbled around this coffee shop since I was around the area. There's plenty of street parking but I did have some trouble looking for this spot. 

I'm always on yelp looking for new coffee shops and so this one popped up. I ordered the vanilla bean latte and asked for it to be iced. 

It was made right away and right off the bat... way too sweet (like overly sweet). Good thing there was ice because I needed to dilute the drink. I did however enjoyed the vanilla bean flavor. 

Overall, decent cafe with a ton of drinks and food to try out. I can see myself here with my work laptop! Nice vibes and very hipster. The drinks were sweet and can get pricey though.
author: Elaine C.

description:
This SoMa establishment serves good coffee and light bites in a gorgeous venue, featuring a decent amount of seating in an elevated area inside, as well as a patio outside that's particularly enjoyable on sunny days. If it gets too warm and sunny, however, the inside can get awfully hot. Fortunately, they do offer a few refreshing beers here.

Overall, it's a particularly good place to camp out and get some work or people-watching done.
author: Vincent L.

description: My go to spot for many years...The Recchiuti which is the dark hot chocolate is the bomb!
author: Sunil R.

description:
My absolute go-to for working cafes. Outlets. WiFi. Fantastic drinks. Great atmosphere. 

An increasing amount of cafes in SF are becoming anti-WiFi and anti-outlets, even the Starbucks'. Thank you Coffee Bar for fueling the workers of SF!
author: Alexis Y.

description:
Coffee bar is one of the best if not the best work cafe in SF. There are plenty of seating areas with outlets, nice high standing tables in the loft. Many people are there working throughout the day, which means there's an energy which means you can get work done. The music isn't too loud. 

I usually order the black tea which has just enough caffeine for non-coffee drinkers to be productive.
author: Demy T.

description:
Very disappointing.  Coffee is so overpriced. $4.75 before tax for small latte!  Now, I know this is San Francisco but down the street at Starbucks the same size latte is $3.45 and they're not know for being inexpensive.

Ok, well at least it's a good place to work and cheaper than a co-working spot, right!? Right. Except that the Wi-Fi is dreadfully slow.

I gave 2 stars because at least the coffee was good.

[Postscript: Why anyone would go here when they can cross the street to Starbucks is beyond me. I really needed to get work done so I left and discovered that Starbucks isn't down the street, it's 10 steps away). I had the same size latte in a ceramic cup for $3.45 before tax.
And the internet works!!!  Oh, and it takes a lot for me to write a negative review...i guess really needing to get stuff done made me more cranky than usual.]
author: Lisa B.

description:
Yes coffee bar was on my list for a while until today I finally made my trip here, on my daily routine.

Don't be fooled by the small shop front, as once you entered inside, you shall see a small yard and a grand space inside the room. I would recommend sitting outside at the cute red tables, while enjoying that cup of latte.

Aside from basics, coffee bar also offers specialty coffee, including vanilla bean flavored latte and Havana, a slightly sweetened coffee with condensed milk added. Breakfast looked tempting too, avocado toast, and even espresso toast! There was early-bird tacos too.
author: Elaine H.

description:
I came here for the first time last week and was so surprised how much room there was inside! I've been to their other locations in the FiDi and they're all just a grab & go kind of place, no seats inside - but this location had plenty! There are individual tables, and lots of communal, but also LOTS of people here. 

Luckily, we caught a few people leaving while we just got there, and grabbed their spot. Awesome spot to do some work, and their horchata cold brew is also the tastiest thing ever!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Tons of room, good coffee, and really fast WiFi. 

Wish there was more availability of baked goods in the case.
author: Trent W.

description: Great cafe with tons of space. The interior is a wonderful place to sit down and work during the day. They are very laptop friendly and have blazing fast internet.
author: Vinay A.

description:
In love with their horchata cold brew.  Anything mixed with "Horchata" can quickly go into grainy territory, and although acceptable in actual horchata, the last thing I want is for my morning coffee to be grainy.  Fear not because coffee bar has somehow worked their magic and got all that delicious ricey-cinnamony goodness into their cold brew, without screwing up the smoothness of the coffee and the beans they are using tastes fantastic; the coffee flavor really shines through.  

Also a little shout out to their house avocado toast.  I don't really buy into the whole avocado toast fad ($$$ for avocado on bread is quite frankly retarded), so when we asked the barista which savory food item he recommended.. I cringed a little when he told me "avocado toast."  But of course I was on a date, and I didn't want to sound too picky so I reluctantly accepted the toast recommendation.  When the toast came out, again my wallet cried a little (just kidding my date payed, but my wallet cried for his wallet) as I stared at the typical looking green slices on bread.  Thankfully upon first bite, I soon realized that the avocado toast wasn't that bad at all, and after a few more bites in, I realized hey.. this toast was actually pretty damn good.  Really fresh avocado placed over some really tasty homemade spread.. all on top of this really freaking delicious sesame bread.  I'm totally a fan and I'm so glad that we got it.  I'd definitely go back for that and the coffee whenever I'm in SF.
author: Wendy C.

description:
This place is totally fine. Coffee is fine and food is fine. Service is fine too. There is, however, plenty of seating. Basically, this place serves as a spot for people to study with their laptops and that is it. 

Also, beware of their chai. If you like very spicy chai, then this is for you, but if that is not your thing, then avoid it. Tasted like someone just dumped a whole bunch of all-spice in a cup to me.
author: Brett P.

description: A very work-friendly coffee shop environment! I love the spacious tables upstairs, and there are PLENTY of outlets and wifi works! Seating is comfortable- I fell asleep and took a nap here- oops. Coffee tastes good, too!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Good Coffee, decent food and great space. It got crowded fast. Great music. I would've loved to stay longer and do my my work but unfortunately their WiFi is shit. I couldn't do any of my online work. Best for offline work. I left and went to Philz.
author: R R.

description:
Great place to work. Love the space, has big communal tables, small 2 person tables, standing tables, and a bar - all available for working. Great music volume - enough to drown out with earphones if you need to work / quiet enough to have a conversation if you need to talk. The space is relatively bright excuse of the large windows. The coffee is solid - gotta love SF's $6 cold brew with soy.

It's pretty packed on Sunday afternoons, but if you're alone to work it's not too hard to find a shared space.
author: Nicole L.

description:
The coffee bar has great coffee, food, and a radical playlist. All the baristas are super chill, and never give off an unhappy or annoyed vibe here. It has plenty of seating which is great because I never feel claustrophobic when I come here to do work. Because it has south facing windows, this place gets glorious natural light which dances along the high ceilings. I swear high ceilings contribute to a more productive work space.
The outside seating is lovely too, and wifi reaches out there too, a huge plus! I love having the option of getting some vitamin D while I work.
 
The bathroom is super clean, which I am always so appreciative of . Nothing dingy about this place! If you're looking for a chill place to get some good work done, the coffee bar is a great choice. 

Cheers to this local spot, they are doing it right!
author: Alex D.

description:
5 stars for the coffee - yummy drip, delicious caramel latte.

5 stars for the food - the banana muffin was killer, with a cinnamon crumb topping and a small jelly-like filling; my friend liked her avo toast too.

2 stars for the service - the barista was rude and unhelpful. It took 20 minutes to get toast with avocado on it, mind you there was no one in line.
author: Adriana G.

description: I love this place and the coffee is one of the best in the city IMHO.  But then again dark rich roast with a bitter smooth battle on the finish ... well that's my jam.
author: Luciana V.

description: Needed a second breakfast when running  errands near mission. This place came up and didn't find the word 'wait' trending in reviews so decided to check it out :-) got the avocado toast with egg , rooster taco and scone for 2 of us - all great . Loved the avo toast the best  . They gave really cool seating and printing services as well ! Plenty of seating too - great place to work ,though I'm sure it must get full later in day for how good the place is
author: Anju J.

description:
This is a great place for people who always have to work work work work work... 

Order a Havana latte or cortado (cuban inspired espresso drinks) 
And then choose one of these:

Avocado Toast (healthy and delish) 
Ham & Cheese croissant (warmed) 
Nutella Bomb (it's exactly what you think) 

Take your coffee up to the bar on the second level, plug up your laptop, and wait as an angel stealthily delivers your breakfast. It's everything you need to jump start your day. If you have to work through lunch, they have raw juice and prepackaged salads too.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
High ceilings, bright and airy space. Looks like a great place to get work done with a basic menu for coffee and some small bites. Wi-Fi available and there are outlets. There are bar seats, regular group tables as well as standing tables.

Ordered an Avocado Toast ($5) which comes on Whole wheat bread, spicy aioli, perfectly ripened Avocado and topped with raw sesame seeds. Very clean tasting, aioli not too greasy, Avocado was ripe and the sesame seeds gave it texture.

Didn't get coffee this time around.

Service was pleasant and quick. Definitely a great place to get work done as noise level is decently quiet as well as the music volume. Would definitely come back to try their Chai or Vanilla Latté as those seem popular here.
author: Janet N.

description:
This place was alright.

I had an espresso.

Definitely a work-space coffee shop.

They offer food which is nice. 

Sightglass is down the street which is more of my style, but this place is perfect for lunch and coffee in my opinion.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Great place to work and the coffee is good too, but the baristas are not friendly or welcoming at all, they just throw a coffee on the bar. 
I asked for my coffee in a mug but she gave it to me in a paper cup and when I asked her to change it she did it but with with a grumpy face.
author: Jay G.

description: Beautiful ambience in this coffee place! The indoors and outdoors is hipster heaven. It's great for working, with plenty of outlets, tables, chairs, and standing tables (my favorite). There is also plenty of natural lighting. Jazz(ish) music is playing so bring your headphones if it's not your type of jam. The coffee itself is delicious and around $4-$5 dollars depending on what you are getting. They also have an assortment of pastries. For some reason they close around 2PM in August, so not sure if they're going to be changing that for the upcoming months. I've only tried the Vietnamese Coffee here but it's pretty BOMB - not too strong but perfectly balanced with the sweetness of condensed milk. It takes me a while to finish too.
author: Anna L.

description: Great spot to check out when you're not in the mood to "work from home!" There's free WiFi, the coffee shop isn't too loud, and the place has an overall beautiful​ aesthetic​. There's an outside seating area as well, but it looks more comfortable to work inside and leave the outside area for social gatherings. The one downside is the pricey menu! Definitely​ not getting iced coffee refills here.
author: Melissa B.

description: Great for a quick bite! Loved the ambiance, decor, and outside seating! Wish they made latte art on my chai latte but the avocado toast made up for it!
author: Marizza D.

description:
Usually like this place but my last trip here was a huge disappointment. 

Staff too busy chatting with friends.  Waited 15 minutes for my lukewarm  latte and I was the only one there.  The barista also made their friends drink before mine even though I was in front of him in line. 

Ended up being late to my meeting and with a mediocre drink.
author: Michael B.

description:
Came to San Francisco on a business trip and this was our breakfast spot for the weekend, an excellent one at that. There's plenty of indoor seating, with a cute little seating area in front. The potted succulents along the patio are adorable.

For firsts, their coffee is dope. I had the vanilla latte one day, and the Vietnamese Cold Brew for the rest. Seriously, I could not get enough of that cold brew. So sweet (and very filling). 

Their breakfast burrito is huge, full of all the delicious things - avocado, egg, white cheddar, bacon (or was it chicken sausage?)... drooling just thinking about it. Don't miss the avocado toast either, something so simple, yet this coffee bar does it right (or is it really the bacon?). The breakfast sandwich is also a great choice. That crispy bacon and scrambled egg between two hearty pieces of sourdough bread? What a great way to start the morning. For the lighter-faire folks, the granola and oatmeal were also great choices, as the fruit on top is just so fresh.
author: Emily A.

description:
I had an iced green tea there and it was spectacular especially as it was a hot day. Inside, it's pretty darn warm, but there's lots of space upstairs, some seats downstairs, and plenty outside!

Boyfriend swears by the horchata cold brew! Gotta say it's pretty good, but i dont think i would go out of my way to buy it here.
author: Mimi T.

description: Great spot for getting work done on wifi and the large cup of Havana coffee I ordered while small was one of the best iv ever had.
author: Sean G.

description:
This is honestly one of my favorite coffee spots in the city. It's tucked away in the Mission but it's always so crowded! I've always LOVED the caramel coffee at Coffee Bar. It's something about their caramel that makes it so authentic and not the kind you get from a pumped bottle. 

The place can get crowded very fast so it's hard to grab a table if you're not on the lookout. The space against the wall is off limits during certain hours for computer use - most likely during lunch so people don't hog the space for those who are there for an actual conversation. There's plenty of outlets against the wall and people come and leave pretty fast so I think you can definitely find a space to sit if you wait around for a bit. The baristas are super nice and friendly. The atmosphere can get a bit noisy at times so I wouldn't come here if you're looking for a dead quiet space to study at .
author: Tram N.

description: I'm usually here every weekend as it's my go to place to study and do some work. They have free wifi, awesome coffee and good food. What more could you want from a coffee shop? Most people in here are studying or working so it's on the quieter side. Only cons are that they get busy so the wifi gets super slow and it's sometimes hard to find parking in the area. Also, if it's your first time here, the washroom is downstairs. :)
author: Mira B.

description:
Good coffee and great service. Excellent place to get work done. 

Food however, terrible. They were kind enough to exchange my awful Bacon scone for equally gross avocado toast which was also destined for the compost bin. Hate to waste food but, oh boy, stick to the chia pudding which is delicious.
author: Eloy T.

description:
Coffee 8/10
Food 6/10
Space 7/10
Service 9/10

This is a really spacious chill cafe that would be great for working remotely. The decor needs a bit of an uplift, there are spaces on bookshelves that look pretty bare and in need of some love and attention. Some interior decorating wouldn't hurt. Staff at the cafe are friendly and we'll organized. 

Ordered avocado toast with hard boiled eggs. Honestly it was bland. There were pieces of she'll in my eggs. The bread seemed like store bought multigrain and the eggs were cold and unseasoned. It needed way more seasoning and garnish. Even sprinkling chopped parsley on top would have elevated the entire dish. But for $6 you can't ask for much.

Also the pastry window looks a bit sad..why is it so low to the ground? It looks shy and awkward..
author: Danbi L.

description:
Unreliable wifi- reconsider coming here if you plan to work. We tried for 10 minutes and it was either extremely slow or not working at all. The coffee is okay.

We ended up going to the Starbucks across the street.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Maybe I'm just spoiled because I recently moved to SF from Phoenix, where ginormous coffee shops full of wonderful little working nooks and crannies, fast wifi, and tons of outlets are somehow the norm but I wasn't impressed.  The coffee was good but overall it was really crowded and cramped, loud, and the wifi was pretty crappy (I noticed many people were tethering and I used my MiFi).

My boyfriend and I are looking for a place to be able to post up for a few hours on a weekend, get some coffee, some lunch, and maybe unwind with a beer or wine after we feel we've been productive enough.  This, for some reason, is extremely difficult to find in SF, which I suppose can be expected with the cost of real estate.  The search is still on, but at least the coffee was good.
author: Georgeann G.

description:
I researched the "best cold brew coffee in SF" and this place exceeded every expectation. I ordered the Horcheta Cold Brew (which the barista recommended) and it was perfectly sweet and smooth with a cinnamon twist.

This place is also fantastic for doing work. Wifi is great and there is ample seating. The place itself is situated next to a warehouse so it seems slightly out of place, but the sign is very noticeable and the vibes inside are incredible. Very relaxing and beautifully designed interiors.

This is my new favorite place for coffee and work!!!
author: Randi M.

description: I've been trying to cafe hop in SF and this was the first one I visited! I think the best part is that there's free parking near the area during certain times of the week, esp cuz it's so difficult to find parking in SF. Another great thing about coffee bar is the abundance of seating, which is really appreciated for me finding a cafe where I can study and sprawl all of my papers over a large table. It does get a bit loud around lunch time, so if you're looking for a quiet place to study, either come earlier or it might not be the best place!
author: Iris X.

description:
What the H*LL?  I mean really, what am I missing here? We stopped in to Coffee Bar on a Saturday afternoon, because of all the super high ratings... The overall appearance seems cool enough. It's attached to the artist building which we love to visit. Nice looking outdoor space, and cool two level interior. BUT, that is where it all ended for us. There were three people behind the counter (1 young boy, 1 young girl, and one older woman), and only 1 customer in front of us. We stepped up and ordered our two lattes. One decaf, and one regular. I am a person who cannot have caffeine (decaf is the max my body can tolerate). The girl did the register work, and told the boy what to make. Then she stood behind the counter, staring at her phone. The older woman stood by the café machine and watched the boy... well, kind of do nothing for a really long time. He finally got the person who was in front of us, their coffee. Then, he stood around by the machine . . . and stood there, and stood there... We were sitting on the waiting bench right in front of the counter, doing just that.. WAITING. Oh, let's see too, there are a ton of dirty plates and such out in the patio area, just sitting, while the young girl stared at her phone (she was actually facing them if she would have looked up). We waited, and waited... Finally, the boy got ONE latte finished. He put it on the counter and we walked up and asked "is this ours?", "yes". "Is this the decaf or the regular latte?"... (long pause), "decaf". . . Ok, so we got one down... I swear to you, it was another 10 or more minutes, and quite honestly we were determined to see just how far this would go, when a new customer came in the door. The girl did not move from looking at her phone (and yes, she is standing right by the register). So, the boy came up to help the new customer. Oh, yeah, he STILL has not even started the second latte, and he is now helping this new customer. REALLY??? It was like we were on a hidden camera show to see if we would explode (remember Boiling Point?)...The older woman never budged the entire time. Just stood by the café machine. I know this is a wordy review.. but stay with me, I have to finish this.
So, we have been here to get two lattes, for about 25 or more minutes, and the boy finally gets back to making the second latte. It comes up, and we have our drinks. . . what a flipping disaster of a business.
Now to top of my afternoon...That "decaf" latte turned out to be a regular caffeine infused drink. . . my body was jacked up until the next day... THANKS A**HOLE...
author: Greg S.

description: Hands down my fav place to work when I am in SF for business.  I adore their Bergamote black tea, horchata latte, or if I'm feeling simple: my go to classic iced Americano.  They have simple syrup infused with cinnamon at the milk bar.  Their sandwiches and pastries are delicious as well.  They have plenty of working space and outlets and the 90s music playlist is just perfect! I adore this place so much!
author: Grace H.

description: Coffee is really good but food is okay, overpriced for quality. The atmosphere is warm and enjoyable but not necessarily friendly.
author: Kevin M.

description:
vanilla bean latte -- I was intrigued by their homemade vanilla bean syrup, but the drink was too sweet which masked the espresso/coffee flavor. With tax it was $4.99 which is a bit much IMO considering an average latte price is $4
2.5 stars for the coffee, rounding up to 3 stars because of a cool environment -- both inside and outdoor seating is plentiful and welcoming. i think it'd be better to come and stay for a while than grab something to go

v friendly service
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Ordered an iced americano and an iced latte. Took them almost 30 mins to complete this order. Why? Because they messed up and then forgot to make my new/correct drink. 

They also gave me this stupid cup. No lid would fit it. WTF is this? 

Didn't apologize or offer to comp my drinks. Horrible experience. Never coming back. They can't get basic orders done.

I ended up throwing my drink away it tastes so bad.
author: Gina H.

description:
Great coffee shop to study / work individually or with a group--there are plenty of large and single tables, seating, outlets, and free wifi. 

Coffee was good; I had the Havana Latte and enjoyed it. I did not order the food but there seemed to be a decent menu as well as pastries available in the glass display by the ordering counter.
author: Ailien V.

description:
The Havana latte is my kind of coffee. It's super sweet because it has condensed milk in it, and lots of it. I wish it was a little bit less sweet but nonetheless amazing.  My bf had the Vietnamese coal brew which was pretty good as well. I don't like cold brews because they're usually too bitter, but it has condensed milk in it which makes me slightly sweet. 

I also really liked the large space. It seems great for studying!
author: Vy T.

description: Vietnamese cold brew  best iced coffee beverage of all time. If you must have it hot try the Havana Latte
author: Kartik S.

description:
Of the many many cafes, coffee spots, and work-stop eateries that I (and I'm sure all of you) have been to, this one makes it to my top tier of great spots (in SF, tiers of "good" are necessary, haha).  And while parking can be a slight hassle, depending on the hour of day....still a great spot for the following reasons:

1. Space: Open, lots of tables and outlets, average ambiance noise.  The design is industrial, clean and simple.  At times it can be busy and crowded, but customers are in and out enough for you to find a seat soon enough.

2. Food: I've only tried the Kalifornia Salad...kale, cabbage, and chicken topped with grated cheese, Serrano peppers, peanuts, avocado, and a peanut sauce drizzle.  We've all had the typical California style kale salad, but I must way this was one of the most well-executed ones.  The kale and cabbage were cut in small enough pieces and were softened so I don't feel like I'm eating a bush.  The serrano peppers were just enough to add a good kick and lingering spice, but isn't a crude intense spice.  A little heavy on the dressing, but I'll just ask for it on the side next time.  Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

3. Coffee:  Didn't try it yet, but the menu has a good spread


I'll be back!
author: Mon T.

description: Never got to try the coffee because their hours are posted in correctly, or the lady just wasn't having it this morning. Got to the coffee bar at 7:20 am and a lady shook her finger at my roommate and I and nodded her head no. Was a kind of odd interaction.
author: Candace M.

description:
My favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.  I'll go 30min out of my way just to get a Chai here.  One of the best I've ever had.  Plus it's an amazing place to get some work done when out of the office.  Close to lunch spots, and not terrible to find a parking spot.  

The place also has amazing sandwiches and salads too. But make sure you come early on weekends...place fills up fast.
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is a great place to study or hangout. If you can find a seat haha. It's always full, filled with people with their MacBooks who definitely look like they're settled in for the long haul. If you do manage to find a spot to sit, you're very lucky. This place is happening and for good reason. The drinks are so good, and their food is pretty great for a cafe. Although, it's more like $$ than $ once you finish ordering. But no matter, I can tell there's quality to be found here. The vanilla bean lattes are some of the best I've had. If you wanna stay up the entire night, probably go with the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Boy, is that strong. But still yummy. Their sandwiches and wraps are great, albeit pricy but if you're settling in for a day of work/studying, they're all good options. 

5 stars for the coffee, more like 2-3 stars for how packed it gets and the lack of parking there. So frustrating parking there but if you get lucky with a place to sit AND park, count your blessings and enjoy the delicious-ness.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
amazing ambient. I get so productive when I go there. there is a variety of coffee options and food which okay quality. this is on top of wifi and outlets.
the only reasons this place does not get a better rating is because they don't have a great customer service, there is always a line here which is really annoying when you're trying to get some work done. Moreover they close at 4pm. this is very inconvenient.
author: Helia S.

description: Apparently this is a great spot if you want to sit with your computer by yourself for hours taking up a table for two or four and eat expensive but sub-par food. The inside is large but a lack of chairs and poor use of the space make it hard to find somewhere to eat/drink.
author: Nick C.

description:
Horchata cold brew is reason enough to come here.

Cool indoor workspace. Pretty packed on Sunday cuz people in sf like to get the week going a day early.
author: Andrew C.

description: YUM. Seriously. The coffee. The food. It's all great. The kalifornia salad (why you gotta misspell my home state?) is amazing. I know you think a kale salad will not be satisfying but you are so wrong. Spicy and creamy and crunchy. It is everything.
author: Sally J M.

description: Coffee Bar is a lovely spot to work, relax, and talk. Food and coffee are great, and the music was on point. Specifically, Melissa Rose, this dope ass barista, had an incredible playlist. She kept the amazing deep cuts coming all day. Thank u, Coffee Bar!
author: Emma P.

description: There Vietnamese coffee here is so AMAZING! I'm happy to find a place that have them. Also I didn't know that they have horchata brew coffee there that's one thing I want to try next time.
author: Andrea C.

description: My favorite place to study in med school. Came back this weekend after residency. Felt super nostalgic. Coffee was as amazing as I remember. Would urge you to get a Havana latte or Vietnamese iced coffee. Menu of food sounded just as tasty as it used to be. Perfect place to spend the day studying while eating delectables and sipping premium joe. *****
author: Harjit m.

description: You know you've gotten used to insane SF/NYC prices when $5 avocado toast seems like a steal but here we are. Oof. Anyways, it's good toast. And a good latte. And it's a pretty nicely laid out place.
author: Misha T.

description: I love Coffee Bar! The whole vibe, and their range of lattes and coffee are awesome. They have a ton of outlets, and communal tables that make it easy for us to work or study. They also have a great music playlist, and is just an overall great place to go for meetings, studying, or having coffee with friends. I really love their Havana Latte--it's sweet and tasty. Very welcoming environment, and cute decor.
author: Shan M.

description:
I've only had the iced coffee which is really delicious, bold, and strong. I've seen the prices on some of the other options and food and it's pretty pricey for food so if you're trying to do work here, bring food with you if possible and just get coffee here and get your work done. 

Plenty of seating to do work except during prime times when certain tables are blocked off from being used for work as brunch is popular here as well.
author: Cheri C.

description: Typical "for the vibe" coffee shop with high ceilings, outdoor seating and work space. However waiters have attitude/ don't communicate very well. Nothing is super fancy--the tea is normal tea I'd get for free at dimsum, vanilla latte doesn't really have any vanilla, snacks are overpriced of course.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Wow this place is great! I almost don't want to write this review so more people won't find out about it.

Their avocado toast is probably some of the best I've had yet. It has a nice sauce with a kick and I would go back just to eat it again. I tried the green tea which I also enjoyed.

The space is big and open, and there's outdoor seating as well. Small tables, a few bars to sit at, as well as some big, communal tables. Wifi is free and I was kicked off once, but no big deal. 

Also, it's located in the perfect little nook of the Mission/Potrero Hill so tons of street parking. 

Perfect place for: working, reading, hanging out, feeling hip but not too hipster, sitting and thinking, sitting and talking, etc.
author: Steph D.

description:
SUPER SUPER LOVE THIS PLACE. 

Coffee Bar is really a bar for coffee lovers. Those that love to work with a nice cup of coffee. On a sunny day, how nice for natural light to shine upon thee :) 

Coffee Bar offers an outside patio and also an enormous inside seating with plenty of tables and OUTLETS. Yes, don't fret. Outlets are there, but as this place gets packed it may be hard to secure a spot. Wifi is free and doesn't have any network issues. They play their own music which is sorta loud and not my style, but I just opt to put on my own headphones and play my K Pop music. 

For coffee, I ordered the Havana Latte which consisted of latte with condensed milk. It was sweeter than I liked, so I'll probably ask for less the next time. Nevertheless, it was a good enough to wake me up. They have breakfast and lunch options too but I skipped that out. Toast, sandwiches, pastries, salad, yummm... the next time :)

Any place with an abundance of study space, drinks, food and cute decor deserves my regular visit. It's too bad this isn't closer to where I live. Although I'm not sure I want people to think I had nowhere else to go :P The real problem though are their hours. They close at 5pm everyday. Where am I supposed to study after class? Hopefully they decide to expand their hours. 

WORTH THE VISIT.
author: Fiona L.

description: This spot is really cute and such a great place to get some work done or go on a coffee date. I have been going to this coffee shop for about a year and a half now, but it seems that their breakfast menu has gotten smaller and less appetizing. The only things I order are the avocado toast and the nutella bun (if you're lucky). Nevertheless, the coffee selection is delicious. You cannot go wrong with anything on their coffee menu. To name a few, my favorites are the recchiuti mocha, cortado, and vietnamese iced coffee. The only reason I give this coffee shop 3 stars is because the breakfast menu could be better and they rarely have the recchiuti syrup made.
author: Tina A.

description:
Their specials are always great. It was crowded as always at 11am on a Friday, but there were many seats open on the front patio despite it being a sunny day. Probably because everyone here is working on their laptops.

COST: $12.07 total for 2 coffee drinks.

WE GOT: Iced Havana Latte ($4.50), Mary's Horchata Cold Brew Special ($5). Both tasty! Definitely on the sweet side, but nice for a morning break.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
The place itself is worth 4 stars; it's a great work spot and definitely will accomodate your hipster needs very well. You know, a coffee shop with a lot of room, a lot of light, a delightful outdoors sitting area, so that you can sip on your organic coffee while "working" on your new MacBook Pro, after your hot yoga class. You were supposed to meet with Jared to discuss this new project for your startup, but turns out he is not coming after all. Jared is instead meeting up with Jessica. They matched on Bumble and have been talking online for two weeks now, so it's getting SUPER serious. Turns out Jessica is a regular at Coffee Bar too, because she is a strong independent woman, and she thought Coffee Bar reflected that perfectly. Jared liked that about Jessica. Unknown to Jared at the time, this would go nowhere anyway, because Jared liked his latte iced, while Jessica didn't. They mutually ghosted each other after the secind date, and that was the end of it. Richard was better anyway. Tall European and all. He had good taste in polo shirts. Surely Richard would be the one... 
Long story short, the croissant is worth 2 stars, so the rating nicely averages out to 3!

LOOKS: Dat croissant is FAT. It definitely doesn't skip leg day. But you gotta work on all parts, not just squat your life away... 3/5

TEXTURE: Ouch! Zero crunch on the outside. You can already guess it the moment you hold the croissant in your hand. It never lies. A croissant with no crunch is like a latte with no ice. At least according to Jared. Jessica obviously disagrees on this point. 1/5

TASTE: The croissant actually tastes pretty good! The buttery inside has a good balance. It's not overwhelming. But I can't technically call it an inside, because there is no outside. Sorry... 3/5

PRICE: More than $3?? Yeah, thanks but no thanks. 2/5

VERDICT: L'ADDITION, S'IL VOUS PLAÎT!
author: Nathan H.

description:
I've found my first favorite coffee shop in SF ~
The ambiance and decor inside is just beautiful and I love how peaceful the area is. I spent 4 hours at the coffee shop without even realizing how fast time had gone !
I got the havana latte which was really a bit sweet but I personally enjoy my latte's sweet as I have a sweet tooth .
I also got the avocado toast ~ the avocado was just perfectly ripe and i enjoyed the slight spicy kick that the toast had .
author: Julia K.

description:
Delicious salad. Not too loud. Pretty fast wifi. Perfect place to work.

They even have some tables meant to be used like a standing desk.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Bustling cafe, solid food and drinks, laptop friendly!

I had a good couple hours of continuing education I needed to finish up and was looking for a cafe in the city where I could get my work done. Coffee Bar was a good choice. I got there around 10ish so I was able to score one of the coveted counter seats that line the second level.

I hadn't had breakfast yet so was hungrily looking over the menu. We're in SF so of course I see the Avocado toast ($4 - add $1 for egg, $2 for bacon bits). Other options are the very intriguing sounding espresso toast ($4 - you're mine next time), yogurt & granola ($5), and egg sandwich ($8). The breakfast burrito was tempting but I was being cheapsies so I opted for the ham and cheese croissant instead which did the job and paired nicely with my latte.

This place had a good amount of seating upstairs, and several large tables which were communal. I imagine this comes in handy as starting around noon this place gets crazy busy with the lunch crowd. Their menu is fairly expansive with decent sandwich and salad options available. Also available are pre-wrapped sandwiches, great for those on the go.

Since my seat overlooked the first floor, I was distracted watching all the people come in but it didn't seem like an issue for my counterparts who all looked very focused and serious. A decent number stay here for hours upon hours and even take work calls from their laptop. Music selection consisted of a lot of new alternative and indie rock a la Modest Mouse which I found enjoyable. Self-service water was a plus.

No complaints about the Wifi although you have to re-agree to the terms every hour or so. Cafe is bright, airy, and spacious and was definitely an upgrade to studying at home.

The reason I can't give this place 5 stars is it's a little on the pricier side for the quality of food you get. You can easily rack up quite the bill if you're grabbing lunch, drinks, and a dessert here.

Also there is a perpetual line for the bathroom and their toilet is weaksauce! Some blonde lady in a cute cargo jacket and booties left me her #2 to deal with so I was in the bathroom for what felt like an interminably long time trying to get that sucker down and make the toilet presentable again. (What a nightmare!) I knew someone was waiting for me as I heard them jiggle the door open. So awkward. This definitely marred my experience some. Sorry to ruin anyone's appetite but just speaking the truth.

Downstairs they also sell roasted coffee and homemade vanilla syrup and caramel in cute jars.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Beautiful neighborhood and awesome vibe. Super slow service and warm/cold coffee! C'mon for so much $$$ (very pricey), at least serve a hot coffee. Not that hard.
author: Chip S.

description:
Brought by a recommendation, it was not a disappointment. The place has two floors and is fairly large. There is an outside patio as well as an inside dining area. Parking is free along the small streets from what I recall and it isn't hard to locate. It is right at the corner. 

Food/Drink:
I had their veggie burrito and horchata cold brew over ice. The veggie burrito was large. It is enough for two people but I had it all to myself. It had black beans, scrambled eggs, cheese, avocado, etc all in a red tortilla. The tortilla wasn't flavored, it was just dyed. 

The horchata cold brew was delicious! It was very warm when I visited and it hit the spot! The amount was generous and it wasn't too sweet. It was smooth, there wasn't any texture like actual rice or oats like I have had at other establishments. 

Service:
Staff is very friendly. There are waiters and waitresses but for simple things such as extra utensils and condiments, its self serve. They know their regulars which is always a plus and everyone is friendly & approachable. 

- They do have restrooms. 
- They have power outlets. 

Con:
It gets very warm inside and there is limited sitting outside. 

A must try, even if its just for coffee when in the area!
author: Patricia D.

description: I really want to love this place but the wifi is just entirely too slow and unusable to ever come back and work here again. It's set up perfectly for working but the wifi issue just makes it a complete pass.
author: Ian S.

description:
So many hipster vibes but yolo I love coffee and Coffee Bar is great.

I love coming here to grab a cup of coffee and a snack or a sandwich. I've gotten the iced coffee and iced Americano here and both were pretty good. I need to try their other coffee drinks! But I really dig this place for their food! Their ham and cheese croissant is DA BOMB.COM. And also the last time I came here I got a lox sandwich for lunch and ugh omg so delicious. when I die bury me with a lox sandwich in hand. They have a ton of different sandwich and pastry choices and lunch specials and everything looks delicious. 

The coffee shop itself is pretty spacious. There's a nice outdoor seating area with tables and umbrellas. Inside, the space has high ceilings and tons of seating. It would definitely be a great place to study or do work. It's usually pretty quiet and laid back. Definitely check this place out if you want some caffeine, delicious food, and a nice place to chill!
author: Amy T.

description:
Came here primarily for the breakfast burritos and now they've been replaced with premade tacos.

Went from best breakfast burritos in town to none at all. 

Coffee and atmosphere is still great but I'm not sure I'll go out of the way for food here anymore.
author: Yelp P.

description:
Great coffee shop, perfect for working. Strong wifi, plenty of outlets. Couple standing tables for working too. This is one of my go-to work places on the weekend.

They do have food here too, but I've never gotten it; it's not cheap.

Warning: it gets warm upstairs during sunny days. Try to snag a table outside in the shade instead!!
author: Paul B.

description:
Looking for a coffee shop that can adequately drown you in your work while you can be treated to a perfectly-pulled cup of coffee and hearty eat can be a bit difficult to find.

Most coffee shops are little pop-ups or small cafes with a few seats and couches with enough room for a few guests. This Coffee Bar should be called some sort of Coffee Lounge or Library, because there are wide open tables, desks, chairs, couches and even gorgeous outdoor patio seating. There's nothing like seeing everyone pulled up on their laptops, headphones on and coffee in hand that makes you want to work, as well.

Not a lot of cups of coffee can make me swoon as much as this, but I wandered in on here for a quick cup and decided to see what this Havana Latte was all about. For a 12oz cup for $5, it surprisingly made me swooooon. It made my mouth melt with every sip. I ordered it with soy milk, as is my usual, and was surprised at how creamy and sweet it was. It was like a deliciously perfect, warm cup of milky lightly-caramel-ly coffee... I can see why people would crave this over and over again as it's a rich and warm cup that easily fills your appetite. Damn smooth and light.

Other peoples' eats seemed delicious, but they normally go from $8-13, so I didn't go for a plate. Their sandwiches and salads are made fresh in-store and delivered to your seat. Perfect spot for a good cup of coffee and sandwich to go with your midday work grind, coffee break with friend or chat.

If I'm ever in the area again, I'd LOVE to come back. This may easily become one of my favorite coffee shops in San Francisco... And it's not just the succulents, pretty red patio seating or lots of open space... Their coffee pulls really well!
author: Rachel Ann C.

description: An overall super disappointing experience. Coffee in the latte was burnt and bitter, and I've seen children blow bubbles smaller than the bubbles in their frothed milk. I also wouldn't be surprised if the bread for their avocado toast came from the sale section of Safeway next to the wonder bread. And what's that, a craft single on my egg sandwich? The only saving grace about this place was their bean and avocado burrito. Service was lackluster unfriendly as well.
author: Nadja K.

description:
Industrial building in Mission on the corner of Florida St and Mariposa St. There is a lot of seating available (inside/outside - includes standing tables), natural light, outlets galore, music from the likes of Maxwell and Outkast and a yummy veggie burrito.

Bonus: if you're into houseware, Coffee Bar is about a 3-minute walk to Heath Ceramics.

-

WiFi: No password needed. Agree to conduct rules
Outlets: So many. FYI, the bar seating has outlets underneath
Parking: Street
Eats: Sandwiches, salads, pastries, coffee, tea
Noise: 10/10 (10 = very noisy)
author: Alaine J.

description:
Great place to work - echo-y and open, the white noise is perfect for some heads down work. Not great for phone calls though.

Coffee is decent, if not pricey.

But avoid the sad sad baked goods. They are VERY institutional and the croissant I bought was terribly dry and tasteless. Ick.

Go for the environs and drinks, avoid the baked goods.
author: Madison W.

description: Love this place! Such a great place to get shit done.   This is my fave productivity spot in all of sf.
author: Neil T.

description:
I live nearby and currently work remotely, so this is place is convenient for me. I come here on a regular basis, coffee is good, food is ok, wifi is crappy and unreliable (but I'd still rather come here than go to starbucks).

As at all pretentious, overpriced SF coffee places, here too they make it clear that making coffee is an art and takes a while, and everyone working here always seems annoyed at you just out of principle. Fine. 

Anyways - I always order either a cappuccino or a latte, but the former is normally a tad too strong and the latter too weak in terms of milk/coffee ratio. Not to be annoying, I did anything about it - until today, when I realized if I'm paying almost $5 for a coffee, I might as well thoroughly enjoy it. 

So I asked for a latte, but with a little less milk.
What followed was a 5 minute back-and-forth about what exactly that meant, if I was sure about it etc, with the barista making me feel like I was asking for them to go to Indonesia this instant and harvest me some fresh Kopi Luwak coffee.....?!
In a town where people constantly order triple shot, gluten free, almond milk, decaf and-so-on, I didn't think me request was that outrageous, but ok. 

So next, the person who took my order goes to the barista that's making my coffee, and instead of just saying 'latte but just pour a little less milk' goes on explain the specific ounces and recipients to be used...
Then the two discuss again, as if I'd ordered a f'ing Unicorn tear concoction, roll their eyes, and make it very clear that they're so over it. 

First of all, I'm right here - get a grip. 

Secondly - if you're gonna charge $5 for a coffee, something's gotta give for that overpricedness.

Thirdly - I'm getting really sick of this millennial, entitled AF crap...if you're so f'ing annoyed at people asking you for coffee, then maybe don't work at a coffee shop. 
But I'm sick of having to deal with this 'the world owes me everything' attitude when I'm just coming in to grab my damn coffee and get on with my day.
author: F F.

description: Love this spot. People are nice, plenty of space for SF, and drinks/food are great! Horchata cold brew is on point and salads have huge portions!
author: Eric T.

description:
One of the best coffee I've ever had! The Havana Latte is popular here and it is delicious, probably because of the condensed milk. They don't drown the latte in condensed milk so it's not overly sweet. The cold brew iced coffee is also on point (or 'on fleek' as the cool kids say). I generally don't drink black coffee but this is tasty without milk. 

Their breakfast burrito was just aite. Maybe because it had chicken chorizo instead of pork, and I wanted a dirty burrito to kickstart my metabolism for the day. I've had better breakfast burritos but putting tapatio on it made it more flavorful. According to one guy's tip below he warns us Yelpers to not use the tapatio because homeless people drink it. I saw this AFTER I had used it. My first thought was, FUHHHH am I going to die now?! Nope. Still alive and kickin' after one week. 

A lot of people come here to do work and it's one of the better places I've been to to get work done. However, come early in the morning on a weekend (before 10am) if you want to get a seat/table, especially with an outlet. The WiFi also goes in and out A LOT the more crowded it gets. I left shortly after 12pm because of this frustration.
author: Kristina D.

description:
Once I was very fond of this place. But I don't understand why I keep coming. I ordered a turkey club sandwich. But they where out of bacon. Ok. Fine. I was charge the same amount for s turkey-no-club-sandwich. 
Then I noticed a small note under the cash register: we will charge 5% to your bill to cover costs related to doing business in the Bay Area!! 
I want to go local, but I think I will stop coming here and visit more often the Starbucks across the street.
author: Foo B.

description:
Great coffee and pastries. Even better atmosphere and vibe. It's quiet enough to sit and be able to get your work done but not too quiet where you feel awkward talking comfortably with a friend. 

I come here often to get school work done. It can get pretty full with people but it's nice because they have a lot of community tables and they even have tables reserved for non-working customers who just want to enjoy their coffee.

The chai tea latte is wonderful and so is the Vietnamese iced coffee. Would definitely recommend!
author: Jamie K.

description:
tldr; I would probably come here every day if I lived near them

I love this Coffee Bar. I've only been to their FiDi locations in the past since I used to work there. I was in the area (a bit out of the way unfortunately!) and decided to stop by for a coffee. Firstly, the menu looks way more expanded than their FiDi locations. Also most importantly, there's a TON of seating! There's a lovely little outdoor area that you walk through to get into the shop, and then there are a ton of seats inside. 

I got the Havanna Latte here which I haven't seen in FiDi (though it sounds like maybe I just haven't been to their other locations in awhile). It's basically a latte that is made with condensed milk instead of normal milk.  It is awesome.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Meh service, ran out of bagels at 8 in the morning?! Food was good though, got avocado toast and chia seed pudding.
author: Lawrence J.

description:
I love the ambience for working and catching up.  There's a lot of natural light, and the setting is quite spacious, which is hard to get with coffee shops in the Mission.  There's both an upstairs area and an outdoor area in front for those who want Vitamin D.

Coffee is okay, and it's on par with other non-branded coffee shops in SF. This doesn't matter too much though, especially because the space makes up for it. 

BUT I'm knocking off 2 stars for the awful Wifi.  This place should not say they have Wifi, given that it creates the wrong expectations.
author: Sophia D.

description: Great space, decent coffee. But if you need to grind on solo work vs. meet with someone or just signal how cool you are, there are places with much better WiFi connections.
author: Brett Robert K.

description: good food and coffee. very slow internet! If you guys planning to get things done make sure you can connect through your phone
author: Sasan N.

description:
Moving jobs from downtown SF to the border of Mission/Portero Hill means that my caffeine and lunch options are a bit diminished! However, I'm lucky that a Coffee Bar exists right down the street from my new job.

This is your typical modern SF cafe -- wooden/industrial interior with tons of outlets for people to work and study. They have lots of seating space in doors along with a small patio outside for when the weather is warm. I've come here for a sit-down lunch and it was easy to get a table for 2 people.

I've tried their ICED COFFEE and it is pretty strong! I will come back for their lattes and Vietnamese iced coffee. I also enjoy their bottles of FRESH JUICE -- I will return to get an OJ or grapefruit juice if I need a little extra Vitamin C boost.

For food, I enjoyed their TURKEY CLUB SANDWICH. The portions are huuuuge and I was definitely in a food coma afterward. The sandwiches come with a generous side of green salad with a tasty balsamic vinaigrette. 

The prices are a bit higher ($10+) for a typical lunch meal, but I feel that it's worth it for their fresh ingredients and big portions. I can see myself splurging on lunch here once a week. I will be back!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
This is my fave fave place to study! I'm a lover of high ceilings and wide open spaces and huge windows. and that type of environment (for me personally) is most fitting for studying/working. I can't do small cramp dim places. I know there are many more options but coffee bar is unique in its design and this place gets lots of sunshine. coffee isn't amazing but it doesn't suck either. Staff is overall friendly depending on who you get that day. food is pretty good but i stick to the avocado toast it's perfectly filling. and i can't give this place the full 5 because wifi gets real shitty during peak hours and i can't watch my course videos without pauses. but if you don't have to watch lengthy course videos then you're good! be sure to come before 11am to secure a spot :) and parking

update 10/21/17 their are new owners- while the space is as great as ever, service and food quality seems to have gone down. but some baristas are still quite friendly.
author: Reese A.

description: Helllla good! The Horchata and Vietnamese cold brews are A+++. Tasty and potent. The crew is super nice too.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Good spot for getting some work done. There's plenty of seating (inside and out on the patio) and plenty of outlets, but WiFi here isn't the most reliable. With everyone here on their laptops, it's not too unexpected to find the Internet dropping and lagging now and then.

Coffee, food and free Wifi is enough that I could stay there all day though.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Coffee and food are decent, but I definitely think they're overpriced. Especially for the neighborhood and the vast availability of other options. 
Service is also just okay, fairly quick but not very friendly. 
The WiFi is really spotty, the first time I came here it was great, but lately it seems to go out two or three times an hour!?
Plenty of seating though, so that's a plus, and a cute little outdoor area!
author: Morgan V.

description: Michelle waited on us today. Top notch waitress. So helpful. So friendly. Great service. Thanks, Michelle. You are the best!!!
author: Rose F.

description:
The words "coffee" and "bar" together instantly makes me perk up my ears...
Add good quality coffee, a decent selection of lunch food, and crafty pastries that are delicious-looking but pricey but delicious-looking...
Obligatory outlets, natural lighting, free unlimited wifi, large tables...
Plus the location in the cool kids part of SF i.e. the Mission...
And the fact that for once, street parking is fairly easy on weekends...

[TL;DR]

Coffee Bar is a haven for twentysomething San Franciscans because it's essentially the ideal cafe, including all the necessary amenities and radiating a cool hipster vibe.

[THE AMBIANCE]

By hipster, I do not mean the hipster fad of mason jars and pretentious service by snobby staff wearing thick glasses and plaid shirts; I mean the truly avant-garde type of hipster. The decor of the split-level interior design with bar seating, concrete accents, plants potted in branded mugs, and interesting wall of hanging candles is rather Instagram-worthy. 

The crowd mostly consists of people wired on coffee and intently wired on laptops, or people engaged in conversations that sound like start-up business deals. This is arguably my favorite study spot in the entire city because just by sitting here, you feel the brainpower and productivity exuding from everyone around you.

[THE DRANKS]

My go-to is the Vietnamese iced coffee ($4) because it supplies a walloping dose of caffeine. I also like how sippable it is: still delicious after the ice melts and dilutes the drink somewhat. 

I've had a taste of the vanilla latte (on point) and caramel latte (tastes like toffee candy)--the coffee is good quality and makes Starbucks taste artificial and gross in comparison.

[THE NOMS]

The almond toast bread (~$4) (it has some fancy Euro-sounding name which I forget) is a must-get if you are craving some dessert. It would have been much better if they could warm it up, but the pastry is soft, fluffy, and fresh (reminded us a lot of Taiwanese brick toast).

Lunch is pricey and not mind-blowing, but having a selection of real foood is better than being chronically sugar-high from pastries. The sandwiches (~$10) look nice but are not gigantic, so be warned if you are very hungry. The salads are rather gigantic and you can feel healthy while munching away on your mound of veggies. I've tried the Cobb and Napa ($12) which are tasty, though I would like for light dressing (especially on the Napa because it's very strong in acetic acid i.e. vinegar).

[THE VERDICT]

Coffee Bar... raising the bar.

You should expect to spend more money than your average cafe study session, as hipster usually entails $$; however, Coffee Bar is pricey but not overpriced.
author: Edna C.

description:
The first time I came here, years ago, I liked it. I had a very good cookie and felt like it was a nice place. Overtime though, I have ended up disliking it more and more, mostly because it feels like being in an office. 90% of the people here are on their laptops. It's not that I'm completely against that, or that I haven't been on my laptop in a coffee shop myself, but here it's just too much. 
They're supposed to have certain tables reserved for people without a laptop at lunch time, but nobody respects it and they don't enforce it, so if you are lucky enough to get a table, you'll be surrounded by no less than ten people working on laptops. 
Food is fine but a bit pricey, and the overall experience is just not that great. But hey, if you're looking for an office this may be great for you.
It has a gender neutral bathroom.
author: Marta F.

description: Great coffee, lousy service - waited for my order 10 min while the barista kept making drinks for people after me. When I said something I got a "oh well you'll be next". I wish I could give it more stars but this has happened before.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Great study spot with lots of seating! Love that it has two levels and and open airy feel to it. It's a bit on the pricey side, but if you're doing a full day of work there, it's very enjoyable.

It's fairly quiet and definitely a productive environment so you can actually get some work done. I got the viet coffee which was pretty good, I do wish it was a LITTLE stronger but it got the job done. 

*It's a pretty popular place it seems like, so it might be hard to snag a seat.
*Nearby parking wasn't difficult either, which is always a plus!
author: Amanda K.

description:
CUTE CAFE! 

They have pastries and good drink varieties. I got a peanut butter cornflake cookie, which had the right balance between sweet and savory/ saltiness. Mm... And my friend liked their ham and egg croissant. Their egg sandwich looked delicious, so I will try that next time.

Perfect place to relax on a sunny day. And also a good place to plunker down to do work. Outdoor sidewalk and patio seating, inside open loft seating, plants to keep things all natural, etc. I like that it's not too crowded, as it's not as centrally located in zee Mission. I will be back!
author: Joanna L.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon. The space is a great place to do work or read a book. There are plenty of plug outlets and the natural lighting is fantastic. The entrance door was open so there was a nice breeze going through. 

Most of the people here were busying on their Macs, so it was a nice study environment. The interior design feels open and modern. I love the couches - they are so comfy and have accompanying sofa squares to put your legs up on. I got a chocolate mocha. The mug was a nice touch, compared to the usual to-go paper/plastic.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Neat little place to hang out and do some work! Street parking around this place, you can't miss it from the street. It's also right across the street from a Starbucks (but Coffee Bar is always packed while Starbucks is not so much).

FREE WIFI here but good luck finding a seat if you arrive around lunch time! Great playlist here and good vibes. My boyfriend and I had some work to finish up over the weekend and came here with another friend of ours to work. Arrived around lunch and had to wait around a bit to grab a table. Ordered lunch and a couple drinks before we started working.

The sandwiches are HUGE and yummy! I almost couldn't finish mine (2 halves), but took my time to devour that baby. Probably stayed there for 3-4 hours and everyone is working too (or just meeting up with someone). There's both outdoor and indoor seating. Would def come back here again!
author: Wing L.

description:
Always a winner.

I love this spot and the bountiful love it has to offer.

Da pluses
+ OUTLETS GALORE
* table space (DO KEEP IN MIND THAT THEY HAVE A NO LAPTOP AREA DURING THE LUNCH hour 11:30-2 
* delectable GRUB
+ COFFEE of all kinds, syrups too 

WHAT I TASTED:

* Horchata Cold Brew - lip smacking delushious
* cappuccino - I'd sip dat again
* veggie burrito (PLUS A SIDE OF BACON) try it, you'll love me for it
* tuna melt - it is deliciously paired with a refreshing salad. Luvvvv
* vanilla custard muffin - interesting texture, flavor was there and not overly sweet!

This has been my 4th time to coffee
Bar and it's definitely not my last :)
author: Bern M.

description:
It is like Muscle Beach except its all laptop and very little muscle. Ok there is some muscle, but definitely more laptops.

If that's your thing and you've looking to show off your fifteen-inch Macbook Pro with some nicely placed stickers, well, this is the place to do it. The coffee and food offerings are all really tasty, I try to come in for a cappuccino when I am in the neighborhood. 

Really great multi-level floor plan, some outside patio areas, and well made coffee

Crowd: Hard to believe how many attractive people on laptops I saw this morning

Atmosphere: High ceilings and a cool lofted seating area, has this "I survived the dot com boom and still look good in the next one" style

Try: Espresso drinks and pastries are all great
author: Taylor S.

description: I have been in this neighborhood for 8 years and the Coffee Bar was one of my go to places. Past reviews are true, but today it is sadly not the same place anymore. The interior is tired and is in need of a revamp. The outdoor space used to be lovely with many nice plants and seating. It's now been overtaken by some weird pizza shed that's never in use. Now the outdoor space feels cramped. The food menu has also gone south. Limited choice and not very interesting. Staff appears despondent and unhappy resulting in below par service. I can only imagine the business has changed hands or the owner has given up. There are many far better choices in the neighborhood now only 2 blocks away.
author: Max B.

description:
Although this place is really big, it was pretty packed with people and their laptops on a sunny Saturday afternoon. The interior of this place is really nice. Wooden tables and nice lights.

I ordered the Vietnamese ice coffee. I felt that they added a good amount of condensed milk without making the coffee too sweet. My friend ordered the same thing and she really liked it as well.

There is a free WiFi here which makes it a perfect place to get some work done. The only thing about their wifi is that they kick you off about every hour and you have to reaccept their conditions. This is not a problem, but it took me a while to figure out why my internet stopped working.

Great place, I'll be back!
author: Lydia H.

description:
Very hip feeling. Lofty. Spacious to a certain extent, because it gets super busy here. The coffee and pastries are really delicious and admirable in the sense they are big and hearty and do things to my black soul. 

You'd fit in here if you had a MacBook Pro with advanced photo editing software, with thick rimmed glasses and expensive shirts. I love it here. I wish I could go back more often. I wish they had more locations.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Used to love this place as my go to for working with the amazing layout. That's still great, but the internet is now painfully slow even with not many folks, the coffee quality is not great anymore and the staff is sometimes amazingly friendly, and others won't even say a word. It's certainly a bit disappointing.
author: Callie R.

description:
Checked this place out on the way to Mission Cliffs - it was pretty empty pre-9 AM and had great quiet outdoor seating. I got the Vietnamese iced coffee and a chicken chorizo breakfast burrito. The iced coffee wasn't too sweet and the burrito was gigantic (easily shared by two). Also, checked out the cornflake cookie which was perfection. 
Bf got the horchata iced coffee, which was good for the first half and then just got to be too rich/much. He also got the breakfast sandwich - the sourdough english muffin was delicious and the eggs were super fluffy. Will definitely be returning.
author: Tanya M.

description:
Havana's Latte is so perfect for me because I love a good caffeine kick + sweetness. Sometimes raw sugar packets or honey just doesn't do it for me, but the rich condensed milk is so major with each sip!

I also have tried the Vanilla Latte (rich flavor with vanilla beans) and hot Vietnamese coffee (good way to stay awake).

I couldn't turn down the avocado toast - scrumptious! Super simple dish w/ a bomb spicy mayo and sesame seed coaxing the wheat-seed bread w/ beautifully sliced avocado. 

Great place to study w/ free wifi (pretty good but gets spotty if it's really busy). I like this location because there is parking and also a Starbucks close by if you need secure wifi.
author: Olivia L.

description: I love working remotely from this cafe but the food has gone downhill. Last week's granola, fruit and yogurt was disappointingly tiny. $2 extra for a few measly strawberries?!?! And twice in the last month I ordered the niscoise salad, only to feel nauseous afterwards. The tuna didn't taste very fresh, the salad was quite overdressed and I was told it wasn't possible to make it without green onions. Also, I can't eat egg so asked to have it replaced by extra veggies, maybe even some avocado or beets. I was told no every time. Doesn't seem very customer-friendly.
author: Erin W.

description: This place was pretty good. I loved the Tuna Melt, but the drinks were ok.
author: Isabel G.

description:
Although I've only been here couple of times, I think the original location of Coffee Bar is a really cool spot.  If I lived in the area or worked nearby, I'd probably make this my go-to coffee house.  They have a nice outdoor patio but I think this is one spot where the interior is nicer than the patio.  From the inside you can't see it, but there's an upper level has big open space with plenty of tables.  The communal tables overlook the cafe and actually make for great people watching.  

I haven't had anything from their food menu but the coffee is good here.  All I've had fro here is their Vietnamese Iced Coffee which is their 24-hour cold brew with condensed milk.  It's really tasty!  I hope to come back to try their famous Havana Latte though since I hear it's really good.

I haven't had any of their food yet, but their breakfast and lunch menus both look really promising.  The breakfast menu ranges from breakfast burritos, bagels, toasts, and Eggs Benedict and the lunch menu consists of large selection of sandwiches and salads.
