Coffee Bar does get pretty crowded during the brunch hours on weekends, but with both inside and the patio being pretty spacious, it shouldn't take long for a table to open up.
 
Overall, Coffee Bar is an awesome cafe.  It's perfect for a weekend brunch, and a great spot for working and study groups.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Great study place, with good ambient noise (coffee grinding, some conversations, and mellow music) and fast free wifi. You just need to know what places to sit. That aren't restricted to computer access. I sat at the bar counters at the top of the stairs, which have no restrictions. Only problem is if you get here at a busy time, good luck finding a seat. People tend to plant themselves here so sometimes waiting for a seat is harder than you think. 

Had the light roast drip and an apricot ginger scone - hit the spot. I'll try the breakfast sandwiches next time, which looked legit.
author: Anita H.

description: I really love Coffee Bar, but they need to crack down on the laptop crew. Every time I come here it is a sea of laptops. People sit for hours here on their laptops, and there is hardly seating for customers who are trying to have a meal, or coffee here with a group. I would like to see Coffee Bar make a huge effort to move people out, that are buying one cup of coffee and spending the day there. It discourages me from coming, because there is never anywhere to sit.
author: Erin J.

description: Very disappointed I drove out of my way here considering there was 40 minutes left and exactly what I didn't want to see was that they were closed this is horrible business on their part I hope that in there very busy time in their lives they could take maybe just a couple of minutes to revise when they're open and closed on the side I'll take my money elsewhere will not try again.....
author: Ismael P.

description: ARE YOU KIDDING ME? You want me to stand in a long line and pay top dollar for your overpriced food, and you have 1 employee on staff? Get more help, people need to get to work and not hang out at some stuffy cafe. Food and coffee and fast service. Not all of us have the leisure of hanging out on the internet in some music infested cafe.
author: Aj C.

description:
I've been in this cafe for hours - I honestly don't remember being outside today, that is how long I've been here. I'm actually writing this review inside Coffee Bar, on the grey comfy couch by the wall. Tragic, wonderfully tragic. 

I had a snack here. Professed my love for the girl next to me here. Edited a website. Sent some emails. Read 10+ articles and think pieces. Decided to sell some mugs on Amazon. Planned impromptu date with the girl next to me. Grabbed an iced coffee from downstairs. Refreshed my computer. The list really goes on. 

This cafe is dangerously perfect. I honestly am too damn comfortable and dreading the inevitable hour when I will have to leave. Wifi - no password and very strong. Outlets in some corners near the couches, great snacks and food at reasonable cafe prices, hints of natural light mixed with low indoor lighting fixtures. Jammin playlist of tunes that make you go 'hmmm, dope' instead of 'dang, that's annoying'. I'm going to try my best to frequent this place before it gets out of hand and I have to consider actually finding a better cafe in the east bay. Kudos, Coffee bar, you've won my heart.
author: Morgen B.

description: Overpriced, pretentious hipster hovel. I admit the espresso is good but at $3 a pop it better be. Music was chill BUT wi-fi was shitty with download speed of 1.3 mb/sec and it cut out at least 8 times in the hour I was there.  The nearby sbux is actually better.
author: Baba D.

description: Coffee Bar has an amazing location with a great setup, it's a shame it's wasted on coffee from Mr Espresso and a mediocre espresso machine. My drink was well made, so it's clear that the barista knows what they are doing, but the quality of their tools just isn't there. I'm sure some of their flavored drinks would be pretty solid, but if you're looking to taste some straight up espresso Coffee Bar isn't really the place.
author: Geoff G.

description: Cute hole in the wall coffee shop! There is a nice upstairs loft area (and it's huge!) with tables and chairs for working, but it can get pretty warm and stuffy if it's a warm city day. I went on a Saturday afternoon and it was pretty packed. Coffee was good - though nothing out of the ordinary. Good vibes here!
author: Emily M.

description:
My boyfriend has been raving about Coffee Bar for so long, but it was closed every time we tried coming here on a weekend. FINALLY, I was able to experience its glory on a random Monday afternoon and was lucky to find a seat open on the upstairs barstool area. 

Walking through the outdoor patio seating already sets the tone for how cool this place is. Once you enter Coffee Bar, there is so much to visually absorb... the delicious pastries in the window, the beautiful light fixtures around the cafe, and of course the massive amounts of seating everywhere. Though there was wine and beer available, I ordered an iced coffee with a raspberry and herb scone then found a place to sit upstairs. The staff is super friendly. There are plenty of outlets (though the one next to me did not work) and free and fast WiFi. 

The vibe here is great. Everyone seems to be focused on their laptop and working hard to get SOMETHING done. But they could be playing games for all I cared... they motivated me to concentrate on all my tasks at hand. As Coffee Bar neared closing time, I wish they turned on the lights or opened the curtains... it got dark super fast which made me want to peace out.

Nevertheless, I will be coming here more often. Certain seating areas are blocked off during lunch time for laptop use, so keep that in mind and get here early then camp out all day.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Definitely worth the walk from my office from start to finish I was overall super impressed by everything the coffee bar was about. Location is choice! Tucked away in a nicely put together location in the Potrero district, ample parking, and the smell of freshly baked bread filling the atmosphere right across the street. 
Need I say more? Of course! 
Entry has a nice little patio are for folks that want that little fresh air and sun for those days in the office; a beautiful coffee bar just steps way from the main doors. With not only great coffee, and tasty lunch items, service was superb. The barista that helped me was Anthony, greeted upon entry, charismatic and knowledgeable about his craft; made a great Red Eye for me since I literally was about to doze off to snoozeville. The Venue: love it! Simple, local portraits on the walls, nice up beat vibes, and overall great location for that study time or catching up with friends over a nice cup of joe. 
Definitely will be back! I have my eye on that ham and cheese croissant that had stared me down right when I got to the register! Thanks again Anthony! Keep up the great work
author: Brittany B.

description:
This place is exactly what you'd expect in SF. The coffee bar has craft coffee as well as craft beers, and many pastries / lunch options as well. You enter through the outside seating and into and beautifully decorated 2 level building with lots of seating and outlets available. The main level is where you order, and the seating is all on the second level. Views are delightful as you can look down on the main shop and through the big panel glass. 

We ordered the nitro cold brew / vanilla bean latte / vanilla canneli. All were exceptional. The prices are fair and the service is fast. Good place to enjoy coffee/ food/ or beer, work or enjoy music, or even mingle with a group as they have large tables.
author: Nicholas M.

description: This is horrible I'm visiting from Los Angeles and on the way home I just really wanted to grab some of their Horchata iced coffee. but I guess I won't since they decided to close a whole hour before the registered time online that's bad business! if you plan on closing a whole hour before hand maybe you should adjust the time online. if the workers are too lazy to stay the full time to stay open. I guess I'll be going somewhere else.
author: Natasha R.

description: Coffee bar is marked in the "Mission", but it's not really where I expected.  Regardless, it's still a good coffee shop.  There is a lot of seating and WFH space, and the decor is uber cute.  The horchata latte (asked for it not too sweet) was good too.  Will visit again!
author: Lyn C.

description: Went here after I saw some good reviews, I liked the interior decoration and the vibe it gave off. A friendly environment that welcomes anyone and everyone! Limited seating although I came at a busy hour. Great place to get work done and of course amazing coffee
author: Charlotte M.

description:
When they are good they are good, with nice fresh juice, good coffee, etc; When they are bad they are bad. 
Stay away from the food unless you are extra patient, forgiving and are nonsense tolerant.
Today our co-owner picked Coffee Bar for her birthday lunch and treated the staff. Upon ordering take out by phone with (apparently outdated) ONLINE menu, we were told "menu changed" and Kalifornia salad 'no longer had chicken' so we asked for tofu and in the end they said they had chicken from another menu item, and could put some on. Great. Birthday meal, 4 people complaining about the chickenless salad - boss complained that it cost $12 each w/out chicken. (Previous salad was $13). We called and complained and they offered chicken so someone went to get it. He asked for new menu for our lunch notebook, and they said they didn't have one so he took a photo of their posted one. Fast forward towards end of lunch, a couple  of us mentioned that our Turkey Club would have tasted much better with bacon. LOOK at photo of new menu and bacon IS listed, pretty essential to a Club sandwich no? So when I called and said that 'another 2 of the birthday lunch' were shorted, this time on bacon, the guy simply says "we haven't had bacon in 3 days". hmmmmmm. Can't go buy any at Gus's, down the street? Or at Safeway, also nearby? WTF?!?!?!? In a past incident they gave me the wrong sandwich and when I called they refused to offer a credit, and said I had to come in right away - but I had already walked all the way from work and all the way back to work, using half of my lunch time, so I didn't want to do this. Our staff has had other issues there as well. Quoting a one star review I read today, "we can't make you a sandwich because we ran out of bread"...
author: Alex S.

description:
In a city with arguably more coffee shops than people, it's hard to find one that you can truly rank up with the best of them. 

And coffee bar makes it. 

The ambiance, first off, is hands down incredible. Cool, decor, plentiful indoor and outdoor seating, and situated in a much less-traveled area provides for a very calm day at the cafe. 

The lattes are great, but the kicker was actually the food. The sandwiches are all super fresh and feel clean (great if you're trying to be a bit healthier this year ;) a black coffee and avocado toast? YUM). As mentioned my favorite thing here is the avocado toast, but any of the sandwiches are hard to pass up

The neighborhood is also cute to walk around with some nearby gems as well
author: Jay P.

description: Sweet, friendly service! Today I came in for their delicious vanilla latte with homemade syrup. I got it decaf with almond milk because I'm pregnant but still needing my coffee. The barista, Melissa, made it super tasty and on top of that was so nice to me. A mom herself, she had a few encouraging words for me, a first time mom, and took notice of me beyond just being a customer. It's excellent, human connection based service like this that is getting harder and harder to find in the Bay- especially in coffee shops.
author: GiuGiu B.

description:
First time Coffee Bar has failed me was today. 

Ordered the *amazing* Cobb Salad online ahead of time, only to show up and it (1) wasn't ready and (2) they didn't even see the order in their system, even though my bank account showed I had paid for it.

I gladly waited around because the salad is just that good, then TRAGICALLY found out once getting back to work that there was no bacon. 

No. Bacon. Life over!!!!!!!!!!

But seriously, I'm so sad about my experience today. All hope is lost.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Saturday, 2:30 PM.

Quickie:
+ Drink/Food quality
+ Service
* Hygiene
- Lagging wi-fi
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
+ Layout

And then...?
If you can find a seat, Coffee Bar is good place to get work done.
author: Chuck N.

description:
This is my go-to SF cafe when I want to bunker down with a laptop and get some work done. There are a few outdoor seats, quite a bit of indoor seating, plenty of outlets, good natural lighting and a strong wifi signal. Parking is very easy, which is crucial for my work-cafe selection. I've never been able to get one of the counter seats on the second level, but there has always been room at the large communal tables.

While the baristas are friendly, dirty dishes are left on the table FOREVER. There are tubs so people should be bussing their own tables, but rude ass customers here don't bother and the employees don't either. The restroom line always takes FOREVER, to the point that I always wonder if there's some secret cocaine stash in there, because I have stood in a restroom line at least a dozen times now, and each time it's always ONE person who's in there for about 8 minutes, yet there is no after poop smell.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I still rate Coffee Bar a solid 3 stars. Stopped in today for a late lunch - 3:30pm. Service is still friendly and I ordered the mushroom melt. It included swiss cheese, spinach, & garlic aioli on rye bread. It came with a lightly dressed side salad with carrot shavings and cherry (or grape) tomatoes. It was a good sandwich - TONS of mushrooms, nice and warm, and very flavorful. It felt reasonably priced at $9. 

Two things were not optimum for me. The first was the bathroom - it really needs a refresh. The whole thing just felt grimy.....including the hot air hand dryer....which was either simply streaked with some indiscernible dirt, or stained that way. Either way....ewwww. 

The second was the atmosphere this time. Last time I just had a beer and was taking it all in so maybe that's why the "university library" atmosphere didn't bother me. This time it just felt clinical and cold. With every single person's head in their computer, and no interaction happening between humans, it really was interesting to see how it effects the overall environmental feel. Chilling.

I guess the one thing I still need to rate Coffee Bar on is their coffee. Looks like I'll need another visit for that :-)
author: Laurie H.

description:
Whether you're studying, catching up with a friend, or just stopping by for a quick caffeine-fix, Coffee Bar is the perfect escape away from the hustle and bustle of the city. 

The cafe resides in an industrial neighborhood and the interior appropriately combines that raw warehouse-type edge with the coziness of a hipster studio apartment. There's plenty of tables and seats, but it can get really busy at times, so you end up being limited to single bar seating, or a tight spot at one of the communal tables. If you're lucky though, you can snag a coveted spot on one of the comfy couches.

The drinks are amazing, the pastries are fresh, and the sandwiches boast fresh and unique ingredient combinations. I will admit though, many of the food items are a bit pricey. I absolutely love the Vanilla Bean, Caramel, and Havana Lattes here. They're not only delicious, well-portioned, and intense in flavor, but finished with beautiful latte art. If there's one drink that I would skip on the menu though, it's the Vietnamese Iced Coffee. I don't know if the barista was having an off day or what, but when I tried it, it was very bland and lacked that rich and creamy consistency that it's supposed to have from the condensed milk.

White walls strung with icicle lights and an inviting outdoor patio add some additional character to the bright open space. Fast and free wifi and plentiful parking on the weekends. Coffee Bar is a great find and easily one of my favorite cafes!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
We were looking for a coffee place in the inner mission neighborhood, when we came across this one. The reviews looked good so we decided to give it a try.  
You enter the place and its perfectly represents the neighborhood vibe. Very hip and contemporary with high ceiling and lots of open space. It has a ton of seating, most of it is communal style yet we did not find a single spot to sit. It was completely packed. They have free wifi.
For our order, we had the havana latte, which is a twist on the regular latte with condensed milk added to it. Very unique and good, but it can get a bit filling. I would definitely go back to this place to try out their other coffee creations.
author: Varun A.

description: Horrible customer service. I stopped here to have a mocha and to take a seat to chill out after a long day of walking. This business posted their closing time was at 5pm however when I joined my boyfriend at our table AT 4PM we were told that they were closing that specific section of the shop where we were sitting so she could start cleaning tables?!? I'm sorry but asking paying customers to move to another section of your store when all of the other seats were occupied is ridiculous. I have visited a lot of coffee shops during my trips to San Francisco and I will never be stopping back here again.
author: Kristin B.

description:
Before we proceed, I should say that Coffee Bar is actually my favorite coffee roaster in San Francisco. And we know there are many. Coffee Bar, to me, is the best. So there's that.

Next thing: back when I was a student, I occasionally used to stop by this location to study or job search. When you walk in, you're immediately drawn in to scanning the elevated, expansive seating area surrounding the ground-level register area. Almost everyone, sitting side by side in neat little rows, is on their laptop. 99% of those laptops were Macs. I had a PC. So in that grand sea of shiny white and silver Apples, I always felt a little dweeby with my black Dell Inspiron. But whatever, that's just kind of a silly story I associate with this place. And I think more recently the ratio has become a bit more balanced (maybe around 70% Mac, 30% PC?), so it's even less of a deal now than it might have been before.

The vibe is very fitting for the micro-neighborhood, i.e. the Outer Mission of the Inner Mission (aka something I just made up): hipsters and their artsy snobbery meet techies and their industrial minimalism. The result is the subtly affluent, but always cool, calm and collected caffeine buzz that binds much of the crowd in this nook of the city. It's a site to be scene (see what I did there?). And for those of us who still don't quite fit in, taking the coffee beans home is always a solid option.
author: Kate V.

description: Coffee is fine.  Insufficient restroom and the clientele don't offer preggos to the head of the line.  Monsters.  I regret my purchase.   Starbucks would have been better.
author: Kayla S.

description: I love the vietnamese iced coffee and the horchata cold brew. The horchata a little bit more. This cafe is huge, but gets crowded for good reason. There's two levels: the ground level for ordering and steps leading upstairs with nice wooden tables and tons of outlets. If I lived closer, it'd definitely be my go to cafe.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Came here for lunch during the recent open studios art walk in the Mission. Coffee Bar has carved out a little piece of a very industrial neighborhood and created an oasis. Outside is a small patio with lots of plants and sun that makes you forget your surroundings. The small metal tables and chairs are not particularly comfortable or easy to sit at so I was surprised to see so many people on laptops looking camped out. There are umbrellas at some of the tables if it gets too bright.

Inside is a fairly large loft with lots of seating in a typical coffee shop atmosphere. It was a nice day so we chose to sit outside. As soon as you wind up the wheelchair-friendly ramp and into the restaurant, you're in line. The entry way is fairly small and I can see this getting crowded really quickly. We must have come after the rush because they were out of forks, out of glasses and were kind of scrambling. So it's an order at the counter kind of deal with a big written out menu on the wall. The prices are very reasonable and the food is good and the coffee even better.

I got a turkey club for $10.50 and a coffee for $2. I'm not sure if there were refills for the coffee as I didn't ask but the cup is not very big. You put your number on the table and they bring your food out to you. It came fairly quickly. The waitstaff was nice and efficient but not overly so. I got a small to go box by getting the attention of someone behind the counter but it took a while. Overall, this is a bohemian do-it-yourself type of experience with good food and a stay-as-long-as-you-like feel.
author: Angelique L.

description:
This place is fantastic! I love coming here to drink coffee, eat, read, work, hangout, or all of the above. The interior is spacious with high ceilings, a lofted seating area, and lots of light.  It's also off the main road so it's less crowded and less hectic. 

Tip #1: Coffee Bar is very much a working-cafe. Most people here are busy with their computers or books (and they have STANDING DESKS!), but it can still get a little loud. It can also get crowded, but I've never had trouble finding a seat before. There are limited outlets along the walls, and the wifi is spotty but functional (which is better than most places in SF). 

Tip #2: Cold brew coffee? Delicious. Food? Delicious. But the food and bevs will set you back a good $15-20... This place is pricy!

Tip #3: There's space for bike locks right outside of the cafe. 

Overall: This is hands-down one of my favorite work cafes in SF. Actually, one of my favorite cafes overall in SF. 100% would recommend Coffee Bar!
author: Sarah W.

description: This place is useless. I came here expecting to be able to get a few hours of work done and wound up incredibly frustrated. The internet is horrendously slow and most of my applications wouldn't load. It's overcrowded and super noisy. Hard to find a place to plug in a power cord and you're practically sitting on top of other people at each table. I don't know why they advertise food since their grab and go fridge was completely empty and they couldn't make any of the sandwiches on their menu because they were OUT OF BREAD (!?) Their staff is very friendly but moves at turtle speed. Somehow it took 20 minutes to move through a line of 5 people and 50 minutes to make a salad.
author: Meg H.

description: Absolutely delicious! Egg sandwich and vanilla bean latte. Excellent price! Beautiful scenery! Nice environment. Nice staff!
author: Stacy C.

description: This location is a little off the beaten path, but it's well worth it! They have a good amount of seating, but it can still be difficult to find a space sometimes. The coffee drinks are excellent. For a change of pace, check out their Havana Latte!
author: Ed M.

description: Go to coffee shop to do some light computer work and good eats. Had their avocado toast with hard boiled egg on top . Their coffee is strong but much needed when working. Parking can be hard but walkable from muni on 16th st.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Such a great spot off the beaten track. 

Outside lounge area, upstairs seating, ground floor counter.

Get your Mr. Espresso coffee (San Francisco roasting!), grab a sandwich (hot/cold), and squeeze in between the many MacBooks. This place used to be the delivery part of an old warehouse, and it has been redesigned very creatively.

My favorite is the Iced Vietnamese Coffee - caffeine buzz on the sweet side.

Spacious cafe, great vibe. Who needs that Starbucks across the street?
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I really love The Coffee Bar - the Havanna Latte (espresso and condensed milk latte) and their Bhakti Chai are one of my favorite coffee combinations in San Francisco. And of course because they use Califia Almond Milk. I ask for my Havanna extra light in the condensed milk. 

This location differs from the Fidi one in the menu they offer (Pattisserie Phillippe pastries, cold brews, fresh juices, some breakfast items, a few sandwiches and prepackaged salads). Also the cafe is much bigger and includes cute outdoor seating. Wifi is free and fast. 

Overall, this is my favorite Coffee Bar location.
author: Jess C.

description: Used to be a cool place with a great staff: nowadays it looks like a ship without any captain...the service is whatever and changing all the time....no more wine options, no more great evenings events either....where did the soul of this place went?
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Currently finishing the other half of my veggie burrito from Coffee Bar. 

This is a cute and cozy spot in the industrial part of Mission with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Upstairs contains a variety of seating options (communal tables, long bar, standing station tables) with outlets available. The music is soothing with some familiar jams playing at an enjoyable volume level. Bathrooms available (awesome BART poster in there). 

I ordered the soy chai latte which was perfectly spiced and didn't contain an excess amount of foam. I had a taste of my friend's almond croissant which was buttery, flakey, and had a very strong almond flavor. Yum (if you like almonds, of course)! The veggie burrito was the star of the show for me - sweet potatoes, black beans, scrambled eggs, onions, avocado, and white cheddar cheese wrapped in a red (unflavored) burrito. I am a newb to the vegetarian lifestyle and I am happy to know that I can hit up Coffee Bar for a delicious option. Oh, and they have Tapatio. Winner. 

Four stars because they accidentally served me the chicken chorizo breakfast burrito. Regardless, I'll be back to Coffee Bar to try out more of their beverages and foodstuffs.
author: Alexandria T.

description: cookies are good staff is friendly most of all good Vietnamese Cold brew coffee is my go to here!
author: Jay A.

description:
Beautiful space with plenty of natural light, tables for working, and outlets! Coffee Bar is always an ideal spot to watch various crowds of people typing away vigorously on their MacBooks. It's a bit amusing and intriguing at the same time, but it pretty much sums up the Bay Area in a nut shell. As for the drinks, the coffee here is great! There's nothing like sipping on some Iced Coffee while sitting outside in the warm afternoon sun. You can satisfy your caffeine and snack cravings with Coffee Bar's great selection in both drinks and food.

Whether you're here to meet with a friend, grab a quick bite, or get some work done, Coffee Bar is always a great place to grab some coffee and relax. With friendly staff and plenty of available seating, there isn't much to complain about!
author: Aaron W.

description: Such a cool/chill little spot! They have a great, sunny, relaxing outside area or a modern inside to hang out in. Got the cold brew ice, and you can add your own fixings, even with almond milk. Tasted great! Also got the avocado toast, which was delicious I would definitely recommend stopping in and PASSING by the Starbucks at the end of the road. So worth it!
author: christina m.

description:
Update: New guy Anthony. Soooo nice. Keep him. Raising this one star!


I come here a lot like once a week. There's a lot to like. The atmosphere is great; the food is great. I've been holding off writing this review for a while. The big problem I'm having is that they can be so damn unfriendly. This happens not all the time and it's not everyone. Some folks are really actually nice. The people who bring the food are always sweet. But cashiers often can't even squeeze out a thank you for a $20 breakfast. 

Oh and if you're lucky enough to be here when the owner is here you're in for a special treat. He's very good at approaching customers and telling them off. I've seen him chastise people for bringing in outside food, which I get. But I've  also seen him chew out  a very young  boy for leaving his bike with training wheels in the wrong place. In every place I've ever worked the culture trickles down from the top. Is that what's happening here? I'll bet they wonder why the tips aren't better.
author: Mark M.

description: San Francisco's premier location for laptop friendly coffee shops.
author: Henry L.

description: Coffee is just ok. The service is slow and confusing, the attendant forgot what we ordered and sold things from the menu that were already sold out, so we had to make a new order all over again.
author: Debora R.

description: Great coffee, atmosphere and food! I love there vegetarian breakfast burritos and specialty coffee drinks. Two thumbs up
author: Anton A.

description: I really wanted to give this place four stars, but they have some issues with service. Came in before a BAVC class and had a good 45 minutes to kill before I had to be there. Ordered an iced tea and avocado toast thinking I had plenty of time to enjoy it. Unfortunately my food order got lost in the shuffle somewhere, and by the time I got it I had already finished my iced tea and had to rush to eat because I was going to be late. There's nothing worse than watching other people who ordered way after you did get their food first and having to ask someone about yours. The avocado toast itself was OK but had the opportunity to be really good. Bread wasn't toasted enough in my opinion and the portions seemed small. Chipotle aioli and sesame seeds created a good flavor combination that would have been even better with that extra crunch. Iced tea was perfect but would've been even better if I could've actually drank it with my toast. I'd definitely give this place a second chance but I left my first experience feeling a little underwhelmed.
author: Alie C.

description: Perfect spot to come do some work and grab a bite to eat!
author: Lindsay L.

description: I enjoy catching up on work here during the week, as there is plenty of seating and when it's nice outside, there are some extra tables. A lot of designers / people in tech like to flock here. Coffee is good, but a tab overpriced. However, if you get here past 11am on Saturday/Sunday - it's unlikely you'll find a seat unless you are willing to loom over other customers awkwardly, waiting until someone gives up their seat.
author: Jabari G.

description:
Only a 4 because I didn't have an espresso or coffee or food (grabbed a juice for my meeting) ...at the point in which I do, and if it's solidly good, the rating will bump to a 5. 

Great location, far enough away from rackety Valencia, the interior design is filled with wood yet modern flare, two levels with couches and small and large tables. Free wi-fi, folks sharing a meal, studying, chatting, it's social yet not noisy, welcoming and stylish. 

Impressed. Can't wait to go back. Bummed you're so far away. 

-See yah soon, from Haight Street
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Great indoor space with high ceiling and big windows to keep an eye on the outside world while you do work or just sip on coffee. 

Came because this place was listed as the number one cafe to work from by thrillest. Was not disappointed by my joinery. 

Tried their dark chocolate mocha and the mushroom melt. Veggie burger also comes highly recommended. Super friendly staff, good music, and of course...

Outdoor seating score: 4
Patio seating for the sunbathers!
author: E F.

description:
Coffee bar is ALMOST perfect. I love everything about it except the fact that they have NO AC... it's not a concern normally but the first time I was here it was wayyy too hot to concentrate on work. I came here base on a friend's recommendation. I wanted to get some work done so I was looking for a place with stable wifi, good coffee, and food options if I get hungry (their Caesar salad is pretty good).

I really like the ambiance at coffee bar. High ceiling and everyone seems to be focused on their work so that's kind of motivating. Their horchata cold brew is addicting... SO SO GOOD! I tried their vanilla latte the second time I was there too. I was sold when they mentioned it was a homemade vanilla syrup. You can really see the little black vanilla beans but the latte was kind of too sweet for my taste - would ask for less syrup next time but the taste was really good!
author: Crystal W.

description:
What a cool place with impossible parking. I don't mind the drive here or even waiting in line. It's the parking that'll make you crazy. Expect to park at least a block away unless it's your lucky day.

Can bitterness be so smooth? For sure if you're ordering the Vietnamese iced coffee. I loved it. For something sweeter try the Havana latte, which is also made with condensed milk but is a bit creamier. Both were fresh, rich and delicious.

The line moves fast and there's plenty of seating inside and out. Avoid the free wifi laptop mob and sit outside.
author: Lloyd B.

description: Yes! I love that this is changing the neighborhood. The food was a-okay, and I'd eat here if I were already here for the coffee/patio/space/neighborhood and happened to be hungry. Nothing to write home about, but the ambiance makes it a pleasant experience nonetheless and willing to overlook perfect okay food.
author: Victoria C.

description:
I really do like coffee bar - I use it as a temporary office while I search for other jobs. I just have one point of improvement: to the nice lady who sits behind the espresso machine:

Every time you yell (naw, shriek) "latte on the bar for Stephanie!!!!" or "Mushroom melt for Caitlin!!!!," it's alarming. Borderline, deafening -- to the people who rely on the wonderful working atmosphere you've built to conduct business. People will find their latte, and their mushroom melts - otherwise, they'll get cold, and no one wants a chilly version of either. Please, please, no need to scream - there's already enough barking outside your walls, on the streets of San Francisco. A normal conversational volume will get the job done just fine.
author: Adam B.

description: Comfy cafe with lots of seating and plugs. It was the perfect spot to catch up with a friend on a rainy day. The food and drinks were ready super quickly. I got the daily special, a mushroom melt sandwich, that came with a side salad and a friend got the SF salad. Both were pretty large portions and worth the bang for your buck. The bread for the sandwich was thick and had just the right amount of softness as you bite into it. Would come back to study or chill with a book!
author: Ali N.

description: This place doesn't try too hard. The space and decor is nice, but the drop coffee was old and bitter, my croissant was doughy and cake-y, and my tuna melt came out cold. When I returned it to the kitchen to ask them to heat it up, they said, "we don't melt the cheese". This is a tuna MELT we are talking about. $25 for all of this, including tip.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Vanilla bean latte is perfect - perfect vanilla flavor, perfect temperature, perfect thick, velvety foam

Avocado toast with egg is second only to Provender's

Good internet & works as a temporary office with free wifi, but hourly it kicks you off & makes you re-log in which gets supremely annoying after a few hours.  If you're coming to work for a while before/during lunch, beware the tables with signs on them, they're computer free 11a-2p.
author: Crystal W.

description:
This cafe is a great place to get some work done! Acoustics are great-- not too noisy considering that the place gets pretty busy.

I had the Vietnamese Cold Brew ($4.25) which has a nice bold flavor-- sweet from the condensed milk, of course!

Food is a bit pricey with their sandwiches and salads starting at around $10, but they do have some pre-made food (sandwiches: prosciutto was available today, yogurt, fruit cups) which starts at around $5.

There are laptop free tables during lunch hours but there are lots of seats available. It's a bit warm since there is no a/c, but the air circulation is supported by a few ceiling fans. 

FYI: it's on the side of 1890 Bryant St-- I'd say it's more on Mariposa.
author: Jellie S.

description: The reason I like this place is because it's the least pretentious coffee place I have found in the city. There is a good variety of coffee drinks in addition to tea and even wine! I got a cold brew, and I thought it was okay. It was a little too acidic for my liking, but I had a sip of a friend's tea which I did enjoy. There is plenty of seating, although it can get pretty crowded. If you are willing to wait a while though, then you will probably be able to find a seat.
author: Steph V.

description: Love the space. Received a mocha when I ordered a hot chocolate; I'm letting it slide, this time. The space is awesome, and I got a bunch of work done. I'll be back.
author: Ximena C.

description: 13 minutes for a cappuccino at 9am on Friday? You guys ought to be glad the lion did not roar. I was in a good mood. I would recommend that Coffee bar ad a barista during peak hours of breakfast and lunch. No wonder there was a bench to sit on inside. Were they roasting the beans upon order? I told my new work colleagues about my experience and they laughed at me. As in.. oh you didn't know? I will not be back.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Get their horchata iced latte. If you need a mid-day caffeine jolt, this is it. 

I could not think straight when I drank half a cup. I kept talking jibberish to my co-worker. This cup of goodness is so tasty. 

Next time, I will get their food for lunch.
author: Deborah C.

description:
The two stars are related to staff friendliness. 

It's always very cold in this coffeeshop because of a draft from the kitchen. I am a regular and have addressed the issue several times. It really helps if the front door is closed; makes a huge difference! However, the staff rarely does it because they say that they get warm downstairs. 

I understand the concern, but something minor like getting a fan for the bar area, would help patrons feel more comfortable. Every time I come in, everyone upstairs is wearing winter coats and scarves. 

It's very unfortunately because the set-up is otherwise great for doing work and the food is pretty good.
author: Riri S.

description:
Cute neighborhood coffee shop! Pretty good selection of coffee (I'm impressed with their lattes) and other simple bites like pastries and sandwiches. Free WIFI (though slow, so don't count on it). 

The space is large inside with a lot of seating (that does fill up quickly), and ton of windows and great lighting, with a nice warm industrial feel. (They most definitely need some fans, it's quite hot inside in the baking afternoon light.) There's also a small courtyard with plants and a handful of tables with plenty of cute dogs lounging with their owners.
author: Priya C.

description: It's a great spot to grab coffee and do a little work. It can get really busy at times and their internet can't hold up the busy crowds- but then again, it is a coffee "bar", not a cafe. Overall, it's a nice hip place to do work with an open and clean environment.
author: Ness J.

description: I have been a patron of Coffee Bar for five years as I work in the vicinity. Today I waited 30min for a sandwich and it was the nail in the coffin for me. To go orders that came in after mine were delivered before me. Over the years I have put up with lost orders, bugs in salad and rude customer service and always gave CB the benefit of the doubt. To be fair there have been some exceptionally great people working there too but as they are quality individuals they seem to leave. Speaking for myself and a fellow colleague, "Never again."
author: Alejandro M.

description:
This is the best place to have a havana latte and a delicious sandwich.  I myself had a breakfast burrito and it was hella filling.

Not only this, you can work forever here (with loads of space). However, I suggest to go there early -- I went at 8 AM in the morning on a Saturday. It didn't get packed until approximately 10:30 - 11:00 AM.
author: Joanne W.

description:
What a perfect study spot. After searching tirelessly for a place to camp out at with my laptop and headphones on a Saturday, Coffee bar came under my radar. Tucked a little ways out from the business of the heart of the Mission, it's located in the middle of a neighborhood, a sort of unexpected little gem. I got an iced tea, which was perfect for a sunny afternoon. 

Bustling (seems like a popular place), but at the same time a sort of sanctuary apart from the rest of the city. Gives off a vibe of openness in many respects.
author: Janice L.

description:
A solid place to get some coffee and get some work done. I'm actually motivated to do work by the fact that everyone around here is on their laptops getting work done.

PARKING? There's usually pretty easy to get street parking around the area, I usually just bite the bullet and pay the meter, but honestly you can probably find non-metered spots if you look hard enough.

COFFEE? This place actually is probably one of my actual favorite coffee places in the city based on their quality of coffee. Their coffee is all around good, but I actually like their Nitro, or nitrogen-infused coffee. It looks kind of like a beer, and tasted basically like a very lightly carbonated cup of coffee. Delicious.

MISSING STAR? The missing, much-coveted last star is not included in this review solely because of the fact that it is almost ALWAYS crowded and almost impossible to find a seat, and because it's incredibly hot and stuffy in there.  Regardless, I love working in there, as seen by my 4-star review, so go and give it a try! Just don't say I didn't warn you!
author: Andrew T.

description:
Second time coming to this coffee spot! Decent place to study with a constant white-noise level of commotion. It's always busy, with cutthroat seat hoarding and a sea of laptops in all direction, thanks to the free wi-fi.
The coffee is decent, considering all the other nearby coffeeshops nearby. Had a pretty bomb vanilla bean latte! The food (sandwiches and salads) are adequate but nothing to write home.
author: Tina K.

description: Great place to work and their kalifornia salad is in the words of a Californian "hella dope". Seriously why would this coffee shop have such a bomb ass kale salad!? Idk but keep doing what I you're doing. It is $13.50 pre tax but it is worth it. The upstairs has tons of room to sit and work. Be warned, they make you re-sign on to the internet every hour which is sort of annoying.
author: Sarah F.

description: Great place! Quiet location, plenty of room to settle in and relax inside or outside, cute decor, friendly service, nice healthy food choices as well as your standard sweets and bakery items , and the coffee was yummy! (A bit too sweet for my taste but next time I'll just request half sweetness!) Why go to a coffee chain when you can just come here for better quality ?
author: May F.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite coffee/tea houses! Parking is pretty easy to find. There's quite a lot of street parking and the good part is there's no meters! Yay! My sister & I came here before and we came back here for our Vanilla bean latte for my sister & Havana latte for myself. This place is a nice place to study, chat, and do whatever kinda place. They have FREE WIFI!! (I know everyone loves free wifi!!) The coffee shop has an indoor seating and outdoor seating. The workers are friendly and awesome. My havana latte was amaze-balls! I love the little designs they do on the latte's. It's always so pretty with their designs. 

Overall, this place is a MUST GO-TO coffee/tea house. If you never been here, I don't know what coffee/tea place you go to but this place is BOMB. I honestly rather have a cup of tea/coffee from here then Starbucks to be honest and I love starbucks.
author: Monica W.

description: Beautiful interior. Great workspace and environment. Friendly service. Just not a big fan of their coffee. I got a latte. The espresso was just okay. This might be just a personal preference, but it just tasted dry and almost chalky and flavorless. I've had some incredible lattes in the bay so my standard is pretty high. I don't feel like coffee bar is quite up to par with other coffee shops.
author: Lisa O.

description:
Havana latte
--This was amazing! It's a bit sweet for me, but it was so yummy that I didn't mind the extra sweetness. The coffee was moderately strong. A must try!
author: Katelyn P.

description: Tried this place out for the first time and it was a great coffee shop to work at. Wifi was perfect,  many outlets, plenty of places to sit on a Saturday and I enjoyed the food and drinks that I got. Mushroom Melt was delicious and the people who work here were helpful!
author: Michy J.

description:
This space is gorgeous and the hipster variety is so promising (they have this horchata cold brew that's crazy delicious and so SF!). The food is ok; inconsistent but sometimes great. Service is politely disinterested. 

But oh my god. It is so slow. There's a reason everyone who loves Coffee Bar is here to study or drink wine or soak in the vibe. If you're here to grab lunch and head out, prepare for a long, miserable and often baffling wait. Options are somewhat limited in this neighborhood so I end up here, but I've more than once blown most of a lunch break waiting for lunch. 

In fact, as I write this, I'm playing my non-favorite game: how long will I sit on this cold hard bench by the door waiting for a cup of soup, to go? As far as I know it just has to be scooped into a cup and have a lid put on it, right?

I'm at eight minutes and counting, and kicking myself for getting anything other than grab and go. Hey, on the plus side, at least they have grab and go. 

Update: the answer to the soup wait question is 12 minutes.
author: Molly W.

description:
great place for working. Only go there if you have a mac laptop, otherwise they wont let you in ;) 
Inside is usually full of people on their laptops working. The coffee is really good and they have some food items that are also good. There is an outdoor area which is nice if the weather allows.
author: Sal R.

description: Went in to grab a coffee and some breakfast to go and ended up waiting 12 min for a bagel.......with less than a dozen people in the store. Not a great first impression. Otherwise, the atmosphere was great. Always nice to have places with quite outdoor patio space.
author: Sabrina F.

description:
Every time I come here I feel like a poor pariah. But, it's close to the theater so it makes sense to come. They run out of ready made sandwiches hours before they close and their food is pretty expensive for what you get. It's always filled with tech bros. 

Today I accidentally cut someone, there are two lines and the lady to my right was waiting for the cashier on my right. But the cashier ahead of me said hello and motioned me forward. There were lots of bugged out eyes and stuff, but eventually I just ordered to make it all go away. 

I picked out a turkey sandwich from their pre-made selection it was labeled with a T. I got back to the car and it's actually salami, which isn't a problem for me but they should more carefully label their food. 

If you want something quickly that is also what you ordered just go to Starbucks across the street. 

Update: Why did I even bother.? Went again, and paid $11.00 for a chai and a chocolate croissant. When I ordered I told him I wanted a large, he then points to the cups and starts giving me OZ measurements. I then told him, the biggest one. He looked perplexed and then asks me another question. I cannot hear him over the fan and some incredibly loud mechanical noise. So I say sorry? And move in closer. He repeats at exactly the same volume and I have to ask him two more times to repeat himself because he just doesn't get louder. Man, If you would speak up people could hear you. Don't make me crane my neck behind the counter.
author: Devon L.

description: This coffee spot is the perfect place to go when you want to get some work done. The cafe itself is two stories and they have a couple of tables outside - perfect for people who want to bring their furry friends! On me visit i tried Marys Horchata which is a cold brew mixed with horchata. This drink was refreshing and def hit the spot! I also got a chocolate pumpkin scone which paired well with my coffee. The menu also isn't just beverages and pastries they have lunch items too! The servers are super friendly and are willing to recommend certain drinks depending on your mood. The only downside about this cafe is that it can get quite crammed because theres bench seating, table seating, couch seating, and high table top seating so it can get pretty squished and hot in there depending on the time that you come to the Coffee bar.  I know I'm definitely going to be back for their food items and another cup of marys horchata!
author: Samee M.

description:
I have a feeling I'll be dreaming about this Madagascar Vanilla Bean Latte for quite some time to come. Extremely sweet (just like I like) with tons of vanilla flavor and, I trust, enough caffeine to keep me going.

WiFi seems serviceable. The terms and conditions page (really? I'm talking about T&Cs?) is actually helpful and shows which areas of the shop are off limits to laptops during the lunch period (11:30-2:30).

Unfortunately, the construction noise from whatever business is next door is EXTREMELY LOUD. Since they leave the door open between the businesses (?!?) you better bring some heavy duty earphones, and not count on having a quiet conversation. Judging by the other reviews, maybe this is a temporary thing (review written March 2016) since others remark on how quiet it is. Sure wasn't quiet today...
author: Paul L.

description: The absolute best place for study and work and food and drink. Clean and hip but welcoming and communal. A pinnacle experience for sf nomadic workers
author: Henry L.

description:
Great location with ample amounts of energy plugs, space and awesome coffee! I've had the pleasure to visit all three locations in SF. 

This location is great to study, work or enjoy your coffee. I love their caramel latte!!! Their havana latte is highly raved about and their Vietnamese coffee isn't bad. Some days I go for their black coffee and love every experience. I love how every time I receive my coffee, I can always drink it without the hesitation that it'll be too hot for me. It's always at the right temperature and they even do their spin on latte art. This is by far my favorite coffee shop in SF!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Have always loved this place for working or meeting friends, but they now close at 4 pm?!?!?! Way too many places in SF close way too early (is this a real city or not?) but 4 pm seems especially ridiculous.
author: Geoffrey U.

description:
-Awesome staff
-Good seats and balcony seats
-Great wall windows
-yummy  coffee yuzu!
-outlets :)
author: Karen J.

description: This is my second bad review of coffee bar. After my last one several years ago, I thought I'd try it again & see if the service has gotten better. Sadly... for THEM! It's only gotten worse! Recap: I enter & there are 4 staffers working the counter & just 2 people in front of me. Seems like it's going to go off without a hitch, only I see 1 of the 3 talking on the phone now - assuming it's biz, so I'll give her that. The other ones manning the espresso machine & the 3rd is just sorta walking around scratching his head-literally  While the 4th is unloading baked goods. Meanwhile, customers are piling up. I'm ignored for a good 2 minutes while the chaos ensues, finally one staffer apologizes & said she'll be right with me. I tell her I want a croissant & a small coffee to go & she tells me they're just brewing TWO new pots of coffee, so they're out & it'll be a few more minutes to wait. WHO runs out of BOTH coffees at the same time, on a Sunday morning!!? So, the line is getting longer & the staff are visibly clueless about managing the mess or the coffee counter & I'm getting more frustrated the longer I wait. Just wait, it gets worse when the guy behind me has ordered & then HE gets HIS coffee before me! I'm standing right in front of the espresso machine, yet still overlooked for the guy behind me! I asked the staffer where's MY coffee & she apologizes for skipping me for the guy behind me first! This is why I'll never give Coffee Bad another chance. It's not too hard to monitor 2 coffee containers & realize you're getting near the end of one & to start brewing another, so that your customers aren't made to wait while two pots are brewing! And if you obviously mess up by serving others in front of another customer who was there first, COMP my order so I'll know you actually care about F----ING up! No three strikes with me & Coffee Bad, I'm done with this place!
author: hot t.

description: Please fix the hours on this Yelp page already. If you close at 400pm on Saturdays, your Yelp page should say 4pm not 5.  Your Bryant staff don.t understand that you control the content on your page, not Yelp.  This is an example of why the Starbucks across the street is always so busy.  PS - Your coffee is great.
author: Chris R.

description: We figured that since we're into going to Potrero for coffee that we'd stop off at Coffee Bar for breakfast on a Sunday.  I've been to the Coffee Bar location in the FiDi and thought that their latte was divine.  So, for the sake of consistency, I got one here, and it was just as delicious as the FiDi's location.  I loved all of the options for breakfast too! We split a breakfast burrito and you could definitely tell that there was nothing "pre-packed" about it.  All the ingredients were fresh, and the burrito itself was light with absolutely no grease trail coming out of it when you took a bite.  At the same time, I do think that Front Cafe and Piccino, from a coffee perspective, is significantly better.  This place is great if you're looking to hang out on the interwebz for a long time and wanting space around you to do it.
author: Lisa I.

description:
Stumbled upon Coffee Bar by accident. Lots of seating and natural light make it a great spot to get some work/studying done.

I ordered an iced vanilla latte and a chocolate chip cookie. The cookie was chewy on the inside, crunchy on the out. Delicious! 

As a side note I love the ambience here but I couldn't help but notice the large plant they have in the upper seating area. You'll see it- they're letting that poor plant wither away. Kind of an eye sore.
author: Amelia C.

description: Decent quality food and coffee for SF, but very overpriced and extraordinarily slow service. The drinks are poorly made, their "Havana Coffee" is in no way Cuban, and their "Vietnamese Coffee" is Thai.
author: Joshua L.

description:
This is my go-to place for lunch when I have class at BAVC. I've heard of the long waits, but that was never a problem for me - I always get togo. 

I think their salad is more on the expensive side even though they are quite tasty. I like their Melmac sandwich. Their cashier on my first visit recommended it to me otherwise I likely would've never ordered it. The sandwich is very generous in portion and it comes with a generous side salad too. You can substitute the side salad for a cup of their soup of the day for an additional $1. I also tried their Nutella bun. I think this would be best if slightly warm. It is extremely sweet.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I didn't know a coffee shop could be my new go-to sandwich spot.

I'm a cheap safeway sandwich guy 95% of the time and these sandwiches are pricey but bless my soul a bite from the last two sandwiches, let me tell you a thing:

You know that scene in ratatouille where he tells his chubby buddy how to taste the cracker and cheese then that symphony of colors goes on in the black backdrop? Yeah its like that. The roast beef sandwich had the right amount of red onion where the bitterness contributed to a pleasant experience. The salami sandwich has this dry, crumbly cheese similar to asiago that played so well with how tangy the salami was - then you notice a little bit of horseradish like finding out your best friend during last call at the bar.

Come here, leave happy (good drip coffee too).
author: Rey D.

description: Great place for a cup of coffee and a place to sit and enjoy ur tea time. the staff are very friendly and they serve amazing coffee and other drinks as well. I would recommend this place for anyone wants a cup of amazing coffee under a warm sunshine!!!!
author: Toshio T.

description: Extremely sad decision by Coffee Bar to eliminate their egg-based breakfast options.  I probably won't be coming here anymore.
author: Em P.

description:
Dare to be different and bring your windows laptop to Coffee Bar. 
Or better yet put Linux on it. I DARE YOU!!!

Joking aside, Coffee Bar serves delicious food and delicious drinks.
I stopped at the cafe to grab a lunch. I ordered arugula salad and cuban sandwich.
I loved that the salad dressing was made in the house. I can always tell a difference and always have a sweet spot for dressings made in the house. Cuban sandwich was fresh, good proportion of meat and cheese vs bread.
author: Lana S.

description: I am admittedly a bit of a pumpkin whore, but their pumpkin latte hits the spot. I love that they asked if my order was for here or to go, and served my "for here" order in a ceramic mug. I've read various accounts of there being plenty of seating, though things were still pretty busy when I visited on a Saturday afternoon after Thanksgiving; while it's bigger than several coffee shops, I'm not sure that it's a guaranteed seater kind of place. Love the bright, natural light though, and lots of counter spaces (with unrestricted wifi, versus the tables) for laptop warrior singletons.
author: J C.

description: Great outdoor seating option in warmer weather.... Cool laid back vibe inside, cozy local feeling. The Golden Gate espresso was delicious with Caramel finish. The veggie burrito hit the spot with the al dente sweet potatoes!
author: Daniel C.

description:
I've never been to a cafe where I didn't put in headphones. The music here is incredibly on point. Actually, everything is on point. Not just the music, but also the food, coffee, and overall ambience. The only thing that could be improved on is the wifi, but it wasn't a big deal.

I ordered a non-fat latte and the Avocado Toast. This came up to a little over $8. The avocado toast was two diamond cuts of bread with a delectable amount of avocado. They do not skimp. There must have been an entire avocado on there all together.

I look forward to coming back here all the time and trying the rest of their menu :)
author: Rachel L.

description:
Coffee Bar has clearly seen better days.  For the first couple of years it was setting the standard for coffee houses and was a great place to hang out -- now, not so much. 

The place is broken down, with furniture that looks filthy disgusting and "enhancements" that seem to be geared toward the owners, not the patrons -- the "out of place" shed that now takes over half the patio comes to mind. 

The food used to be a point of pride here -- inventive, well presented, and tasty -- it's average now and certainly not a differentiator.  The beer and wine selection was pretty interesting, especially for a coffee bar; it's pedestrian now.  The coffee remains the same, although they've had a revolving door of baristas in the past few years, so getting a good pour is a mixed bag. 

What happened?  I trace these changes to a new owner. Once one of the original owners sold, the new owner must have thought, "I'm not maximizing my profits."  Changes for the worse started, including a never-ending change of the staff and managers. Where once this place felt like a community, it now feels like any other business run by an owner who believes his mission is to maximize his profit rather than to create happy, loyal customers. 

I'll probably not return...well, at least not until the memory of how sad this place has become recedes and I want to stay in the neighborhood. But once again, I'm afraid, I'll see how far Coffee Bar has fallen in its years of regression to the mean of mediocrity.
author: Scott L.

description: This coffee bar was very good and I don't drink coffee often at all. This is a nice setting with terrific coffee options. I really enjoyed it here. Parking was difficult but I made it happen as well as I could. Enjoy!
author: Danny S.

description:
I walked into this place WANTING to like it. The cafe itself is cute with an elevated seating area as well as a small patio if you would like to sit outside, however the service here is slow and the workers have not been very pleasant while taking orders.

If you want to eat here for lunch on a work day you better set aside an hour plus for your meal. Even when calling ahead I've experienced wait times of more than 30 minutes. The food itself is relatively good. Prices are a little high, but not too crazy considering its San Francisco. Sandwiches and salads can run you around $10.

The only upside to coffee bar is that they do offer pre-made sandwiches and salads so that you can "grab and go" if you're in a hurry. Unfortunately there are still long lines and less than cheerful order takers that you need to go through first so if you're truly in a hurry I'd suggest ordering take out from another place.

As for coffee and treats I have been appalled to find bugs flying around their pastry cases several times. Honestly I'd rather go to the Starbucks across the street. Even though it's a chain, I still get much better service from the staff there and they cared to learn my name.
author: Christine L.

description: Love this place. Can get crowded and loud. Good sandwiches options. Good internet too
author: Angeline B.

description:
Five stars for great service. Came here to cafe while waiting for my boyfriend to finish work. When I got to my table, my purse slipped off my shoulder and knocked my americano down. I spilled it all over my hand and on the floor. The guy who made my americano for me (don't know his name, but he has tattoos on his arm and was wearing nikes?) helped me clean it up, said he would gladly make me a new cup, and asked me if I was ok!!! Since I was totally embarrassed and my hand was a little burnt from the hot coffee, I really appreciated his sincere act of kindness.

Thank you mysterious coffee hipster dude! Friend me on yelp please if that was you - lets be friends! 

Also, I appreciate that the Wifi is fast.
author: Christine L.

description:
I had the most appalling customer experience here this morning. I arrived on my bike to a virtually empty cafe at 9am on a Sunday. I wheeled my bike (an extremely high end racing bike) into the corner of the garden to make my order, which wold have taken about 1 minute. I was immediately met by the irate store manager, Jamila, who insisted I leave the bike outside on the street. Keep in mind, the cafe was empty at this point. 

I obviously expressed my disbelief to her, but she was adamant, and even went so far as to refuse my order until I moved the bike. At this point, my GF arrived, so I had her watch it for the 40 seconds it took to order.

Sidebar: The food was adequate. Good coffee, and the breakfast burrito was satiating but lacked flavor. 

Next Occurrence: As I was eating, with my bike parked behind my chair leaning on the fence, a guy walked out of the cafe, kicks my front wheel, and goes sprawling face-down on the sidewalk, á la Ronaldo in a World Cup. It was so obviously blatant that I was lost for words. He then had the gall to mumble something about "see what happens when you you leave your bike around" but completely backed down and drove away when I confronted him. He was obviously connected to the staff there, and thought it would be a good idea to try and antagonize me further.

Pros: The space space is nice and airy with plenty of seating. 

Cons: Literally everything else. With the plethora of high end coffee available in SF, I will never be back.
author: Andrew G.

description:
I love this Coffee Bar! I don't come here as often as I should but when I do.. I think that it might be one of my fave coffee shops in the city. I love the decor, ambiance and it's quite a large space for being in the city!

Their coffee, cold brew, and some of their lattes are great. I haven't tried any of the food though! I'm Vietnamese.. & maybe I have high standards for Vietnamese Coffee? 

I ordered the Havana Latte for my mom last week and she was rather disappointed.. It's not as strong as it's supposed to be. I suppose it's my fault trying to order a Vietnamese Coffee for her when she can make a proper one herself! BUT! She did say that the Wild Blueberry muffin was realllllly yummy!
author: Michelle L.

description:
See that humongous mega chain coffee store whose name starts with an "S" across the street from Coffee Bar?

* yeah?! * 

Don't go there. 

I know you want your fancy extra hot triple shot Venti SEASONAL creme brûlée latte (hold the whip, 6 pumps of sugar free syrup, with room and give me a STRAW please!) but today, you're NOT gonna go there. 

You're going to go to Coffee Bar where they have a really nice patio or you can go sit inside, open your MacBook and enjoy the modern looking space. 

You're going to order a plain coffee or if you want something sweet, get an iced Vietnamese coffee. Or if you're a wimp like me, you'll get a decaf iced Americano. 

You will enjoy whatever you've chosen because Coffee Bar uses Mr. Espresso, a Bay Area roasting institution since the 1970s. 

And you'll feel amazing for having supported a local hangout, which I can't say the same if you would've gone to that humongous mega chain store whose name starts with a "S".
author: Janice C.

description: Great place for coffee break bringing own laptop. They have nice coffee and staffs too.
author: Seayong L.

description:
Adorable shop with lots of open space and tables, nice coffee shop ambiance, free wifi, and beautiful natural lighting. For those instagramers who are looking for the perfect hipster coffee or scone picture, look no further. Here's your next destination! I particularly liked the study and chill atmosphere of this shop. It's quite big, and there are plenty of tables, chairs, and outlets. On the other hand, the food is delicious but a bit pricey to me. $5 for 2 small slices of avocado toast and egg on top. $4 for a very delicious cranberry & orange scone. $4 for a cute vanilla bean coffee. $9 for a petite breakfast burrito. All the items were delicious but me and my boyfriend agree that it's not rlly worth the price (unless you're rich and don't care). I would come again for the setting and order less menu items =P.

Btw, I came here on a Sunday morning, and there were plenty of parking spots around the area.
author: Shirla S.

description:
Coffee Bar is a cafe lover's dream. It truly is. Still relatively "new" to San Francisco, I was confusingly walking down Bryant Street wondering where the heck I was going. In this part of the Mission, industrial buildings and unmarked storefronts surround me... I turn the corner and like a glimmering diamond hidden amid the concrete and plaster of the neighborhood is Coffee Bar. The building itself is "large and in charge," but so is the welcoming front patio teeming with happy San Franciscans sipping away at their caffeine and pastries. A solid handful of bistro sets hug the front of Coffee Bar. If folks aren't chattering away, others are sitting with a book or laptop... some are quietly sunning themselves surveying the people on this busy corner. 

Upon entering, you are met with a wonderful display of industrial chicness. Huge loft-like windows provide fantastic natural sunlight. Minimal wall art surround the joint and there are a handful of large lighting fixtures above. The bottom floor is for ordering. Upstairs, there is plenty of seating. Wooden tables and up-against-the-wall benches and metal chairs predominate. There are several group tables as well. Much to my delight, there is a generous amount of outlets for your electronic devices. For those of you who plan on surfing the web, they provide free wifi (No password required! Double "hurrah!") I will advise, however, if you plan to do some work or linger to not go during lunch hour. There are many signs reminding patrons to not use the main tables between 11:30-2:30... and rightfully so! I too have been in situations where a friend and I would want to sit at a wifi-friendly cafe only to wait until a table clears and then we'd have to run to grab it. Very stressful indeed! (On a side note, I don't mind sharing tables with strangers. In fact, I quite like it. I don't feel as guilty sitting alone and if you're lucky, a perfect stranger with good energies will start a friendly chat.) In terms of the crowd, Coffee Bar attracts a diverse lot: hipsters, gay and lesbian couples, older couples, students, techies, young families, first dates, book club readers (I'm not being facetious. A book club was meeting in the corner hashing out what they liked about this month's juicy novel. I wonder if it was "50 Shades of Grey..." Hmm...).

Onto the good stuff... and by that, I mean coffee. Not only is the space fantastic, but more importantly, so is the coffee. I ordered an iced espresso; very smooth and reasonably priced ($2.50). I also had an iced Vietnamese coffee. It's cold brewed for 24 hours and mixed with sweet condensed milk ($4.50); no sugar or milk needs to be added. The latter is a great choice if you're too lazy to mix in your own milk and sugar. The baristas are very friendly and the food runners are also quite pleasant. Based on my observations, the staff look pretty happy to work there. That's always a positive sign. 

Lastly, why is Coffee Bar my new favorite coffeehouse? Upon my first visit, the "DJ" was serving up some late 90s/early 2000s rock realness. From The Verve's "Bittersweet Symphony"  to Goo Goo Dolls' "Slide" to Third Eye Blind's "How's it Gonna Be?" to Red Hot Chili Peppers to Vertical Horizon to Sugar Ray... talk about "TRL" throwback playlist! I was enthusiastically jamming out... and how could you not? I felt 15 again ready to dial in MTV's "Total Request Live" hoping Carson Daly would play Blink 182's latest song. 

Coffee Bar: Thank you for a nice introduction to your space. You've warmly embraced my presence. In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I'll be back." Oh dear. I went there. *face palm* I guess good coffee makes you do and say crazy things.
author: James Z.

description: I'm new to the nitro coffee trend, but after seeing pictures of people drinking what looked like Guinness with their morning cereal, I knew it was a trend for me! The cup is small and don't even think of asking for ice with it. It's perfectly portioned, iced coffee, jet fuel. No other iced coffees even come close to the nitro.
author: Hayley H.

description:
Since my move to the city, I had been desperately in search of a cafe with both outdoor seating and WiFi. Coffee Bar was seriously a shining beacon of hope -cue angelic chorus-  If you're familiar with Berkeley's popular coffee spots, Coffee Bar is like a grown-up Caffe Strada. It's the perfect environment for people-watching, chatting, and working.

Coffee-wise, I tried their Vietnamese Iced Coffee. I would definitely recommend it! It's not too sweet, and not too bland. I didn't get a chance to try the food, but I was tempted to steal a bite from my neighbor's sandwich. It looked delicious.

No complaints except that the WiFi is a tad bit spotty. I'll definitely be back here on weekends to work on side projects :)

P.S. There are also plenty of outlets and dogs.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
3.5 stars

- great iced coffee (not sour at all, like starbucks often is), iced jade green tea
- lovely cafe atmosphere, indoor and outdoor seating 
- awesome upper loft with plenty of seating, bar-style, cafe tables, and couch seating
- there are plugs! but not at every table 
- wifi is decent, sometimes spotty
author: Inga C.

description: Thanks to Yelp, we found this two blocks from where we're staying. A horchata iced coffee, a Vietnamese iced coffee, two hot chocolates and a chai latte were ordered over the course of two days. We found the service to be fantastic and the drinks great as well. Can't go wrong if you are in the area!
author: j m.

description: This place is magical. Productivity somehow magnifies the minute you step in through the door. Amazing place to work with spacious seating, free wifi and easy access to outlets. A little pricey but I guess it pays for the atmosphere.
author: Eddie Z.

description:
Definitely recommend the mind-blowing mushroom melt! Probably the most flavorful a sandwich can possibly get without drowning in grease or toppings.

The place is 2 levels: ordering on level 1 and seating on level 2. They give you a number to place at your table and bring your food to you. I'd describe the ambiance as "cozy industrial." There are two couches next to giant windows, a few plants, and lots of separate tables throughout, as well as bar-type seating.

For those looking to camp out here for the day, come early, as outlets appear sparse and difficult to come by. Wifi is available.

For those looking for a chill place to lunch, there is an area sectioned off from 11:30am to 2:30pm that prohibit laptops. There's also outside seating.

There is only one restroom, but it appeared cleaned and well-maintained when I used it.
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description:
Out of all of the study spots in the city, Coffee Bar is my favorite. It's a great place to order some food and a coffee, head for a table upstairs, open up your laptop, and settle in for a few hours.

There are 3 reasons why I love Coffee Bar:
1. It's a great place to work because it's an environment where everyone else is getting things done too.
2. The food is really delicious.
3. You can order alcohol (!!!).

When I work, I need to be surrounded by other people who are deep into their work as well, and Coffee Bar definitely has that point checked off. There's a good amount of seating, though it did get crowded during the late afternoon on the weekends. A lot of the seating is communal, so you may have to share a table with some strangers. There are plenty of outlets, and the free wifi was pretty decent (though not blazingly fast, by any means) when I was there.

I'm not big on coffee, so I can't say much about their caffeine offerings, but all of the food I've had at Coffee Bar was delicious. One day I visited and the special was a smoked salmon salad--it was absolutely on point with a generous amount of smoked salmon and fresh mozzarella (my favorite!).

Best of all, if you're a bit stressed, you can forgo a cup of coffee for a cold bottle of Lagunitas (or any of the other beers or wines they have available). I took full advantage of being able to drink while I worked and I loved it.
author: Queenie T.

description:
"So that's against the rules, and you can't sit with us".. Taken from mean girls. When I walked in I was like, okay, good thing I have a macbook cuz EVERYONE is using Apple!!!

There is outside seating, plenty of seating on the upper inside patio thing. Couches, tables, chairs.

Ambiance is nice, and I can imagine myself relaxing here with a nice cup of latte. I got the Chai latte togo, which sadly did not have any design for me :( So there is no picture. wah. And I didn't love the latte, because it was really ethnically spicy if you know what I mean.. but as I started shopping in sports basement, I was like WHOOO!!! Good caffeine surge. I will be back to try another latte!
author: Sharon N.

description:
Good food and you can plop down w a laptop! Win-win!  Like the pizza. Apparently they like hosting events too. I like that the space is bright and open. Also, the official address is on Bryant but it's really on mariposa  and Florida.
Pros: fast zippy internet
Lots of places to sit and lots of outlets
Indoor and outdoor seating! 
It's totally cool if you want to sit here all day long (but if you do, make sure you buy some stuff to earn your keep (: )
Offer a variety of breakfast and lunch items 
They host events here. It would be a cool spot to host an event. I see that they have a projector + screen too.

Cons:
It can get really hot. Most of the seating is in a loft like area up top BUT the kitchen is up there too so the combination of rising heat and the heat generated by the kitchen can make it stuffy.  They usually have the door open and they have two ceiling fans BUT they only seem to run the ceiling fan closest to the door.  Please run the second one closest to the loft too! We could use some air circulation up here! It would be cool if they could open more windows too.

The food is kinda hit or miss and lunch items  run from $9-$15 so it's not spendy (for the area) but it's not super cheap either  . The breakfast items is the best bang for the buck.  However, I don't really mind bc I come here and plug away for a few hours (as do many others) and they gotta make money somehow! 

All in all, I love coming here. It's one of the few places in the city (that I know of) where I can get reliable zippy internet, good coffee, plenty of outlets, and be able to have lunch too! If I am going to be staying a while, I always try to buy more than just coffee bc I want them to stay profitable!
author: Alison H.

description:
Welcome to the first Coffee Bar in San Francisco!

This place is secluded from traffic flow of people and cars, which makes this spot a fabulous stop to drop by and linger here for some odd hours over work, studies and coffee.

The outside lounge area is great because of limited neighboring noises.  The inside dining area is contemporary and spacious.

Complimentary Wi-Fi.  

Havana Latte is my favorite at Coffee Bars!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Loved the coffee. It's top notch and high quality. The only downside about this place is that it gets really packed inside during lunch and it gets really hot. It can be hard to find a seat and hard to find a seat with an outlet, so come early to secure a spot!

The coffee and food is excellent and a great spot for lunch.
author: Wilson P.

description:
This is a great little local business. They have a great indoor area which is large enough to seat a lot of people, both the laptop crowd and the lunch crowd. The effect of the laptop crowd (which admittedly I am often part of) is offset by restricting where you can sit with a computer during certain hours, AND having large areas of bar type seating where you can sit for a while. Quality wifi is a bonus too. The outdoor area is also pretty cool, shaded by some trees and fenced in a bit from the street.
