The coffees are great, both hot and cold varieties. Try the Wietnamese coffee if you're in the mood for something sweet. I've seen others eating the food items, and they look pretty great too, but haven't tried them myself. I'll be back though.
author: Brent W.

description:
Quandary: How do people in the neighborhood decide whether to get a cup of joe at Blue Bottle or Coffee Bar? 

A key factor must be do you simply want to enjoy a latte or do you need to get some serious thinking done. For the latter Coffee Bar is better equipped with dozens of patrons set with laptop out for designing, writing, or crunching numbers and an espresso drink by their side.

The space invites creative and entrepreneurial minds and thoughts. They serve food too to keep you productive for long hours. Free WiFi.
author: Bryan W.

description: Bright little coffee shop with plenty to chose from. Decided to check it out because this place sells more than just coffee and simple pastries; they also sell breakfast items and sandwiches. My boyfriend and I tried the oatmeal and sesame bagel. The bagel was definitely something else, and I'm saying this in a positive way! We also tried a vanilla bean latte and a caramel latte. Both lattes were delicious but the caramel latte was amazing!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
What's the Starbucks across the street got on a welcoming, small-shop cafe? Besides Pumpkin Spice Latte's, absolutely nothing. I love this place for being conveneniently located a couple blocks from my work. I have yet to try everything on the menu; but so far I've tried the delicious Vietnamese Iced Coffee and the yummy soup and salad. So far, so good! 

What I love most about this place is the atmosphere. I give them five stars for putting the best mellow hip-hop tunes on rotation. When I walked in and a Roots joint was on, couldn't help but extend my stay a little longer. Besides that (because music is always such a huge factor in my opinion), there is great seating, lighting, and plenty of plugs, which are the basic necessities that most coffee shops don't take note of! Their service is fast and efficient and very friendly. Decoration is on point, very minimalistic, yet simple and elegant. When the Mission District gets a little hot outside, there is ample space and tables to hang out on or continue your study sessions at. 

Looking forward to trying more on the menu, especially the yummy latte's and herbal teas that i've been eying. I'm definitely making this cafe my go-to when I get to the neighborhood early.
author: Desiree S.

description: I guess these folks are doing well as they're opening new locales. I've only been here for special events. The last time was when Lauren Kiino of Il Cane Rosso did a dinner. Really cool chic industrial design, and the layout of the space is sweet too. Having the placed closed down for the dinner alone and getting your Mr Espresso fix is good stuff.
author: Kim N.

description:
Solid choices for food and coffee, plus a great workspace upstairs, equals one happy coffee shop hopper right here.

Why here?
I came here with my coworkers (or rather, one of them brought us here since he loves this place). Having never been to a coffee shop that's geared towards young professionals on their Macbook Airs, I didn't really know what to expect outside of good coffee.

Service and Space
The baristas were moderately friendly, and didn't seem too disgruntled when I asked them the specific differences between all their lattes, and what milk they used, and the strength of the teas. I'm the obnoxious coffee drinker who needs to know every specific detail of her drink, so I was pretty happy when she didn't chuck a espresso cup at me.

The space upstairs is what makes Coffee Bar amazing. There's no room downstairs for sitting (it's only for ordering coffee), but upstairs there are tables and couches for you to sit down, plug in your MagSafe chargers, and type away to your heart's desire. Come early to nab a spot, or wait until someone rotates off of those couches. Some tables are designated as "no WiFI zones" during the afternoon, so if you're planning on a long day of work here then just find a different table. Take a look at their map!

One thing I didn't like? The music. It seemed to be more of a Pandora playlist and not tailored towards any specific working vibe, and the volume was much too loud to be considered work/focus friendly. I guess if Coffee Bar doesn't want that vibe, then they don't really need to play mellow music.

Drinks and Food
The drinks range from pre-pressed juice to your standard coffee to green, black, and herbal teas. The chai isn't too overpowering, and neither are the teas. The coffee in the lattes isn't overpowering, and the dry cappuccino has just enough foam to make me happy.

I can't speak too much for the food, but my friend got the avocado toast and it looked delicious. I'm also happy that this place serves decent lunch food, versus just pastries.

In the future, I'm going to bring a good pair of headphones, park myself on a couch, and look around at everyone's hipster Mac decals. For the meantime though, I'm happy with what Coffee Bar offers.
author: Kat P.

description:
Super slow service. I've had a number of times where I've waited 15min for my order only to find they had it sitting for 5min behind them. When I've politely asked if its ready yet I get a snarky answer. 

I WANT to like this place, but with the expensive prices, bad attitude and slow service I can't.
author: Brian V.

description: Nice place for those of you needing a jolt of caffeine and a place to work, as looking around not a single person is without a laptop.
author: Heather D.

description:
Probably one of the best coffee places to sit down and work in SF.

Great coffee, super ambience, and pleasant staff.
They do have designated seating if you want to sit with a laptop (check the small map - the are places where you shouldn't sit with a laptop). The interior is lovely, well designed and sweet tunes playing.

While they do have some outlets, they don't have enough when the place is full so if you can, bring a power strip.

The outdoor seating area was also lovely.
author: Malthe J.

description: One of my favorite places to study. The ceilings are high and this cafe just has a great atmosphere. I've had the vanilla bean latte and Vietnamese coffee. I loved the vanilla bean latte but the Vietnamese coffee was alright. The Caesar salad is overpriced. I'm giving this place 5 stars because I'm mainly looking for a place to study and this is one of the best places to go.
author: Amy L.

description:
Background: Chic Hipsterific Coffee Joint on the border of the mission. 

Details: 

Parking (5/5) weekend: on the weekends this area isn't so bad since all employees in the surrounding businesses are away, however during the week you do have to be a bit more of a ninja. 

Coffee: (5/5) smooth, tasty, fulfilling espresso. I've mostly gotten iced drinks, but a large latte (16oz)  will run you ~$5. Kind of pricey versus getting the giant 24oz venti at Starbucks, but it is SO quality and good. The espresso isn't burnt or bland. 

Food: (4/5) Tuna melt Sandwich w/salad $12. Tasty, but it took awhile 15 min+ to get the food.  It's a healthier version of a tuna melt stuffed with lettuce, avocado, tomatoes on a multi grain bread. Deeeeelish!  I've had their tomato and cheese scone  ($3) and a raisin cinamon swirl croissant (that was a bit too sweet for my taste, $3) The pastries are a bit on the pricier side, without being completely mindblowing. 

Staff: The cashiers at the front are super nice and helpful if you're a first timer. 

Ambiance (4.5/5) : Various types of seating options: two sofas for relaxingl 4 large work tables (@capacity at least 6 people each) 2 long  tables with high stools (5 people each roughly) ; an outside patio area for eating mostly; and a sprinkling of tables that are LUNCH only from 11:30-2:30pm (no laptops allowed, 30 minutes max). It can get a bit crowded, so if you're with a group of friends, sometimes it comes down to just luck to get some space.  The patrons at this place are pretty polite - don't be scared to ask people if you can join their table, most people would gladly make space for you. 

Workablility (4.5/5) Wifi for free! Pretty reliable wifi, except sometimes it randomly gets slow when there are too many people here.  Outlets everywhere! This is a major plus :)  I love coming here to do work. 

Verdict (5/5) :  One of my favorite coffee shops in the city, I wish I discovered this sooner. A part of me wishes I didn't write such a great review because others will just flock into this amazing spot!
author: Christine B.

description:
Perfect place to study and do work! Lots of outlets and plenty of tables. 
Love the high ceilings and the outdoor patio.
author: Keanna T.

description: Very good coffee and okay food in a noisy, hot space, usually with a generous portion of hipster rudeness on the side.  I work up the block, and love their horchata cold brew, so I have been willing to overlook the attitude until today.  I walked in at 5:15 PM and was going to pick up one of their prepackaged meals from the fridge when the guy behind the counter yelled "sorry miss, we're closed" in a not-sorry tone of voice. Which, now that I see their hours, they were - though since the gate and the front door were propped open, there really wasn't a way to tell.  I think they could have sold me something from the grab-and-go that was about to be thrown out, even if they were technically closed, but in any case, the rude yelling is uncalled for.  So I'll take my custom across the street to Starbucks from now on, where the coffee is worse but the service is better.
author: Nina T.

description:
I felt right at home when I walked through the doors of Coffee Bar. It has such a relaxing atmosphere. The baristas are very chill & friendly, even our servers and bussers exudes that feel-good relaxed vibe.

Located just a block from my friend's Bryant apartment in the Mission, this coffee bar is a a favorite amongst the locals. Always packed, with lots of people waiting around anxiously for an open table.

Coffee bar is very laptop-friendly, particularly macbooks (YESSSS!!!). Every single patron here (with the exception of the to-go order customers) were busing tapping away at their laptops. I was told that this is where most of the locals call their "workplace" or "my office". During my visit, I witnessed a couple job interviews & 2 staff meetings.

There's outdoor seatings, but most of the action is indoors. The balcony overlooking the coffee bar and foyer is constantly occupied: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=CZ8Bdq4WiiQgSPh50X_F2w

There's a power outlet at every single table and free wifi. However, it's difficult to get onto the network when everyone's on it though. 

Lot's of tables, including this communal table. The owners try to encourages a sense of community among patrons, forcing them out of their comfort zones to mingle with one another. Awesome!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=8k9bmCotLbSyXtrHQOtzuQ

There's also designated "lap-top free" zones during the hours of 11:30am-2:30pm. This is to accomodate people who stop in for a quick lunch or coffee break during the busy lunch hours. There's only a 30min time limit on these tables. 

One dude decided to disregard the signs. But the staff was quick to act, by politely asking him to put his laptop away or move. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=eCX-C4rf_GGe_t6i8o9sXw

The only teas avail is from the Five Mountain Teas Co (http://www.five-mountains.com/fivemountainsori.html). 

I got the organic BERGOMAT BLACK TEA for $2.50:
 Rich, full-bodied and had a nice citrusy floral finish. 

Good selection of gourmet salads & sandwiches. Overpriced but tasty.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=mcSsY8dyvz5sfHlnZK0ZVA 

HOT SALAMI SANDWICH ($10):
 Menu stated that it was made with "salami rosa" but plain salami was used. It was lacking the nutmeg, coriander and specks of pistachios that's normally in a salume/salumi rosa.

Served with arugula, roasted piquillo peppers and asiago cheese. A very tasty and very filling sandwich.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=93dkwFBm9ao-RhfAgAvqUg

The filling to bread ratio was just right for me. The asiago cheese remained gooey-soft till the very end, perfect! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=Wm7FoYS-9PMI2veO0rO_Jw
author: Cin T.

description:
Great place to work, lots of seating, your choice of comfy couches, benches, regular chairs, or bar stools, free wi-fi, and very focused people sitting all around you.

Only drawback...my (very expensive) salad was seriously overdressed and horrendously salty. I forced down a few bites cuz I didn't want to waste it, but ugh, I gave up. I ate some of the avocado garnish on top that wasn't smeared in sauce, and that's about it. Inedible.

I'll probably come back to work and get a drink, but I'll be passing on the food...
author: J K.

description: This place consistently runs out of eggs during breakfast (today was the third time in five visits.) In no world should a cafe run out of eggs on a Sunday before noon.
author: Brian S.

description:
pretty easy to rate 
+ quick, friendly, clean
+ delicious, roasted right, coffee
+ awesome vietnamese coffee too.
author: Jonathan Q.

description:
Coffee Bar looks so unlike a coffee place. more like an upscale eatery.

menu: salads, soups, sammies, pastries (starter, sandbox bakery), expressos, etc.

brew:rwanda (m,2)
-smooth, bold, as good as ethiopian

drips
-a great place to laptop
-better ambiance than the chain coffee places.
author: Victor G.

description: I am a big fan of Coffee Bar, but I'm also a huge fan of this particular location. It's a pretty hip area in the mission, more of the industrial area, but I really like that aspect of it. The latte is a must for me, I used to get the Havana Latte (includes condensed milk) but then I became lactose intolerant. Overall this place is cool, if you're lucky enough to go on a nice day, the outdoor seating is the way to go. It's nothing special, but I like it.
author: Aaron C.

description:
This place is pretty great. Simple but adequate menu (though $13 sandwiches and salads at a café is on the expensive side honestly), plenty of seating, huge windows for natural light, plenty of outlets...that being said, if you sit at the upper bars where the hidden outlets are under the counter, they are on the near (lap) side instead of the far (knee) side of the bar so if you sit next to one and anything is plugged in, it will essentially be hanging in your crotch. I've had to rearrange seating and move a couple times when other folk want to plug their square apple chargers in and they hang directly over my lap. 

There's also not a lot of air flowing through the café, so it's guaranteed to be 10+ degrees warmer than outside. (Its jacket temps outside right now and I'm almost breaking a sweat inside the building.)

The main downside to Coffee Bar is the less than reliable and slow internet. Each time I come here to work I end up having to reconnect and agree to the Internet terms several times. I typically just use it to listen to Pandora, so it's really obvious how often the Internet cuts out.
author: Colin M.

description:
Coffee Bar is adorable and delicious! They have a cute outdoor area and tons of little tables indoors. This seems to be a very popular spot to bring one's computer/tablet/devices to work or play for a while. 

I've come in on my way to work and have taken out coffee and a pastry to go. I had the ham and cheese croissant and it was probably the best croissant of my life! It was so fresh and stuffed with ham and cheese goodness. I'd predict their other pastries are similarly heavenly.

The "condiments" bar always seems to be clean and they have soy milk which is a big plus. The coffee is strong enough to get my day started right!

My only complaint (and 1 star off) is that the service can be pretty slow as the baristas sometimes seem almost a bit too chill.
author: Meghan P.

description: Upon handing me my drink, the barista realized he had given me the wrong type of milk, I said it was ok, but he insisted on re-making, such rare and excellent  customer service ! Latte came out perfect, great foam to coffee ratio.
author: Maddie T.

description: I like the atmosphere, it's very open, great lighting, cool patio space. Can get really crowded if you don't show up early enough. Coffee was good. Food was good, but kinda pricey. Aside from the regular menu, there are also daily specials. Overall, one of the coffee shops in this area that I actually like.
author: Kelley P.

description: Coffee bar is one of those shady cafes that shut their wifi down during peak hours WITHOUT telling customers. I understand the need to open up space for lunch customers, but they could handle this by notifying patrons that wifi will be inaccessible during that time. Instead you get lured in, plop down $$$ for coffee and food only to realize you got fooled and have to go over to Starbucks to get work done.
author: Vade Mecum B.

description: I love this corner coffee shop. Delicious drinks, unique pastries and a simple quality breakfast menu. The staff is always friendly and the environment has always been a diverse crowd of two tops catching up or individuals working on their laptop or small groups enjoying the outdoor patio. The neighborhood is a bit sketch but great coffee shop regardless.
author: Angela L.

description:
Their horchata latte drink - die hard fan!

Vietnamese coffee - also a die hard fan!

This place has great coffee and decent food. If you're looking for a lounging spot, come here. However, inside where the couches, bar tables, and outlets reside is packed. So if you're planning on doing work here, come with a fully charged laptop just in case. Also, their free wi-fi kicks you off every hour. Is it annoying? Yea, but it's not the end of the world. Will you see hipsters here? Yes. Do they sell alcohol? Yes, wine and beer.

Consistent coffee shop that beats the Starbucks down the street. A go to for anyone in the hood.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Wouldn't recommend.

Hot chocolate was ok, service was reasonably fast, and I like how many spots there are to work.

However wifi is unreliable.  The connection kept resetting, asking me to re accept terms, and at one point the connection crapped out entirely.  I wasn't able to reconnect for an hour.

Also employees don't bus, at all.  Normally at self-bussing places, you bus, but if you don't someone will come by to clean up because they don't want place looking sloppy.  Not this place.  

Right now my work companion is someone's half eaten salad that's been there for who knows how long.  I'll clean up just so I don't have to look at it, but then they ask you to separate dishwear / silverware from food.  Not yours, a total stranger's.   Later, someone else left their coffee cup.

Suggestion to management: place visible signs reminding people to bus their areas.
author: Charlie B.

description: 415 Caesar was average (3 stars) and a little pricey. Didn't try the drinks either - they were pretty pricey too, but I think that's because most people hang out with their laptops for hours. Likewise, they were cool with us hanging out and playing a board game there for 2 hours or so. Decent bathroom, and tap water was available so I appreciated that!
author: Nicola L.

description: Fantastic place to work, and great coffee to accommodate.  Lots of ports where the designated laptop areas are, which I think was a pretty neat idea.  I got their Vietnamese coffee which was good.  Staff and ambience were cool!
author: Michael N.

description: My new favorite coffee shop in San Francisco. I love how much space there is in here. The lighting is just great too because it's natural. I spent a Saturday afternoon there working on a presentation I had to give later in the week and it was great. WIFI signal is good and there is no password, so you don't have to interrupt the barista like other places for the WIFI password. I got a mocha there and they do take their time to make it so that it's perfect. It can get crowded though as I've stopped in to just grab a cup to go and saw there was no seating available inside or out. These two people were wandering for a table the entire time I was waiting. So it can get pretty busy, but this is definitely my new coffee shop to go to when I need to get some work done.
author: Julie L.

description:
+ Nice vibe
+ Rotating menu

- Slightly overpriced
author: Margaret R.

description: Love this place! Really easy to get work done here as there are a lot of tables and a bright, open concept. Tall ceilings and minimalistic decor add to an environment that is easy to focus on. I am a fan of mochas and the variety of mochas they serve here is great! Seating can be a little difficult to find, especially if in a group. Other than that, this is my go to spot for getting work done!
author: Mark L.
I. L.

description: Warm, large atmosphere with lots of natural lighting, plenty of work/reading space (including standing tables!), and delicious affordable options. Had the Espresso Toast with sweet marmalade dip. Highly recommended for work.
author: Sebastian L.

description: Cool little place in an up and coming area of sf near General hospital. Not much around it so parking is easy. Good strong coffee with a variety of flavors etc, ranging from Vietnamese to turbinado sugar in your espresso. Food choices are tasty and very fresh tasting, but a little expensive. They also have breakfast that is excellent! Good place to work or just hang out with your girlfriend on a Sunday morning :)
author: Samir K.

description: Great salad, coffee and comfortable workspace!
author: Jen-Chieh C.

description: Pretty  nice spot to do a meeting or get some work done.  I've been here once for a holiday party and I'm not sure I'd recommend it for that, but it's good for a spacious workspace.  Plus the coffee was great and the crispy peanut cookie was delicious.
author: Vivian W.

description:
I love this place.  The space is modern and comfortable.  Get there early so you can have your choice of seat but it will be packed as soon as you know it.

My favorite has to be the Havanna Latte but that is if you like your sweetened condensed milk.  Otherwise just stick to black coffee that rivals some of the best in SF.  The space and friendly service makes this business though.  iPod is always playing great music selections and the pastries are provided by Dynamo Donuts and other fresh, local bakeries.

if you have time to stay awhile - do so.  Grab some great food or a glass of wine if you're up for it.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Coffee Bar has decided to monetize their WiFi by offering higher-speed connections for a monthly subscription fee. 

To encourage people to get a subscription, they have throttled their free WiFi to the point that it's basically unusable.
author: Jacob L.

description: Horribly bitter espresso. Baristas need better training. Shame for such a nice atmosphere (if you can get a seat).
author: Ted M.

description: Went into Coffee Bar to pass time and get some work done. Plenty of outlets, great WiFi, a clean bathroom, and a pretty good menu of food and drinks (coffee and non-coffee including beers, sparkling waters, etc.) . Trendy and pleasant place to be productive on a beautiful San Francisco weekend.
author: Brad W.

description:
Sexy soundtrack perfect for productivity, good-looking people, super friendly staff, modern hip interior, free/fast Wifi with lots of open space and outlets, and Mushroom Melt on fleek. 

Still gotta try their coffee, so look out for an updated review soon ;)
author: Valerie F.

description: What a great place to study! The coffee is great, the food is tasty, it's spacious, and there is a ton of parking around!  I had the Havana Latte, which was a little on the sweet side but that didn't stop me from almost finishing it. For lunch I got the caprese sandwich and tomato soup. Both were great, although it was a little strange that the sandwich was served on a hamburger bun.  The atmosphere is the best part though - they've got good music, lots of tables and a lot of sunlight. Can't wait to come back!
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
The coffee here is amazing and the environment is perfect for working. I'm not a hipster and this place is definitely filled with them. But the ambiance is nice and I get a lot of work done here. 

There's free wifi. Certain tables are reserved for dining during lunch but there are other tables to study for longer. I order food, study more, and then order a coffee for snack after. The music playing is a mix of party and indie.
author: Hana J.

description:
Great space, needs some improvements, but solid food, joe & easy parking:

*Needs MAJOR ventilation inside
*A sando, yogurt should not take over 15 mins
*Maybe the line would move faster if they had a larger, easier to read menu
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Nice staff, plenty of spots to work, though not every one is near an outlet, and delicious coffee and food, mmmmm :)  Free wifi, well lit and ventilated interior, outdoor seating, parking is not a pain, as in you will probably have to circle around the 'hood for several minutes to find a non-two hour, non-metered spot, but they're out there if you can parallel park.

I got the mushroom melt for lunch, it was cheesy and delicious, I can't wait to try the veggie sandwich and other coffee drinks! 

Ambiance is fine: hipsters keep to themselves, unless you are even more hipster than they are, then they'll be curious to talk to you; 90% of the nerds are on Macs; nice interior, clean and comfortable. 

If the sight of hipsters doesn't annoy you and you're a coffee-loving vegetarian like myself, you'll probably like this place too :)
author: Lana L.

description:
Came here to do some work and it was perfecto. The shop itself looks like it could be a loft. Nice layout with various sizes tables/chairs/couches on the upper level and busy busy. I had the avocado toast with chipotle aioli and added hard boiled egg. It was good but nothing I would crave. You can easily make it at home for less than $5ish. 

I also had the 24 hour brew iced coffee (I think $4). Wow wow. I am not a coffee drinker at all but having never tasted a 24 hr brew, I decided to try it. The first sip was magical. It came in a very generous sized glass (which was wayyy too much caffeine for me but that's my problem, not Coffee Bar's). 

You order at the counter on the lower floor and take a number for them to bring you the food. All staff members was nice and courtesy, especially the two gentleman working behind the counter when I ordered. They made me happy. 

It also felt very clean... a big plus for a many reasons. 

Some tables have signs on them that say that the table is reserved for non-laptop users from 11:30am - 2:30pm (don't quote me on the end time). Bummer for me bc I was sitting at one of those and had to move to a large communal table but a great idea or those tables would never free up! 

There is also outdoor seating to complement the perfect San Francisco weather. 

FYI- this place is at the corner of Mariposa St and Florida St  (not one Bryant). If you're on Bryant, you have to turn on Mariposa to get here.
author: Esther C.

description: I love this place. Cute, tucked away in a little corner of SF with abundant parking, free WiFi, and tons of outlets! The sandwiches and drinks are great, but I'm particularly fond of the horchata cold brew. I think I get one whenever I'm in the area. I haven't tried as many of their breakfast items, so those are the next on my list!
author: Ivana H.

description:
Nice and spacious place to get some work done or catch up with a friend.

I went here to study with my gf and we had no trouble finding a place next to an outlet to sit for a couple hours. The weather was even nice enough to sit outside on their patio.

The Vietnamese coffee was on the menu and I thought I'd give it a try. Not bad. 

The hot sandwiches smelled really good, but we weren't hungry so we passed on them. Definitely a cool place that I'd come back to if I'm in the area again.
author: Henry N.

description:
Solid cafe with reliable wifi. It gets very busy on the weekends but also there is reasonable turnover so if you hang out a bit you are likely to get a spot.

Staff is pretty friendly, the sandwiches and other food are pretty good and it is a cool space to read, or work on your laptop. 

Overall one of the better cafes in San Francisco but they close pretty early, 7pm during the week and 6pm on weekends, would bump them up a star if they opened till 10 or later.
author: Brent F.

description: It's a good environment for getting work done. If you're someone who needs complete silence to study, this is not the place to do it. Although it's filled with noise, the ambiance is very productive. The lattes are good here, nothing too special. I think the Coffee Bar's best feature is its setup rather than the drinks and food. Just based on observation, I found the staff to be a tad rude at times, but of course this does not speak for all staff members. Overall I liked the place, but only see myself coming here when I need to jam out some homework.
author: Jen W.

description:
waited over 20min for avocado and toast....
I waited and saw that a to go box was on the side and did not assume it was for me. It was on the counter for awhile when the barrista saw it and called my name and said "thanks for the wait". Shitty customer service and experience...will not ever come back.
author: Alex M.

description: Came for lunch on a Monday. The staff at the counter were pleasant, fast, and knowledgeable about their food and coffee. I ordered the vanilla bean latte and the BLAT (bacon, lettuce, avocado, and tomato) sandwich. The food came out quickly and tasted amazing! I also appreciated the free wi-fi. I will definitely be returning!
author: Ashley K.

description:
Iced Vietnamese Coffee

Delicious, strong and creamy

I was pleased with my coffee

Overall Thoughts

I can see myself coming back here for a cup of Jo
author: Eddie W.

description:
Went here to get some work done. Wifi was not working, and when a few people let the staff know the only response was that it "should be working," each time with an odd suggestion to "turn off popup blocker." Dismissive and unhelpful to say the least, though understandably if you're not a wifi expert and there's no one to help out, there's not much you can do.

That said, coffee is pretty darn good and the food seemed tasty. Staff was really nice besides the wifi thing. The fact that Coffeebar's website advertises itself as a workspace, but they seem to have nobody on staff who will troubleshoot down-wifi is a big bummer. Ended up needing to go somewhere else, and couldn't enjoy a breakfast burrito while getting some work done.
author: Matt L.

description:
I love this place. The space is beautiful with lots of natural light and plants! The area where it's located isn't too congested, and parking usually isn't too hard to find.

The cortado is great, and the mocha is one of the best I've had (I prefer it over ritual's and four barrel's). Also, the pastries are great. Get the financiers if they have them. They also carry dynamo donuts sometimes, but the pastries tend to run out fairly early.

The only gripe I have is that it's fairly hard to get a table here. Usually pretty crowded
author: Brent H.

description: Haven't eaten in San Francisco in a while, so this was a perfect reintroduction of fresh, healthy food. Parking was easier than expected, food was delicious, and delivery was prompt. Seating is limited.. Here on a Saturday where there are more MacBooks hooked up to their owners than a mac store. Outside seating is quaint.
author: Crystal C.

description:
This is the type of place haters can't help but love. The airy space, delicious coffee, diverse seating options, and of course free wifi all but render any patron hopelessly enamored. The 2-floor finished wood, concrete and metal space is even universally designed to be fully accessible. How can one not swoon?!

I love the variety of savory croissants, scones, salads, sandwiches, and even wine or beer to coddle you anytime of the day you may stop in. This spot is definitely one to add to my list of approved office spaces.
author: Ting S.

description:
I can always rely on Coffee Bar for a good morning cappuccino and pain au chocolat. I like the setup of this place - upstairs for work (free wifi) or quiet chatter, downstairs patio seating and plenty of extra space for those who are waiting for their to-go drinks. I have noticed slightly longer waits than preferred when they are busy (e.g. 8:30-9am), but service is always super friendly. 

If you're looking for good coffee, solid wifi, seating space - this is your best bet in the area.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I enjoy places like Coffee Bar for several reasons. The atmosphere, the menu, and obviously the good food. I enjoy a good cup of coffee and great sandwiches. If you do too I would definitely give Coffee Bar a try! You can seat yourself indoors and upstairs or outside on their enclosed patio. It' feels more private with their fences around the tables but on a sunny day in SF it's a perfect lunch spot.

Their Prosciutto with herbed goat cheese and fig jam caught my attention. It's not a combination that I've had before and was pleasantly surprised to find the great balance between the prosciutto and jam. The salty prosciutto was complimented by the goat cheese and fig jam! The bread was hot and crisp. It came with an appropriate small side salad as well.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Food is decent but on the pricey side. TIP: If you order an iced drink, expect 90% ice and 10% of the actual ingredients. Order ''light ice'' with your iced drink.
Feel good, bright work environment is probably the main draw of this place, since most people here are not eating or talking but are buried in electronic devices.
author: jen b.

description:
My fav SF coffee. Yes, you heard me. This land is overflowing with amazing coffee, and while I love Philz (but it tends on the too strong for me side) and worship Blue Bottle, Coffee Bar serves up a brew that is juuuuust right. Their beans are from the local Mr. Espresso.

Outside seating with cafe tables and picnic tables is lined with potted plants, so when you're in there, it's a little haven. Inside seating on the upper floors is open and airy as you overlook the baristas at work.

We completely devoured the Maple Apple Bacon Scone (from Sandbox bakery) that had the absolute perfect crispy outside edges, tasting all crispy and mapley.

Best iced coffee I had this time in town (sorry, BB New Orleans iced, I still love you).

Seems like a great place to work or study, with the ample space and free WiFi.
author: Claire F.

description:
I'm going to make a bold statement and say this is my favorite coffee shop in the city. Let me make another bold statement, which is that I don't drink coffee. So, you might be (acutely) pondering... what could I possibly know or want to rate a coffee shop? Because I have lots of work to do and need changes in my environment in order to be my most productive and, well, I just like them!
I look for 3 things in coffee shops: 1) wifi (ideally, free and functioning), 2) quality of their chai lattes (no coffee means tea tea tea), and 3) atmosphere (the most important criteria to me). In my opinion, coffee bar hits all 3 and VERY well. 
There is free wifi and it works - yay! Their chai latte (esp iced) is delicious. And the atmosphere is A+++. There is plenty of seating, including outdoor seating. The lighting is superb. Noise level is just right (i.e. if you forget headphones, you're not screwed). I've only had a sampling of their menu, but the butter croissant I had this morning was killer and it was BIG too! It can get crowded to the point where you won't find a spot though, so I recommend coming before 11am on any given day if you're planning to stay a while. Also, certain tables don't "allow" laptop use from 11:30am - 2pm, but that didn't really stop me.... or anyone else ;).
I will be back. In fact, I was/am back. Now. 
Thank you very much for existing Coffee Bar!
author: Corrina S.

description: A Havana latte sensation! Sometimes its fun to have a little something different with that latte and they've nailed it with the Havana latte! Not too sweet either... Came here after finding this hidden gem through word of mouth. Cute place for getting work done but gets packed pretty easy!Just in case you get hungry, there is a tasty lunch menu ;)
author: Daniela U.

description:
My old college roommate wanted to show me around the Mission district today and introduce me to some of the most popular spots in the area.  Coffee Bar is apparently the best hot spot for folks working on startups, which was apparently by the fact that 100% of the people there had laptops.

We were planning to spend some time there to work so I ordered a "Connie Mac" panini and a Vietnamese iced coffee to power me through the work day.  The panini was loaded with turkey, bacon, mozzarella, and pesto and more and came with a fresh spring salad.  For $10, the sandwich had awesome flavor but a bit expensive.  However, when you factor in that we were using the space to work for much of the day, it seemed like a bargain.  The Vietnamese iced coffee wasn't as good as the drip-style stuff in the authentic restaurants but not too shabby either.  I'm super sensitive to caffeine so having it at about 2pm was a bad idea and I expect to pay for it the rest of the night.

As a place to work on your startup projects, Coffee Bar seems made for the nomad.  They've got a great patio area where you can enjoy a glass of wine while your dog sunbathes.  When I move back to the city, this is where you'll find me in bootstrap mode.

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere 9/10
author: Joe M.

description: Using their own homemade Madagascar vanilla simple syrup, the Coffee Bar makes a  heavenly vanilla latte. Sit outside on their quaint patio and enjoy.  It's a latte that will bring you back for more!
author: Maureen K.

description: Great local coffee options with yummy breakfast and lunch menus. The breakfast burrito is very good and so is the ham and cheese croissant! Yum!  Outdoor seating is nice and it's pretty comfy. Want a beer instead or with your coffee? Well, they offer a small but decent selection of import bottled beers. The staff has always been super friendly and helpful. Stop here instead of Starbucks across the street! Good eats and drinks!
author: Ness V.

description:
Good coffee and sandwiches. 
Coffee and food is great but it is usually overcrowded and WiFi is really slow sometimes. good beer selection
author: Ari H.

description: went to the city to meet up w some friends and had a few hours to work so I searched for COFFEE and I ended up in a bass ass place -  there was 40 people in the place and you'd never know it as many are full throttle working/playin away on their labtops. - I am 2 sips in on my coffee and oh yes I'll be coming back for more!! Sweet find!!
author: Jesse S.

description: Absolutely love Coffee Bar, have been coming here for years when I work in the area. Unfortunately I can rarely stay to hang out, but when I can I really like the atmosphere- great place to read the paper, work on your laptop, or get some work done. The Vietnamese iced coffee is my favorite. Today I had a chipotle chicken breakfast burrito which was really good. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area!
author: Tom H.

description: 5 stars if it stays open past 5... Awesome location, but sad to see employees have to walk around to tell a fair amount of people that they are now closed. Maybe stay open until 7!?
author: Michael H.

description: Bland sandwiches and 'starbucks level' coffee drinks.  The only good thing is that they have plenty of space, almost everyone there had a laptop in front of him. I actually went to drink an espresso at the Blue Bottle across the street and returned there to stay more confortable.
author: Andrei M.

description: I love this place. Great atmosphere, great coffee, great food options, much better than the Starbucks across the street.
author: Sandra M.

description: Worked out of here this afternoon and really liked the vibe - chill music, chic decorations, nice ambience. It's a cool space and smells really good, and the cookies and cream cookie is delicious. Only complaint is the glass case with all the pastries seemed to be filled with little flies (at least towards the end of the day). When the guy went to grab my cookie, a bunch flew out eek! Otherwise though, would love to come back and do work here
author: Amanda L.

description: People come here to work and the WiFi is often terrible. Don't bother coming here if your work requires a decent Internet connection.
author: Brennan S.

description:
Love the space! Pastrami sandwich was good and they have free wifi and a spaciousl upstairs and a patio area. 
My only concern is that the Asian girl making my latte was lip synching while making my latte and when it dripped a little on the cup, she wiped it off with her bare hands. it looked disgusting (i am not a clean freak type of person- so this was really not good)... i had a hard time drinking that vanilla bean latte afterwards and it was made way too sweet... so be warned, watch your drink being made and if there is any hand action, voice your opinion! :)
i would go back to check out the wifi and upstairs comfort ratio. (we were at the patio last time).
author: C A.

description: Not perfect?  What was i thinking.   Im here 3 times a week for the last 10 years.  Love it!
author: Victor B.

description:
all done. 

i've spent so much time and money at this place. and it has been such a wonderful communal living room atmosphere to do work and eat delicious sandwiches. but after the way i was treated the last time i was there i just won't go back. 

sunday afternoon. not busy. i asked a waiter if it would be alright if i used one of the "don't use laptops between 12 and 2" tables because it was sunday and because it wasn't very busy. he said yes.

cashier lady comes over to me and says i can't use my laptop. i explain the waiter conversation i just had (not to mention there are two men sitting to my right who are also using laptops at said tables and she doesn't call them out about it, just me of the feminine persuasion (?!) she goes away. a manager comes and tells me i can't use that table. i'm eating a sandwich, i have a latte, i have to leave in 20 minutes for an appointment, there are tables available, it is a sunday, and they have two employees come call me out for using a laptop (and again, not the men (?!)

all done.
author: Audrey S.

description:
I come here when I need to get shit done. I like to indulge myself with a Havana Latte and veggie breakfast burrito, plug in to an outlet, log on to the (fast) free wi-fi, and get to to work. Staff are friendly hipsters catering to the hard-working hipster crowd. The music is ok but I'll often wear headphones because I get distracted listening to people talk about their start-ups. Love the large windows, and the staff were helpful with pulling down the blinds a bit so the sun wasn't blinding everyone upstairs. People might complain about the prices, but maybe they don't go to cafes in the city very often.

Tips: 
Don't drive, parking in the area is almost impossible during business hours.
Observe the no-laptop times/tables.
author: N G.

description:
I come to this are of the Mission frequently, but for some reason had never tried this place. I was looking for a great cappuccino (on par with Siteglass, Ritual, and Fourbarrel) and some food.

The ambiance was great inside, and perfect for getting some work done or chatting with friends. Their cappuccino was delicious, and the avocado toast with chipotle aoli and sesame seeds was amazing, especially with shaved hard boiled egg added on top of it all.

The service was great, and the cashiers and baristas were very friendly.

I will definitely be returning.
author: Chloe A.

description:
I just eat the best cobb salad I've ever had in my entire life.

It was so good I'm still giving it 5 stars even thought I was dissapointed I couldn't get a refill of iced-tea. Oh well, check out this place!
author: Kenny C.

description: I usually go the Coffee Bar on Montgomery in Financial District. I decided to give this one a try today since we live close by. However, this Coffee Bar is a bit disappointing. It is extremely stuffy inside. It's not a place to enjoy coffee and study due to the heat, at lease inside. Outside seating is better. It also doesn't feel clean. The cream/sugar station was messy and dirty. Unlike other coffee shops, there is no syrup sugar provided. Ice coffee shouldn't be this bitter.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
I like this coffee shop. I am sitting in it right now.
There's a lot of tables/seats and there are power outlets to plug in along the walls.
There's free wi-fi, the drinks are good, and the employees seem nice.
I like the layout of the building and the hanging lights on the wall.

They have tables that don't allow laptops from 11:30AM-2:30PM. That's sort of cool for the those who just want to chill and talk but can't if every seat is taken with people on their laptops sucked into the internet.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I'm not over in the Portero Hill area often, but on a recent visit to SF, I was here for a tat appointment.  My fav city artist moved his studios to a few blocks away.  I stopped over early and so did a radar search for coffee.

This spot is nicely situated on Mariposa & Bryant.  The area is full of artist warehouse studios, and the vibe is very startup-y too.  Like SOMA a bit, as it sits between there & the Mission neighborhoods.

As a self-avowed coffee snob, I'll definitely vouch for these guys.  They're serious about their coffee and everything is up to par. 

They also have free wifi, so you can get some work done if you so choose.
author: Sean S.

description: Coffee bar in the mission is two-story with a patio, much more spacious compared to other locations in the FiDi; chilled setting and nice for sitting down. Pretty busy on both weekends I went. Almost the same menu as other coffee bars, with more food options. The only caveat is for laptop users, there are some tables that are laptop free during lunch hours (11:30-2:30), and yea I did see a group asked to move from one of those tables. I'd say this is not the most laptop friendly coffee shop as others like Philz, but it's a cool venue in general!
author: Jaclyn C.

description: Clean, bright, open space with plenty of upstairs and outdoor seating. Refreshing, pleasant area for working in. It was fairly busy almost the entire Sunday I stopped by. The vibe of the crowd was focused but amiable. The baristas and bussers were polite and friendly. The music playlist was awesome alternative rock. I didn't like my breakfast burrito (too much potato, not enough egg), but my vanilla bean latte was delicious. Great place to sit and use your laptop or read for hours.
author: Anna B.

description:
Coffee Bar lives up to hype (yes, the coffee is good), but what I really appreciated was the outdoor patio area fringed by potted succulents and fences draped in morning glory vines. When the indoor seating area is filled with silent people on their slim Apple laptops, head outside with your cup of joe for fresh air, life.

In fact, grab a book -- remember your (almost-vestigial) tactile senses and feel the slight chill in the San Francisco summer fog as the breeze blows by -- and a book (remember those?) and head outside to the front patio area of Coffee Bar. It's worth it.
author: Angie C.

description: One of the servers hand her had in her mouth the whole time she was bringing our food to our table. First time we let it go but 2nd time she came around she was still picking her tooth or something holding our food again. Gross and disgusting. I will never go back there as long as she works there.
author: Aban E.

description:
Down a star for not having dynamo donuts anymore.

And another for not offering refills.

I miss the old days of Coffee Bar.  I've been tempted to go to the Starbucks around the corner and that's not good.
author: Leon S.

description: The manager contacted me and explained me the reason why they could not keep the windows closed. I appreciate this kind of customer service, love to see the managers taking the time to explain how things are, even if they cannot satisfy the client's wishes. Thanks for bothering to do so.
author: Jessica R.

description: Well this place grew in me a bit. I do like the food, the drip coffee needs some help. But I like the format; but it's still crowded but in a fun way.
author: David S.

description:
*Parking: street, relatively easy
8Space: a bit on the tiny side, when I was there on a Monday mid-morning the place was packed! It was a bit of a challenge finding a table so I sat on the couch for awhile before a table finally opened up.
*Coffee: I ordered the mocha and it was excellent. Strong, sweet, perfection
*Free wifi is fantastic and unsecured
*I liked this space overall although it is on the crowded/cramped side with everyone on their macbooks doing their thing, it does have a tiny bit of a pretentious patron vibe but I suppose that's what attracts people to this place as well.
author: Betty C.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1010.

I love a good cafe with relaxing atmosphere, in a sunny side of neighborhood, lots of space inside and a patio.

Came here to get the last delivery of Tell Tale pastries. They also carry a lot of other pastries. All were delicious. So is the coffee, very aromatic. The cafe is with high ceiling and is very spacious. A lot of people come here to also use the wifi with some electrical outlets. And the sofas make this place feel more like someone's living room. Or you are like me who love to just read a good old paper print book.

The outside patio is also amazing if you want to soak in the warm sun.

The eatery also carries pre-made sandwiches which was just okay. Next time will try the salad instead.
author: T L.

description: Favorite new hangout.  I can get my hipster fix, doggie fix, and coffee fix all at once.  The pastry offerings are fresh and yummy.  The dark roast drip and non fat cappuccino were delightful.  Enjoy sitting on the rare sunny days in the front patio area. Lots of laptop carrying neighbors and the location is next to doggie daycare and SPCA so lots of dog watching!
author: April M.

description: Ambiance is ideal and perfect for working on your laptop. Spacious, well lit by natural lighting, and very airy (contrary to most coffee shops). Staff is friendly and down-to-earth. It's hands down my favourite coffee shop.
author: Greg D.

description:
I went to Coffee Bar to get some work done and apparently everyone else had the same idea. The place was absolutely packed with people on their computers and it was very hard to find a seat. I was lucky to find a place outside which was great. I would suggest avoiding the lunch hour for easier access to a table.

I got the veggie burger and it pretty mediocre. Not very flavorful. The other sandwiches people had ordered around me looked great, so maybe I just tried the wrong thing. I even overheard someone say the veggie burger is usually better. Maybe an off day?

Overall, this is a cool space and I will probably try this place again. I'll make sure to arrive early in the morning to get a spot and try a different sandwich.
author: Amy Y.

description: First off, this place is uber cute. The seating area is relatively large, they have free wifi and outlets everywhere so it's a great place to work remotely! They have THE best veggie burger I have ever had - I am certain that the patty is sprinkled with magic and now I'm always craving it. OH but their avocado toast - ugh I'm just dreaming of it now - sooo soo goooddd! Furthermore, they're great about allowing all kinds of customizations and their desserts are always delicious as well.
author: Tania S.

description: Probably the cutest coffee shop I've ever been to. Unfortunately it was absolutely packed, not a single open chair. Kinda bummed about it since we came here specifically for a nice place to study. Also parking was difficult because you have to find a spot on the street. I'll raise the rating when I come back another time for food.
author: Micaela B.

description:
So I'm still in love with their coffee menu, vanilla bean latte is so good I would murder a kitten for one.  

My complaint is the lack of veggie options on the menu, especially the take-out salads. They all have meat. They look fantastic- if you're into meat. I can't be the only animal loving hippie in the neighborhood! One option wouldn't be that hard. Pleeeeeease :)
author: Jourdain D.

description:
Pros:
- cold brew (bottled, $5, and I like it better than Stumptown b/c it's less acidic )
- good "BLAT" sandwich (bacon, lettuce, avocado, tomato)
- laptop-free hours
- interesting space (consists of multiple levels)
- large windows and outdoor patio

Cons:
- only 1 restroom
- slightly overpriced

Bottom line: reliable, quality cafe. I really like the atmosphere and the food is just as good as the coffee.
author: Jiann M.

description: originally ordered an iced chai latte with soy which cost $7 that i wasn't satisfied with. asked if they could make me something else and at first they were like uhh but then they were polite about it and gave me a vanilla latte with soy. cool open lofty space inside. some people seemed to be judging me and my friends who went there to journal and be creative and fun, but that's just SF. cute sitting area out front.
author: Isabella K.

description:
UPDATE - They recently fired the whole staff and got a bunch of pretentious baristas. I want the old staff back!!! I really miss the friendly people that remember you and ask how your day is. If I wanted my coffee with a smug smile I would go to Blue Bottle. 

I still go here because it still is a great place to work, but I felt this warranted an update.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Went to coffee bar on multiple occasions to escape the house for a change of scene whilst studying for my finals.

Really enjoyed the large, open space with large number of work tables. The free wifi worked at an acceptable speed for my needs (casual internet browsing).

Had the vanilla bean late which was really good as well as an iced vanilla late. Also had lunch here- the sandwiches are tasty, if a little pricey. The soups are also tasty and better value in my opinion.

I found that they ran out of their smaller food items (croissants/muffins) towards the end of the day which was a shame- I had to leave just because I needed something to snack on!

It's quite a hipster crowd who are obviously health conscious (they offer almond/soy options for all coffees and I noticed the salads are really popular) and so I think coffee bar would benefit from offering some healthy snacks.
author: Steph A.

description:
Great space in the industrial area of Mission. I got a Vietnamese Iced Coffee and it tasted great with strong coffee flavors and no hint of bitterness due to the cold brew. Will definitely have to go back to try the espresso drinks next time and maybe one of their new wood fired pizzas.

There were lots of folks on their laptops so I think it's a popular place to camp out and work on that next billion dollar startup idea.
author: Roger W.

description:
Love, love, love this place! Probably one of my favorite places in the city to study. It has lots of tables and open seating for studying or just hanging out with a friend. The ambiance and lighting are perfect as well.

 I always get the iced Havana coffee and it is delicious. I've tried a couple of pastries there and they've all been good.

This is definitely my go to study spot!
author: Krishna S.

description: Much better than the Montgomery location. Plenty of space to sit, free WiFi, and great drinks. Very good spot to meet up for a date, business meeting, or just to work. Extremely spacious and generous staff.
author: Albert K.

description:
Though I was only picking up a breakfast burrito to go, I immediately fell for the structure of this place. Seating was upstairs and outside, and on a Saturday around noon, both choices were crammed with people. The outside was very dog-friendly, though crammed with bodies, tables, chairs, and the place seemed to attract lots of regulars. While people outside basked in the sun and the easiness of the mid-weekend, people inside sat diligently on their Macs (all with distinguishing decals, of course), frowning in concentration over some piece of work. In spite of the sheer number of people, the noise level was not at all disruptive; it seemed like a good place to get work done. The strike against this loveliness was how warm and stuffy the air inside was.

Unfortunately, I showed up in the middle of a long line, and the kitchen--small, the barrista told us--was slammed and took about twenty minutes to get my food out. If you were the only one in line and expecting take-out or a quick bite or anything to drink (not prepared in the kitchen), this would probably not be an issue. If you are in a rush, expecting food and find yourself behind a few people, I might recommend seeking out somewhere else for the sake of time.

As for the food itself, I ordered a veggie burrito, which was brimming with yummy potential but was ultimately too heavy and not that tasty. The sweet potatoes, spinach, eggs, beans and rivers of butter just didn't come together that well. 

I'd return here with my own laptop to get some work done with a drink, with reservations about the temperature, but probably not with the focus of grabbing a meal.
author: Christina R.

description: I wish I can give 3.5 stars. The soy vanilla latte and breakfast burrito I ordered were delicious. Parking was easy on the weekend. However, because they leave their front door open all the time during summer it gets pretty warm inside. I couldn't really focus on working on my project because it was too warm... I kept falling asleep despite the large size of latte! LOL... Other than that nice place to hang out and grab a great cup of coffee.
author: Hannah H.

description: Love this place, top choice for studying in the city, lots of free parking around, free wifi, lots of space inside and of course delicious coffee to keep you energetic.
author: Nadia A.

description:
This quaint coffee shop located in the Mission is filled with hipsters wearing plaid and thick-rimmed glasses, with 90% of them using MacBooks. If you choose to be the contrarian out the group of "contrarians" I would advise you to bring a PC and wear a pink Lacoste polo.  

Ok, enough satire and onto the meat of the review. I found this place to be a nice alternative to the Starbucks across the street to get six hours of work done. My caffeine fix was a cold brew ice coffee and latte. The ice coffee was meh, but I thought the latte was good. I'm a latte art snob and it my barista did a wonderful job. The taste of the latte was good, nothing out of the ordinary. 

As for food, I ordered the vegetarian burger. It was ok. I've had better.

Overall, Coffee Bar is nice to work in, but can get a bit pricey. I spent a bit under $20 for a meal and two coffee drinks. I enjoyed the atmosphere, despite being in a sea of yuppie hipsters.
author: Kristen T.

description:
Beautiful people flock here like the salmon of Capistrano.
...If you are lucky enough to find parking.

On a serious note: This is the best study spot in San Francisco
...if you can put up with quiet dub step.
author: AJ G.

description:
All of my knowledge of San Francisco cafes is incredibly outdated, from the time when I had money to spend on these things. This is illustrated by my experience with Coffee Bar, when I went in last weekend to ask for a coffee from the Clover machine. The barista said they didn't have one, and I said "Well you used to!". He replied "Yup.... like, 2 years ago".

Oops.

So, headsup y'all -- no more Clover!
author: Maia B.

description:
My go-to lunch spot in town. Usually there with the husband and the fluffy chow chow. We love the outdoor seating area. And in the Mission you get more sunny days to enjoy than out in our hood. 
The salads and sandwiches are all great. Normally I don't like Caesar salads, but the one here is super tasty, they do it with kale and an updated dressing recipe.
I also recommend trying the specials, they come up with some great choices.
author: becca w.

description: Great drinks, soups, sandwiches, and etc. If you need to work somewhere for the day or want to meet up to catch up this is a great place with tables to do work, couches, and good service. The food may seem a little on the higher price for coffee shops but the portions and quality really seems to make this place stand out. Also on a nice day you can sit around by their entrance. I would go to hang out or grab brunch if I were in the area.
author: Lily P.

description: Great place to sit down and get some work done with their super fast wifi. The coffee and food  is a bit sub par, especially compares to the other great options around.
author: Amin S.

description: Good coffee - $2 for small drip. Friendly baristas. Hipster-ish vibe for all you cool kids. Plenty of tables and seats inside and out, although it fills up quickly. WIFI is stable and great to get some work done. Parking is pretty tough to find in the area, though.
author: Suji C.

description: Great coffee, fantastic working environment. I arrived around 10 am on a Saturday and was able to hunker down with my laptop, some coffee, and the espresso toast. The food was delicious, and I felt very welcomed. They even have a handy seating chart that shows where laptop users are welcomed to sit and set up office, and which tables are reserved for lunch costumers. There is amble parking outside, which is a plus in the city.
author: Cristina F.

description: One of my faves for coffee and the space.  I like how the coffee bar is separate in the lower level from the seating area.  Coffee is of course very good, otherwise I would've knocked off at least two stars.  Also a positive, the prices in my opinion seem slightly lower than the usual SF  prices.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Absolutely my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco. Fabulous coffee that ranks up there with Blue Bottle and Four Barrel. You should definitely try their Havana latte!

The inside has lots of seating, and almost everyone comes here to set up their laptop and get some work done. They also have a lovely outside urban garden with seating.

Five stars all the way!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Damned Good Cobb Salad.

Best enjoyed at an outdoor table on a warm Indian Summer evening.

Give 'em a ten and you'll still get some change.
author: Tracey A.

description:
I love this place!  I practically lived there while I was on hiatus from work.  I called it my "office" because I would bring my laptop and hangout all day.  They have comfortable indoor and outdoor seating, decent wifi, a good selection of pastries and food, and great espresso drinks.  I LOVE the Havana Latte!  Other faves are: the ham & brie sandwich and the apple strip.

Sadly, I dont get to hangout as much, but I still stop by and take stuff to go on a regular basis.  I usually find parking within a block.
author: Marleen C.

description:
Agh, I'm so torn about this place.  I come here nearly every day as it is next to my office.

On one hand -- it's solid coffee.  That being said, it's not going to blow anyone away(at least, those of you who know good coffee).  It's not stooping to the low of Starbucks(god forbid), but it just doesn't have that magic that Sightglass or even Blue bottle can pull off.  In a lot of ways it's all there -- most of the baristas are well informed, most pourovers are done correctly, the beans are of a relatively high quality.  That being said, I've never had a cup here that made me go, "WOW!".

All in all, the coffee here is good, but not great.  It's definitely not worth going out of your way though.  If you have the ability, Special Xtra in SOMA is much better and a few blocks south, or The Station or Beacon a few blocks north in North Beach.
author: Yan L.

description:
BEWARE: CRAWLING WITH HIPSTERS AND OVERPRICED FOOD. 

Coffee Bar is kinda hidden behind this wall of green leaves. It was sunny out so a lot of people were sitting outside on their laptops, when I stepped inside, I saw the place CRAWLING with hipsters in every corner. I dropped my jaw in awe. I've never seen so many in one place...

Anyways, so I look at the menu, and some parts of it have french words sprinkled in the description. Um. Okay. I notice the $8-$9 price tag on most items. Eek, I'm on a tight budget. So I go for the soup of the day and salad. All together $6. 

The soup and salad were pretty good, everything tasted fresh, but I don't think it was worth $6. Maybe $4, def not $6.

*shivers* hipsters *shivers*... 

It was alright, but too rich for my blood.
author: Sophia G.

description:
Ah, Coffee Bar. So little not to love about you: 

There's WiFi and plugs aplenty if you're looking to hunker down to get some work done (which most people here are). There are delicious pastries -- try the almond or ham and cheese croissant. The coffee is good -- their Havana latte is made with condensed milk and it's rich, creamy, and sweet (although admittedly a little too sweet for some palettes). Their food is wonderful, too. I like the breakfast burrito, which sometimes is available with chicken chorizo and cotija cheese (and maybe sometimes a little too much potato), and they also have a great lunch menu with sandwiches and salads comprised of yummy, artisan-sounding ingredients like roasted chicken, arugula, beets, tuna, avocado, and quinoa. Lastly, true to their name, they also have beer and wine. 

The space is also beautiful -- it's reminiscent of an open, airy art gallery-esque loft with two stories, industrial lights and lots of bar seating, wooden communal tables, and two couches. 

Initially, my review of was going to start off with a snarky intro about the ridiculously hipster-ific vibe of this place -- lit up apples and plaid as far as the eye can see. But, you know what? You're either with them, or you're against them. 

And, me? I'm definitely, definitely not against them.
author: Betty W.

description: Solid cappuccino.  They serve them in a smaller cup, which ensures a perfect mix of espresso, steamed milk, and foam.
author: Travis D.

description:
Coffee Bar is pretty much the perfect cafe in the city to work in. Parking can be a hassle, but when I've found it, it's usually not that bad of a walk and it's free to boot. The coffee is delicious, and so is the food. What I especially love is that their vegetarian/vegan options are fantastic. The WiFi is free, but be forewarned that it's pretty slow. That's alright for the occasional surfing and email, but if you rely on speed for work (like I do), consider bringing a MiFi as well. Also, there aren't that many sockets, so maybe pack a power strip if you want to charge up your laptop. 

I definitely recommend the "eggless" tofu sandwich. Yum!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Full disclosure
Cafe itself(food/coffee/atmosphere) is 5 stars
The customer service i received from a particular  barista 1 star
This one cashier who trys to memorize ppls name 5 stars
My coworkers say their orders are always wrong 1 star

Ok story time.. 
Barista  was joking  and talking with coworkers  in the morning. It bothered me because a couple minutes is very precious in the morning before work. That gave me time to realize i didnt order non whole milk. When i asked her while profusely apologizing if i could get nonfat she very rudely replied, "UGH  ok, let me make this WHOLE thing over" and then preceded to talk about me to the guy at the register. when it was done she said aloud, " your NONFAT latte is ready.. NONFAT LATTE". I understand that this was a hassle for her  and it was really my fault but isnt it HER job?-thanks for the rough start.  I  was also one of two people ordering it wasnt like there was a line. This was 3 days ago and im still pretty upset. ive been going to starbucks around the corner where they are really nice. Ill probably be going back because the food and the coffee is so good but its not going to be for awhile.
author: Maria D.

description:
Since I moved to the area I've been in often, especially on weekends for brunch.
It has an energy from all the brains focused on their work, or intense discussions.  Internet is free and fast.

Coffee & food are consistently good. I usually get a sandwich or the yogurt+granola. 

Seating can be an issue, try to get here early or avoid coming in as a group. Some tables are reserved for people ordering lunch.

Very accessible (ramp/elevator).
author: Andrew D.

description:
The Cortado is great: it's a gibraltar with extra sugar: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=DAD7_XMFOscraj8MTWxOeg

The standard Gibraltar is good, too: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=cHkOGuBdopdVfz0LyWMyeg

Nice selection of morning pastries, of lot of which come from Patisserie Philippe: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=9Yx1muhHxUzPBMYv3EBNbw

The Atrani sandwich (prosciutto, mozzarella, tomatoes) is great: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5a0deGsSdIP6gXl_On1kCw?select=2VBi_E8r8-uXXYQG81KRRw
author: Scott F.

description:
I never ordered food, which looks delicious but I've heard and seen is slow-coming. However, the coffee is my favorite in the city! Since I judge a Coffee place by their Coffee, 5 brilliant stars. 

Also the desserts are scrumptious.
author: Leo R.

description: This place is AWESOME, food is always on par, coffee ain't half bad. The bar tables above will probably always be filled with folks on their laptops (guilty myself of doing this), but the majority of the seating has signage which bars laptop users between the lunch rush. Their wifi is just spectacular. On a nice day sit outside and soak up the sun with the succulents.
author: Peter C.

description: I feel like this is a great place to come and get some work done. Nice clean space, plenty of room and even a nice courtyard for sunny days. The coffee is delicious in true San Francisco Style. Although not my favorite in the city, it can hold a candle to the others.
author: Carlynn A.

description: Pricey (but so is sf) but good sandwiches! Try all their grab & go sandwiches. I can finally say I tried them all. According to my tastebuds, first place goes to the mozzarella, second place goes to the salami. I usually like fluffy French rolls as oppose to a baguette, but maybe it's because by the time I get them, I'm ready to scarf down anything.
author: Kris I.

description:
This place is surely hip, but I don't know if it is AS hip as other reviewers claim. Although I am overall positive on this place, my visit was relatively mixed. I know better places in the city and outside.

+ Delicious coffee: well-made, rich-tasting, and fast
+ Lots of seating: you'll need it, this place is busy
+ Cool building: kind of a renovated warehouse/loading dock type feel, but still cozy
+ Hip vibe: you can feel the cerebral energy oozing off the patrons as they crunch through their startup tasks. 
+ Good food: the Cuban sandwich was tasty, although not terribly traditional. I lived in a part of Florida less than 200 miles from Cuba for 3 years and if you want a good Cuban, THAT's where you go. Still, Coffee Bar's take on a Cuban was still good.
+ Fun part of the city

- PRICES! A coffee and Cuban sandwich totaled $18 (without tip)! There's a word that comes to mind for that...oh yeah...ridiculous (even for SF)! 
- Parking: Simply horrendous. Best I could find was 1-hour. Good luck getting any work done in that time.
- Too busy: You may not be able to find a table.
- Seating Restrictions: Non-laptop hours at some tables limits seating for those of us who work.
- Slow Internet: I don't know what other reviewers here mean when they say the internet is fast. When I pinged it, I was getting speeds pretty consistently over an hour of less than 1 Mbps. Might have been an off day or someone might have been Bittorrenting Hobbit 2.

So basically, if you want a good cupajoe while you hang with the it-crowd in an it-place and are willing to walk there, pay a premium, and wait around a bit for a seat, this place is for you.
author: Christopher M.

description: Clearly every hipster's favorite study spot. But it IS a great study spot!! Has a nice upstairs with fans and low music so it's a great work environment. Outlets and internet. I love it. Outdoor patio looks a little squishy but still, outdoor patio!!
author: Liza S.

description:
Had a much better experience my 2nd time ordering food. 

Coffee Bar really wanted to make it right (the errors in my order). I appreciate the customer support!

I am indeed a fan!
author: Gina H.

description:
I stopped by this place to grab a quick coffee and was glad to find parking pretty quickly.  There was plenty of indoor and outdoor seating with a lot of people with laptops studying and sharing tables.  The interior had a modern feel, with a clean lines and darker hues.  

I tried their Vietnamese coffee ($4) and an almond croissant ($3.25?).  The coffee was good, but the almond croissant was mmm...mmmm...mmmm.  It was both crispy and moist, with the right amount of almond paste in it.  I definitely will be coming back to check out their brunch and lunch options.
author: Mel L.

description: Great place to plop down and do some work - coffee is excellent, the food is surprisingly good, and there is free wifi. Wish there was more parking around the neighborhood but that's the mission for you.
author: Riz A.

description: I love this place for their custom high quality drinks and food. It's an amazing spot to study too, very open. We had their vegetable soup, almond croissant, French toast, espresso, and unique seasonal coffee and they were all up to the challenge!
author: Brian P.

description: Although I really enjoy both the food and the coffee at Coffee Bar, the service is so poor that I won't be going back.  I ordered drinks and sandwiches and knowing that I would be sitting outside, I asked the order taker what would be the best way to get my food.  After being assured that "they would make sure I got it", I sat down for a very long wait.  I checked on it and after someone going to the kitchen to check, it turns out that it had been sitting on the counter getting cold.  The manager tried a number of excuses from having a new and untrained order taker to their following their usual procedure, laying the blame on everything except their poor service.  I do hope the owner of the business reads this because the opening of "Tart" manufacturing around the corner has already killed your business.  You won't get it back with employees like this.
author: Michael C.

description:
We walked in.   My partner stood in line to order at 1 pm or so.   Walked upstairs and looked outside.  Hipsters everywhere just hanging out with their laptops hogging tables.  Did not order as there was no where to sit left and went down the block.  Would never return as it is a posers dream come true.  


Eat your food and go!
author: Lawrence G.

description:
I can't believe how many lunch breaks I've had taking classes at BAVC where I never ventured past the big fence to try Coffee Bar! This place is a shining beacon of hope in a neighborhood extremely lacking in eateries. The menu is small but delicious! I tried the prosciutto, goat cheese and fig jam sandwich and it as absolutely amazing. Literally cleaned my plate of everything but the cherry tomatoes. I was torn between the lox and the prosciutto, but there's always next time. My boyfriend tried the ham and cheese sandwich with tomato soup, which looked delish too. 

The only complaint I have is this place fills up FAST, especially at lunch time. Line out the door. Seems like a ton of laptop squatters in here, too. Even if you come 15 minutes before the lunch rush it makes a difference.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Love: Good coffee, food is decent (albeit a bit too vegan/vegetarian for my taste).  Breakfast burrito is legit.

Meh: Hipsters.
author: suzanne l.

description: Great coffee, great cold pressed juice, great abundance of wall outlets and laptop friendly seating, great atmosphere, great cafe!
author: Devin M.

description: An artist here just made my turkey club.  Following the Salumi sandwich I had yesterday at Salumeria,  I should play the PowerBall.   Like I said in the other review, I am not one to have $30-$40 lunches for 2.  More like In & Out Burger or a big bowl of pho.  But This was well worth it, and a bargain considering.  My turkey club was delicious.  My wife had the mushroom melt, and both our plates had freshly tossed salad.  Industrial type atmosphere, young and hip, everyone with a laptop or smart phone or both tapping away.   None of this matters when you have a terrific sandwich.
author: glenmore w.

description:
free wifi
outdoor patio

You know how Flora Grubb is mainly a gardening store and serves Ritual Coffee? This place is mainly coffee, but showcases a bit of succulents. The two both have the same industrial vibe because of their locations. One sells cute red, metal tables. One uses cute, red metal tables. I love the mezzanine seating. There are plenty of small tables and large tables for sharing. There's also love the large window and high loft.

The big plus is that Coffee Bar serves their own coffee by Mr. Espresso. There's something like a gibralter here. I don't think they make individual drip though. There is two types of iced coffee, one is normal kept cold in a fridge and one is a Vietnamese iced coffee. Actually, they make it with an espresso, which is not quite the same. They serve beer and wine also. There's also a chai on the drink menu. The menu offers both breakfast, lunch, and brunch dishes. Lunch is sandwiches and salads, but breakfast is my favorite. There is an amazing brunch item, potato madness. There is a large bowl of roasted red potatoes topped with large dollops of guac and sour cream. The cheddar is kind of dry, but I love the bacon and fried eggs. This is something I want to eat all the time. They also sell pastries from some local artisan places.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
+4 for the space. It's pretty incredirocking. High ceiling, industrial this and that. Cool wood counters, alumaseats. Well thought out.

+10 for the service. Adrian, Liz, Tasha - the whole gang. Everyone is tres cool and ultra-quick on the stick with the coffee drinks. They know their beans and regions and serve a mean grab-n-go lunch sammich as well.

I'm being serious here. And Coffee Bar means serious coffee. So, there - it's like an commercial, isn't it? Just go, you'll get it.
author: Mark S. I.

description:
Something for everybody.  Seriously.
