Communal table, work/study counters on the second level overlooking the baristas, sunny outdoor patio with shade and sun, comfy couches for lounging, laptop free tables reserved for lunch (and, you know, actual conversation) during peak hours...all leads to a vibrant, diverse crowd.

The space is great, reclaimed industrial vibe, concrete walls and pillars accented with rustic wood tables and well placed wall art, high ceilings and huge windows overlooking a surprisingly calming industrial neighborhood.  Coffee is excellent, and the baristas are friendly and don't hold their knowledge over your heard, like a lot of other places in this particular hood.

This is the perfect place to drink whatever the barista recommends and bang out a couple hours of work, read a book in the sun, or catch up with friends.  The default living room for the eastern portion of the Mission.
author: James S.

description:
They get 5* alone for providing fat-free milk as an option along with Almond milk.
Excellent coffee, well made and nice surroundings.
author: Ms. T.

description:
Ok, first thing I noticed about this place that it is full of hipsters!  I'd have to say that 80% of the people here had those thick black framed hipster glasses and were using Macs.  Nothing wrong with that, but pretty interesting, how all the hipsters clusters in this area.  

I also noted that during lunch hours, there is a sign that says to limit computer usage to 30 minutes for other patrons. 

This restaurant serves a variety of coffee, sandwiches, salads, and pastries.  I had the turkey sandwich and it was pretty tasty.  Served on some fancy bread, with cranberry jam, brie cheese, and other veggies.  It made a pretty filling, healthy-ish lunch.  Cashier was friendly too.
author: Patty O.

description:
Kind of want to keep this place a secret - but who am I kidding!? Let's all share in the awesomeness that is the Coffee Bar.

This places puts other coffee spots to shame. The coffee is far superior to anything that is nearby - you know who I mean.  The Havana Latte and Cappuccino are amazing. I'm on a mission to try every coffee drink on the menu, but this is as far as I have gotten so far.

Food wise. There is something for everyone.  Pastries, sandwiches, salads. All are fresh and extra yummy. Portion sizes are right on target.  So far, my faves are the almond croissant, turkey club, and mixed green salad.  

There is a nice mix of seating too. Inside you have a small bar area downstairs and then an upstairs seating area full of tables, communal seating areas, soft, and more bar areas. Lots of plugs for those who want to bring their laptops and get some work done. If you do, please respect the handful of tables with time limits during lunch.

They also have a great patio area for those who prefer to sit outside and enjoy the weather.

You won't be disappointed here.
author: Wendy P.

description:
I. Love. It. Here.

Open, airy, quiet -- lots of outlets, even more semi-hipsters w/ Macbooks -- and delicious caffeiney beverages.

A perfect place to study, gossip w/ a friend, or stop in for a snack if you're in this random hood.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Alert! Alert! New favorite place for a cappuccino and getting some serious work done!

Plenty of space for your laptop and notes with ample chargers if you wanna zone in at one of the lovely upstairs counters OR sit at one of the communal tables and maybe make a friend!

The place was spacious, well-lit and my coffee was quite tasty. I'll be a regular, Coffee Bar. Maybe sometime I'll even come without the macbook and enjoy the outdoor seating.

I only wish you were open a little later into the evening! But I understand, you're just looking out for me. I should be out having a social life and not working then anyways.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I am a  coffee addict and this place is delicious!  When I went to Seattle I had like 5 cups a day searching for the best coffee there was.  I'm impressed that this place meets the high standards of Seattle, the coffee capital of the U.S.

I got my usual - a triple espresso over ice in a large cup.  Then I added my own sweetener and soymilk.  The espresso here is strong without being bitter.  It was brewed perfectly.  They have vanilla soymilk here so it really enhanced the taste of the espresso without that weird soy taste.  They also have the clover machine here!!  Try clover machine made coffee sometime, its the newest cult hit amongst coffee lovers.  I also saw them make cappuccinos for other customers and yes, they do that pretty leaf thing with their milk... skills~

I asked a barista if iced coffee from the clover was possible and he explained to me that it would not taste good because iced coffee is better when it starts out cold brewed - if you hot brew coffee and then ice it, it makes the coffee bitter and not good - gosh, they really know what they're talking about here... I was impressed.

The ambiance is very artsy and modern.  I love that their menu is written on some sort of construction paper hanging on the wall.  This place is also two stories with a large outside patio so there's plenty of seating.  My only complaint is that there was NO AC on this hot San Francisco day... but luckily I was taking my coffee to go.
author: Angela C.

description: I stumbled upon this place haphazardly as I waited for my friend to show up for beers at Dear Mom, a bar nearby. I was greeted by a friendly staff (not the hipster kind you're used to at coffee shops) and ordered the Cuban Sandwich and an Ice Tea ($14). I thought the price was a bit steep but once the food arrived I knew it was worth it. The portions here are BIG! The sandwich came with a fresh salad and I could really only finish half of the whole meal, leaving the rest for the drunk munchies that were sure to find me later that night (I was prepared). There's free wifi and ample seating so I could actually get some work done. I wish I lived nearby so I could frequent this place more often.
author: Raha G.

description: First time here. There are some variables which I check to review coffee shops, taste coffee or anything I get, outlets, wi fi, and available seats. Coffee is more expensive than other places which maybe makes sense due to the location. It's a big place but when I got here on Saturday around 2 pm I couldn't find a spot with an outlet and they were all taken. It took an hour before I found one. Wi fi on my laptop is ok but on my iPhone it goes on and off and this is annoying. Overall cool interior.
author: Majid D.

description:
It was 2:30 and I hadn't had lunch yet. My macbook air was shipped two days ago and I had been dying to take it out for a test run in a cafe so I biked over to coffee bar for lunch + some cafe working. 

I had been to coffee bar a couple of times before but not to sit in. There is a lot of bike parking on the street but I wish they had made space in the patio area for bikes. It would reassure me a little if I could eye my bike while inside. There is extra room on the side near the plants which could be a good spot!

I ordered the Bomba salad which was a special of the day and a drip coffee. At 3pm the place was PACKED.. no room upstairs at all. Luckily it was relatively warm out so I sat outside. My salad came quickly and it was delicious- tons of ingredients and the dressing was tasty. Coffee was average/good for drip. I will be trying an espresso drink next time. 

After sitting outside for 20 mins I started to get cold so I ventured back in for a spot. Also wifi didn't work for me outside, not sure if it was where I was sitting though.I cozied up with 3 other people on a communal table and got to work. 2 hours later and tons of emails and designs done, I realized time had flown by. The same people were still surrounding me mashing away at their laptops and sipping caffeine. I get the feeling there are tons of regulars that frequent coffee bar as they seem lenient about sitting time. There were signs that said between 11:30-2 these tables are laptop free.. definitely a good idea!

Music playing was awesome- I liked the combination of old skool James Brown with current tunes. I didn't have to pop in my headphones :)
author: Seema M.

description:
Five stars for friendliness! They even replied to a tweet once while I was there with my laptop.

Five stars for good coffee, tea, and food!

One star for the crowdedness, and blinders-y attitude of everyone there on their computers (aka me and the rest of the macbook brigade)! Once, I saw one of my favorite video game designers working on a new game -- it was awesome! Once I saw a guy come in with his own mobile wifi and a to-go cup from Peets -- super fucking lame!

This place is clearly a work hangout for us folks on laptops. Sweet staff and good food, but I really can't work there for long because the wifi is so excruciatingly slow. Still, it's nice to get out of the house once in awhile.
author: Melissa T.

description:
It gets hot; it gets hot in the mission district, cut off from the ocean by hills all around, urban heat island, summer, etc. And they don't have AC. Big space and they have only three ceiling fans over maybe 1/4 of the sitting areas, nowhere near enough. In fact the only time I felt a breeze is when a PIGEON flew overhead; in and out... twice.
Another thing is, for a work cafe, the internet is atrociously slow and I have to keep signing back in: i wanted to listen to a podcast during lunch break but it kept failing to download one little podcast (19mb), it's ok if you want to do regular word processing / programming etc with intermittent use of internet, but phone over ip, video conf or streaming forget it.
The number of sitting spots with access to outlets to plug in your machine is about HALF the seating space.
Some cute outdoors seating but when I was stepping out it smelled like steaming garbage (not sure if a truck had just passed by or if it was the garbage behind a partition outside as opposed to behind the shop where places would usually have their garbage?).
A bit on the pricey side; I kept getting their in house cold juice bc of the heat. (some interesting flavors though eg cucumber+strawberry+apple although hint: apple juice is the filler of juice, just look at the ingredients label of your favorite juice at trader joe's whole foods etc, Pectin means apple juice = less of your favorite flavor)

One thing I liked: the mood truly felt like one of a neighborhood community, that was nice (plus one star for that).
I'd like to try this place again on a cool day.
author: Zou Z.

description:
I go to Sugarlump when I'm in the mood for a swanky, Mad Men-esque ambiance, I go to Philz when I want a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, and I go to Coffee Bar for everything else. 

Get their Breakfast Burrito with a Havana Latte, and plop down anywhere in the large, open space which boasts an abundance of outlets. Some other reasons to love Coffee Bar include lovely outdoor patio seating, high ceilings, great music (anything from 2Pac to MGMT) and they now make their own fresh juice! It's hidden away from the hustle of main streets which is also bombtastic. 

Freaking love this place.
author: Julianne M.

description: Nice place to grab food/drink and maybe get some work done. Avocado toast and San Francisco salad (marinated organic tofu, yellow corn, avocado, black beans, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese on california lettuce blend with tomato vinaigrette, $13) are my go-to orders. Lots of table space, wifi, and outlets available. Friendly service.
author: Lily J.

description: What a great place to plant down with a laptop, my spotify, and some coffee. I love to nest for a bit when I can here, they have great coffee and a really nice staff. Go Coffee Bar.
author: Jose D.

description: Great place with fast WiFi, good cookies, and a large bottle of Vietnamese iced coffee that I shouldn't have drank the entirety of. They close somewhat early for me, but other than that, a solid place to get some work done.
author: James R.

description: Decor, sitting, and ambiance is quite nice.  Lots of space and wifi is fast.  Only had tea, but it was freshly brewed.  They also have a combination of indoor/outdoor seating where there is group and individual setup.  This allows a bit of variety where you can change base on your mood of the day.  I would come here if I was in the area again and wanted to focus on work.
author: David L.

description: Everything you want in a coffee shop. Amazing coffee, the proper variety of croissants (almond, butter, chocolate), some weird juice, and glass doors that block out jackhammer noise. Hats off.
author: Christina S.

description:
My studio is in this building and I go to Coffee Bar for my AM buzz. I'm not much for the froo-froo, but hot damn they make a good soy vanilla bean latte.

Coffee Bar's espresso is on point, and they have a lot of nice touches like house-made vanilla simple syrup, fresh fruit and vegetable juices and some verifiably delicious items on grab & go menu. They also make their own chai and - coming from a person who usually hates chai - it's amazing.

I'm not a huge fan of their drip coffee, it's dark (which I like), but it's WAY tangy (which I don't).

My one big gripe is that they are always making amazing looking vegetable soups, but they use chicken broth. There's no good soup in the area and when you're jonesing for a bowl slurpy warmth, nothing else will do. Chicken broth in a vegetable soup is a huge kick to the vegetarian ego. Some things are pricy (pastries, coffee drinks, etc.), however, sandwiches come with enormous side salads, and their breakfast burrito is the size of a small toddler.

Come here to eavesdrop on a conversation about quantum physics or computer programming, or to catch KQED hosts in real life.
author: Red T.

description:
Cortadito or the Havanna Latte, the Latin inspired choices I pondered upon my recent visit at the Coffee Bar, filled me with nostalgia. Reminiscing of my visits to South America, I was reminded of the cafes there as I sipped on my artsy-covered-foamed Havana Latte.  
If you have the time to splurge on a fancy latte, or want a spacious place to work, this hidden cafe is fenced away from the hustle and bustle, offers an abundance of seating with outside patio to enjoy the crisp cool days of SF.
Definitely, a hipster scene with a mix of professionals and creative types, taking advantage of the free wi-fi and focused on what looked like "all mac laptops".  (I confess, I have one too.)
The baristas seemed happy to serve up their eclectic selections of coffee, pastries and sandwiches. 
The free unlimited parking is a plus especially when you want to escape the parking meters of San Francisco.
author: Veronica C.

description: I liked it because  of its ambience.  Its 2 storied, looks like a rustic attic with big windows.  V BRIGHT nd roomy. Wifi is free. Coffee is okayish nd about $4.5 for most of d expresso drinks. Its a nice study spot.
author: Ananya P.

description:
Wandering round the hood today, the sun in peak form, I wandered into Coffee Bar.

It's a dream.

A serious caffeine induced dream.

From the intimate picnic area outside.

To the free wi-fi.

To the open interior which manages to straddle a cool balance between edge and character.

To the What's Up menu. Not your usual cheese on bagel kinda options. But food options which actually took some real thought to concoct and make. 

And on Fridays they host the locally acclaimed nomadic Radio Africa Kitchen - http://www.radioafricakitchen.com/, which is supposed to be on point. And then some.

As I took it all in. The space. The vibe. The beauty of it all, the guy behind the counter - smiled real big and genuine and asked if he could help me. 

He proceeded to make a quality cup of energy for me  - to ease me into the rest of my night (which was def. needed considering my lack of sleep last evening), in between explaining more about the space.

Away from the bustle. The noise. The hype. Coffee Bay stands alone. Lovely. Friendly. And a supremely sweet place to meet up over a hot drink or catch up on work.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Great coffee shop with a lot of people taking up residence to work here on a weekday. They have a server yourself coffee station you pay into a cup. I think every coffee shop should have this amenity. Decaf Americano was tasty and not bitter or burnt tasting. Would go again if in the Mission district.
author: Lauren G.

description: Never order the chicken salad sandwich. It's mostly just runny mayonnaise and wimpy bits of microscopic chicken on a dry, puffy, insipid roll. Overpriced + upsetting.
author: Liam D.

description:
I like this place, but I don't love it.  The coffee's good, if a bit pricey, but my decaf iced mocha is reliably delicious, and less expensive than Ritual.  I don't buy the sandwiches, because they are around $9, and that's too much for a coffee shop sandwich, in my opinion.  The muffin I bought once was just okay, nothing special.  And the barristas are pretty unfriendly and act like they're too cool to speak to the likes of you.

WHEELCHAIR ACCESS:  There IS a ramp into the front entrance so that you can go up and buy a sandwich or coffee, and while there's a BIG staircase to the upstairs where the vast majority of the seating is located, I've been tipped off that THERE IS AN ELEVATOR.  I haven't been to the bathroom here, so I don't know how accessible it is.

So why do I like this place?  I love the space.  I love that there's a big, fenced off outdoor space for sitting in the sun and chatting.  I love the open feeling of the upstairs, with plentiful seating and tables, comfortable but useful.  I like that I can plug my laptop in, enjoy my coffee, and still have a lot of natural light.  While I DO think it's rather cheesy to have oodles of signs all over the place telling people that they can't just drink a cup of coffee in some places unless they buy a sandwich too, I guess that's just part of the attitude that comes with this place.

Which is why I just like, not love, Coffee Bar.  And when I get fed up with the attitude or want a reasonably priced sanwich, I go one block up to the Starbucks, which has ample seating, super-friendly barristas, and doesn't give me crap for where I sit or how much I buy.  But oh, the iced mocha at Coffee Bar is pretty tasty....
author: Amy L.

description:
They're close to my workplace so I finally stopped in for a sandwich. At first I thought, $10 is a lot for a sandwich. Then I opened up my to go box and was pleasantly surprised that not only did I have a decent sized sandwich, I had a big salad too. I was able to have two meals instead of one.

The menu isn't huge and the vibe is pretty cool. They also have an outdoor sitting area so if the weather is nice, then it's a great place to sit and eat.

I can't remember which sandwich I had but it had a slightly spicy sauce on it.
author: Amy J.

description: Way too expensive! $12 for a Cuban sandwich? Come on it's just an average sandwich. Why is so expensive? Besides my sandwich I had a soda and a shot of espresso and my bill added up to $20!  A sandwich should not cost $12 unless Pamela Anderson brings it to the guests' table.
author: Aaron D.

description:
The ONLY reason I'm not giving 5 stars is for very slow service and wifi.

This review is completely to let you know that I lived around the corner and would go to Starbucks in the am for coffee instead of CB because it was just so much faster (not like the coffee is better and blue bottle is $$$).

I'm not sure if other people in the hood also go to Starbucks instead because of this and you're losing money.

I love the staff (contrary to what other people wrote). The food is always fresh (also surprised someone said it wasn't). The Malmec sando is the best! 

Hoping this review is helpful for you!
author: Kate C.

description:
Coffee sure has come a long way.

Gone are the flimsy paper cups of yesterday and the loud hustle and bustle of old men with aprons, shouting out orders over a stove.  Gone are the days of standard drip who-knows-what.....oily sludge that lay like a tar pit at the bottom of a chipped mug.

No.  

Coffee places have truly evolved into something bigger and laying down standard after standard of outdoing the previous.  My visits to Seattle have substantiated this.....the coffee shops are now lounges.  They have become trendy open spaces that no longer require a gaggle of books in tow, including the customary nerd.  A spot of relaxation.  To socialize.  To catch up.  Spots are seeing a change in clientele.  I counted several heels in the place, hitting up the caffeine prior to hitting the bars.

Coffee Bar does this and expounds upon the new aesthetic with a creative precision that leaves one looking forward to more inventive surprises.  The loft-like appeal is the first thing that greets the eye and in this part of SF, the sun surely is a guaranteed welcome.

Minimal.  Spacious.  Wide open windows.  My sort of quiet space to revel in small conversations whilst holding my place in a current novella.  The lattes here are a winner.  Smooth.  Strong.  The beans have been roasted quite right.  No bitter aftertaste.  The perfect place to reflect, amongst friends, about the mindless choices of the aging past.  On top of caffeination, feel free to browse their menu for lighter cafe fare.....our neighbor was nibbling on a sandwich that was equally inviting.

I miss the chatter and the hustle and bustle of the coffee shops during my visit to New York, but what stereotypical energy is lacking here, is made up in volumes by an imaginative modernity that is both inviting and timeless.
author: Miika M.

description: This place is the cutest. The coffee is really yummy, and they have food! This location is pretty big if you're interested in grabbing a bite, some coffee, and do some work. Outdoor seating as well!
author: Melissa S.

description:
My office away from my office. Great coffee, decently priced breakfast and lunch menus, homemade caramel for my latte and a ton of seating. The ambiance is bright and fresh and makes getting work done not so arduous.   Staff is super friendly especially food servers. Outdoor seating is a plus and it's really clean. I also appreciate the music choices and that they keep it to background noise levels.

A few things could be better. The Wi-Fi cuts out often and has to be re-booted-- yes, this is a luxury I know-- but It's a little distracting. Also  a wee more PB & J in the PB&J  sandwich would be great!!  It's mostly bread which isn't fun.
author: Uda W.

description: Definitely an overhyped place. I came here on sunday afternoon and it is freaking crowded. Music is loud and noisy. Drinks are mediocre. Not a good place to work at all
author: Ngan P.

description:
Malcolm  Gladwell should certainly write a New Yorker article about this place.

The food while high quality is way over priced, but then shouldn't it be when a few are covering the cost of most of the customers in there? "The most" are (you know the end of the human race types) free loading as much as they can. Indeed this explains their 5 star reviews. WTF am I talking about? Unspoken payment in kind for all of the free real estate, that's what I'm talking about.

If you're there to eat lunch outside of the lap-top free zone, you'll end up sharing a table outside (where the sunlight prohibits lap-top use and makes me think of opening up an all outdoor coffee shop of my own) with people who only speak French so you there is no hope of at least making a new friend out of the deal. [I know there is some altruist right now blaming me because I don't speak French. F--- You!]

I'll go back there for another $24 salad and a sandwich one more time (skipping the $3 coffee since I have to wait in line and pay full price to get a refill). If the guy is as rude as he was yesterday, I'll edit this review to 1 star though. And G--damnit don't think that I won't!!! 

See even the people spending money can use Yelp as a divisive tool. It's not an art saved just for the freeloaders who don't want their lily pad to sink.

I'd rate the picture of coffee below as helpful if it was bleeding money.
author: Marc R.

description:
Coffee Bar has all the amenities one needs for a perfect coffee shop: natural lighting, good food/coffee, indoor and outdoor seating, big tables for workspace, good music, friendly staff, and plenty of parking in the area. In essence, this place is awesome! While the food is a bit on the pricier side of things (my main reason for the four stars rather than five stars), the sandwiches, baked goods, and salads are delicious and pretty filling if you're swingin' by for a quick lunch or brunch meet-up. As for the drinks, they've got a variety of drinks and even have a few specialty drinks including a sweet Vietnamese Iced Coffee and a Vanilla Bean Iced Latte (both of which I've tried and recommend). 

In terms of the location, the place is a bit obscure especially since there's a gated entrance down the street from Starbucks near Bryant St. But once you're found this place, I'm sure you'll be stopping by again! This is definitely a great place to get some work done and I'd recommend coming here on a warm day with an iced coffee and some light reading!
author: Cheston W.

description:
don't get me wrong, i love my local coffee shop that sells homemade Russian baked goods and brews excellent Ritual coffee, but ever since I went to Coffee Bar on the first sunny morning in way too long I've found myself waking up and wishing I could be at Coffee Bar. It's just that good. 
why is it so good? location. light. ambiance. service. sophistication. whoever runs this place is very very very experienced at running a food service because it seems they have ironed out all the kinks. 

but honestly, I'm obsessed with Coffee Bar because they sell Patisserie Philippe aka King of Almond Croissants. He bakes a few items for the place I work, but it's only about once or twice a month that he graces me with a special Almond Croissant which only leaves me dreaming for more. If Coffee Bar was my local, I could get my dosage on a regular basis. Now that would be dangerous.
author: Libra J.

description: Probably my favourite place to do work in SF. Great coffee, lots of space, and plenty of sockets to plug in ur laptop.
author: Yousef K.

description:
Perhaps the utmost delicious mocha I've had to date: dark, complex, & nutty. I was compelled to order this drink iced, as I normally would have preferred. But I trusted my instinct that the velvety Guittard chocolate which was advised as, "fine" by my barista would be more ganache-like in texture and viscosity, and best served warm.

I also had a flaky cheese & parsley scone to nibble on as I proceeded on my way.. I'm quite glad I woke up early and decided to take a leisurely alternative route to work. 

Subtle Exterior, Spacious interior, Succulent Garden

I believe I may have just discovered my new morning/pre-work ritual that is out of the realm of sleeping-in, over-sleeping, or leisurely resting my eyes while half-asleep.  Damn, I may just have to become a morning person.. so worth it!
author: Ty T.

description: good coffee and nice location. Love the  layout of the place and love sipping coffee in sunny patio.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Great lofty space, very simple straight-lines decor. Another spot popular by the MacMuppies (see previous review for Summit). Lots of outlets, including under the tables! Genius! No need to bring the extension cord. Coffee and food are nothing special. But alcoholic drinks are served, and having a cold beer whilst working is always nice. (Yes, I'm actually working from here)

As I write this, news has come out of Steve Jobs' death. How much he's influenced our lives as I look around and see Macs, iPhones, and iPads. I think he would've liked the minimalistic design of this place. RIP Steve Jobs.
author: Ai S.

description: I really love the layout of this place, outdoor and indoor seating. Pre-made grab and go food, fairly decent coffee. However, these guys are so incredibly slow it deters me from being a regular. It took 20 minutes to make a cappuccino on a quiet afternoon, 15 minutes for a latte. The folks working the cash register aren't very responsive or friendly, and much of the seating gets taken up by people working on laptops. Nice place, if you have the time!
author: hillary b.

description: The best Chai Latte ever! FYI - they run out of sweets by mid-day. Plenty of seating (both indoor and out). Definitely coming back for another chai the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: mary c.

description: Came here and got the Havana Latte to go. Parking in the area sucks, so if you're taking it to go just drop someone off to pick up the drinks and wait in your car. They take cash and card so you don't have to worry about having enough cash in your pocket. The latte itself was pretty tasty and it was lightly sweetened where it didn't overpower the flavor of the coffee beans itself but also gave it a refreshing twist. I would like to order it again but probably wouldn't come all the way out here, if I"m in the financial district I will probably opt for that location.
author: Jeromy G.

description: iewww the veggies sandwich is disgusting and they totally skimped on the ingredients. I had to add some of my salad into the sandwich to make it more palatable. The least you can do is toast the bread. I had to force feed myself this $10 nastiness. You can tell the person that designed this sandwich never bit into it.
author: J S.

description:
It's hard to imagine a better coffee shop.
Not only does Coffee Bar offers the City's best latte, but the best work space for getting things done. Plenty of seating from counter to community tables, lots of plugs, great food, fantastic WiFi and genuinely nice folks working there. Parking can be a bitch, but it's not their fault. Once you do find a space you'll never have reason to leave.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Love this place. Located on a corner, it's the perfect little hidden gem for a very strong custom-made, fresh brewed coffee. If you're used to Starbucks - this isn't the place for you....BUT - if you enjoy coffee and good atmosphere, then you need to try this place ASAP!

You'll love it. 5stars 'cause their service was great!
author: Yasmin R.

description:
Solid place to lounge and grab a cup of coffee.  Nice high ceilings with tons of light and wifi.  On a nice day, the have a little garden outside to enjoy the sun.  In addition, the high ceilings diffuse the sound so even though people are talking, it is not very noisy.

The desert offerings are a little sparce and the Chai that I had was really weak and lacking flavor which explains the 3 stars instead of 4.  

But go here for the vibe and to relax and chat with friends.  Dont have high expectations for the drinks or food.
author: Scott C.

description:
AMAZING!!!! 
This is the kind of cafe that a southern california girl dreams about in SF. What a great atmosphere and vibe inside. It's spacious, comfy, and hip. As I was walking in, I was greeted by all these earthy plants and cacti, it was so refreshing. There is a huge tree up in the middle of the second floor, how cute!  The hanging lights against the wall there are really unique, too. 

reasons why it's great for studying: big tables, well lit (love the natural light that comes in near the windows upstairs!), lots of outlets, free wifi, great music!!, cool people, great food, a huge selection of coffee and other drinks. Can't speak for the beer, but the coffee and hot chocolate seem reasonably priced. The capuccinos and lattes here are UNREAL. Never knew that coffee could taste that good. yum. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THE HAVANA LATTE.

Not as crowded (parking also easier to find) in the late afternoon, but you will definitely enjoy your time here. Lots of friendly people who are in start-ups will make conversation with you :)
author: Tuwie N.

description:
Hands down one of the best espressos in San Francisco. I have been hunting for this cup of coffee for a long time. They use Mr Espresso Neapolitan espresso beans, which is an amazing medium to dark roast, completely different than the light roast trends that have invaded this city. 

The staff is fantastic. Super friendly, happy to talk about the coffee they use, where it comes from, and the equipment they use.
author: Eric M.

description: Love the fact that they have outlets and free wifi. I had a Jasmine Tea, it's simple but great. The place is also nicely decorated, suitable for chilling.
author: Joie H.

description:
These guys provide service with a smile, in a neighborhood better known for its surly hipsters.

I ordered a cafe au lait and a vegetarian burrito. They were both excellent.
The cafe au lait even arrived with latte art (!), which is a rare - and much appreciated - aesthetic touch for this coffee drink (the substrates are lower contrast, so it's harder to do..).
author: Noam S.

description:
I come here pretty much every weekday.  Usually in the mornings, but the occasional lunch has happened here as well, especially when I need to grab something quick to bring back to the office.  The service is impeccable.  I love the barista.  She always knows my order, is super friendly, and she always puts a smile on my face...even on one of those grumpy mornings.  She also knew my name by the third time I visited.  Really...awesome.

The chai is wonderful.  Spicy.  Perfect. And great, hot or cold.  I have been told that the coffee is really good as well.  Strong and packs a punch.  Their bottled juices (especially the beet and the kale), makes me feel like I am drinking little bits of heaven.  And, there is booze.  Which, is always a plus for an alcoholic like myself.

As for the food, eh...it's ok.  I always try to make it there early before the lunch rush (if I decide to go to go there for lunch) so I can get one of the pre-made quinoa bowls.  With a little hot sauce, they are really good.  But, they sell out quickly.  And it is always a bummer when I don't get one.  The pre-made sandwiches are a bit bland and blah.  But, as I have stated before, I am not a fan of sandwiches.  So, I should not be the best judge.  But, their salads are just meh also. 

Overall, it is an enjoyable spot that I enjoy coming to and will continue to go to.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Mojitos, Dirty Dancing Havana Nights, Cigars, Buena Vista Social Club, Classic 50's cars.

And now Havana Lattes dreamily drank at Coffee Bar.

Thank goodness for all things Cuban.
author: Jane K.

description:
I absolutely love this place. Free wifi. Outdoor and indoor seating. Parking is abundant but pretty difficult to get around lunch time. Awesome studying location. Gets a little packed, but you will always find a seat. Their sandwiches never fail me and neither do their coffee drinks. I've tried most of their daily sandwiches and all are delicious. Not a fan of their salads though. 

Favorites:
- Vanilla latte (25 cents more for a 16 ounce. You should just get it)
- Almond Croissant
- Salmon Sandwich
- Melmac  Sandwich (vegetarian)

Not a fan:
- Pear salad
- Tonno salad
- Chocolate croissant (decent.. but prefer the almond croissant)

Highly recommend this place!
author: Annie T.

description:
This has become my favorite getting things done coffee place. The service has always been great.

There is plenty of space as long as you arrive before 10:30am on the weekends. There are power outlets underneath the bar on the top floor. 

I really like the Cuban Latte and Cappuccino. I usually opt for the brie and ham baguette sandwich if i am hungry. It's delicious.
author: Filip M.

description: Hands down best cobb salad in the city, and an amazing atmosphere to boot.
author: Eliza D.

description:
It pains me to have to write a less than glowing review for a place that used to be my favorite working and meeting spot in the city.  As I've mentioned in reviews of other cafes, I'm a 5-day a week cafe worker and so certain elements are critically important to my ability to be productive in an environment with good and reasonably priced food and drinks with accessibility to power.  I'll go down the list of how Coffee Bar now rates in each category.

1.  Productivity Vibe = 5/5
Coffee Bar is basically a coworking space without the monthly fees.  People all around you are working hard on their laptops writing dissertations, coding and designing websites, working on their startups, and having informal business meetings.   If you sit and check your email and Facebook all day you will likely feel like a loser, so I give the productivity vibe full points.

2.  Ambiance/Comfort of Space = 3/5
Coffee Bar gets points for having a variety of work stations to choose from: a high bar with stools, couches, small tables, and large communal tables.  The issue is that they often keep the front door open during the lunch hours and it's FREEZING.  It doesn't matter if it's 50 degrees out, you may often find the front door propped open and the ceiling fans spinning while you search your bag for a scarf and put on your coat.  On occasion I've had to leave because it was so uncomfortably chilly, and my friends that I've worked there with have noted the same thing.  However, they do get an extra point for having a nice patio where you can eat and work.  

3.  Power Outlets = 5/5
Plenty of outlets to work with, although I always bring a 3-pronged extension cord to share.

4.  Free Wifi access = 3/5
The wifi is free, but the access is only 75%  reliable.  When it's working it's working fine, but there have been several occasions when the internet goes down and I have to leave.

5.  Good, reasonably priced food and drinks = 3/5
Several months ago Coffee Bar changed chefs and revamped their menu, and unfortunately it was not for the better.  Their food used to be something that I looked forward to, an incentive to get things done so that I could enjoy a yummy lunch.  Now I only eat there if I'm starving.  The "grilled cheese" is more like cheese melted on dry toast in a toaster oven with some cold spinach leaves thrown in, and the turkey club sandwich has a horrible ketchup-drenched lettuce-like concoction on it that ruins the sandwich.  The soups are "meh" (bread soup, aka chicken broth with pureed bread or something like it), and most of the sandwiches are disappointing considering you'll be forking over $9-10 for them.  I hope they bring back their old menu!
author: Yea A.

description:
Yeah, i want to like this place. I even tried to make it my local for a while. Who couldn't argue with the airy space, minimalist decor and patio. But it just doesn't get there.

Service: Slow. I know it's only coffee, but somehow the time it takes to make a drink there feels like forever. I just don't think the staff can multitask

Hours: annoying. There are 3 theatres on the same corner, but this place closes by 7pm, so you can't get a drink before the show.

Laptops: Sigh. way to many of them, don't even think of being able to get a seat there. I've walked in, seen no space to sit, and just walked out again. 

Here's a tip: If you have to put up a sign asking people to make room for patrons during lunchtime, you're doing it all wrong.
author: Geoff H.

description:
Cafe cortado and Bostock brioche. 

Had a great visit recently to Coffee bar. Much like any other industrial/artsy area coffee bar. It caters to lap top toting folks with fixed gears and paper work to kill. 
Great place to hang out and catch up and for your early morning weekend cup of coffee. Friendly coffee counter service and knowledgeable baristas. :)

parking kinda sucks from 9-5 since there are warehouses in the area, and well, people need to park right?

Cafe Cortado was great, just like a simple espresso macchiato. 

the Bostock: Moistened with vanilla/ orange simple syrup and a almond meal/sliced almond crust. Brioche goodness.
author: Art N.

description:
Probably my favorite coffee place in the city.

They have fantastic strong coffee.  And their food is great too!

Try the TURKEY SANDWICH when they have it.  Come with cranbery sauce, brie, greens and turkey, along with a side salad.  Yum.  Must try!
author: Jonathan C.

description: not enough seating but the coffee was good! Had the vietnamese coffee and it hit the spot!
author: Susan Y.

description:
Haven't tried the food here yet but loved the coffee and pastries. I'm not in San Fran all too often as I currently live in LA but this place is on a par with my Favorite coffee place in LA, Intelligencia. Great atmosphere 

Definitely coming back here next time I'm up north.
author: Laura P.

description: Love the: coffee, tea, food, ambient music, and overall industrious, hip vibe of this place.  Do not love the: frequency with which you get kicked off the internet (and thereafter have to re-accept the terms of use to reconnect); bathroom lines; janky bathroom door knob; difficulty finding parking in the neighborhood; and difficulty finding a place to sit once inside.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Need an alternative office for the day? Coffee Bar should be at the top of that list.

They have a very cool setting for working -- a bar set up or tables. Some of the tables are blocked for "non-laptop" use, meaning if you come in for lunch, you theoretically should still be able to find a spot to sit in the sea of MacBooks.

Coffee Bar is more than just coffee, too. Their food is phenomenal - sandwiches and salads are always great, made with very fresh ingredients and creative combinations. AND their Earl Grey tea is amazing. Best I've had in a long time. 

Coffee bar is great with your laptop during the week, or a book and a cup of tea for weekend relaxing. On a nice day, there's even great outside space. If you live in the 'hood (or even if you don't), it's worth a stop.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
Love the cafe for this ambience, space and service!!

I have only one grievance - why is the food always so consistently mediocre? 

I know that's not their specialty, but seriously....I hope they take a look at their menu and try to tweak it.  Just ate their breakfast burrito and it was probably one of the worst I've had in the city with far too many potatoes and spices that didn't meld. 

Over the past few years, I've given up on eating anything on their menu or their pastries (which are about as good as Starbucks even though they come from a good bakery supposedly).  

On a positive note, their beverages are awesome and their salads are good!

Sorry, Coffee Bar, you're my favorite cafe to hang in the city and I tell all my friends to vist, but I'd probably spend 100x more time here if the food was yummier.
author: S C.

description:
Great spot for coffee, food, or working.  The layout is perfect and some of the tables have electrical outlets.

I have had the drip coffee, latte, & mocha- all were tasty.
author: Christy L.

description: The coffee and space is excellent, however the food is becoming increasingly disappointing. The food doesn't taste fresh, get that right and I'll be more happy to come here regularly for food. More like a 2 1/2 star review
author: Rio A.

description: Good food. Good atmosphere. Very busy. Too bad the internet is slow and not very steady
author: Gab M.

description:
The good: Nice decor, outdoor seating, and pretty good food.

Sounding like a good spot, right? 
No, avoid unless you want to wait forever to get the most simple of things and be treated with no respect from their hipster staff. I have been here many times as it is right next to my office, but the last straw has been reached and I will not return.

Typical experience is as follows. Walk in and get in line behind 4-5 other people. There are 4 staff behind the counter, so you think it will move along. After being in line 10 minutes and only to have 2 people helped you remember where you are and it is going to be a long haul. Meanwhile staff is chatting and laughing it up the whole time. Finally you get to order, but have to wait while the person behind the counter finishes their conversation, then their personal phone rings and they actually have the balls to answer it. (This is where I walked out last time). Lets say you decide to stay though and wait again for the person to finish their conversation. Place order to go and they ask your name 3 times, "it is JOHN" damn it, come on, it is simple. Hopefully you do not have a unique name or they will openly make fun of your name in front of you, this happened to 2 co-workers. Place your order and take a seat, it is going to be a while. 
It will take a minimum of 20 minutes for any order. You want a bagel and cream cheese, 20 minutes. Peanut butter and jelly, 20 minutes. 
This place is 5 minutes from our office, but you have to allot 40 minutes to get coffee and a bagel because of their completely incompetent staff. 

Oh, and did I say that you get to pay above average prices for that lovely service. 
No thanks, not going back. Can't believe I gave them that many chances.
author: John N.

description:
I come to Coffee Bar a lot because I work down the street and I'm a big fan. 

Their coffee is legit, the to-go sandwiches and made-to-order food is delicious and their staff is super friendly. My only complaint is that it's a tad over priced in my opinion but I don't mind supporting them. 

Pro-tip: their cookies are a total guilty pleasure.
author: Rachel C.

description:
This place is always packed, but for good reason. A nice, comfy place with free wifi and tons of power plugs that allow you to plug in your laptop. On top of that, no one cares how long you stay (although you are asked to make room for people who have food). 

What makes this place great for me is that the coffee is good. There are many places in San Francisco that will let you sit for as long as you like. But Coffee Bar gives you a reason to choose their place over another -- they actually care what they serve. 

The music is a bit loud sometimes, so it's not a good place to camp out, if you expect to make any calls, but otherwise, it's a good place to work and hang out.
author: Mariko F.

description:
This is by far my most favorite work spot of all time. I usually do my hw here and stay here almost for long hours. I love it because the tables are shared, so that it promotes socializing while also being able to work as well. 

Everyone is always friendly that I've encountered here and the baristas are super sweet! 

I really love the coffee here, and I order countless times of the iced Vietnamese coffee and 1 Caramelized Hazelnut Financier....sooooooo good!!!!!

This is definitely my most favorite place to read and do some sketching! Also it is great if you wanna work on your computers. There's so many outlets, hard to find in sf......

Great interior constructed design...lofty warehouse concrete industrial looking....love it! This is def one of my most favorite places I was a regular.
author: Rae R.

description:
Good place to grab coffee and a snack, and work for a little while. Plenty of seating space most of the time (thought it does get a bit crowded), and almost enough electrical outlets to plug in your laptop & phone if you're running out of juice.

I usually stick with plain old black coffee or iced coffee, so I can't give a comprehensive review of all the coffee options (of which there are many). But the food was very good: good pastries, salads, and snacks.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Was looking for a coffee place with a patio considering how great the weather was outside, the Coffee Bar seemed up to the task. 

Very cool coffee/snack/breakfast type establishment, with seating/tables/free wifi and a little patio area outside. Coffee was well made, decently priced, and the staff were super friendly. While I didn't try any of the pastries or food, there seemed to be a brisk business with a lot of people ordering food.

Definitely a place I'd go back to. Street parking is currently free, though that could change with the addition of all the meters that seem to be spreading across Potrero...

Please note that even though the address is 1890 Bryant, it's really just around the corner on Florida and Mariposa.
author: Paul G.

description:
We came here on a beautiful sunny day in search of patio seating and a coffee fix, definitely found what we were looking for! My latte was perfectly made, we tried their iced coffee for the first time too and it was phenomenal, the kind of thing you can really drink a lot of on a warm, lazy day. 

The outdoor patio is fantastic, although you have to play eagle eyes to snag a seat when one opens up. 

Love this place in the financial district, love this location too!
author: Alyssa G.

description: Every story has a main character who usually has a foil. The main character in this story is Coffee Bar. The sad foil is Stable Cafe. Physically separated by a few blocks they are galaxies apart when it comes to the quality of the food, staff and facilities. I go to Coffee Bar for the coffee. And the cold pressed juice. And the great service at the coffee bar. And the yummy pastries. You get it, whatever I score there is awesome. Stable is like a crazy unreliable hot girl you date because, well, just because you can't hep yourself. Coffee bar is marriage material.
author: Gary C.

description: Who's in charge of this place lately?  I used to come in all the time. The last couple of times I've been in, there are two competing sound systems.  I asked about this last time, and they sort of shrugged, "yeah, the kitchen has a radio."  I'm a back-of-house girl, and started the culinary side of my career as a pot-washer, so I KNOW what's up in kitchens. My owners/chefs NEVER would have let us have a radio interfering w/ the front-of-house scenario.  So much for the customer experience huh.  It's totally chaotic.  Blech.
author: m h.

description:
Two measly stars for all the times I've had to wait and wait for my order.  I've finally come to the realization that Coffee Bar is certifiably, chronically SLOW!!! I work really close by and have frequented this place plenty of times for the supposed convenience. But it seems like every other time I go there to order a sandwich the wait is 15 minutes... for one sandwich or salad! Today at 2:30 pm, with just a few people ordering, it was about 25 minutes! For one sandwich!  The food is decent but this chronic slowness is unacceptable and it doesn't seem like they are ever going to improve their service so I just won't go there anymore.

By comparison, Rhea's, Acme, Salumeria and even Slow Club nearby all consistently whip out your lunch order within 10 minutes --so what's the problem Coffee Bar?
author: susan s.

description:
Good morning, Coffee Bar. As one of the only good spaces to do work in, I would say I can see why all of the creatives (aka Mac users) come here.  The openness and the sunshine coming into the space just makes your more productive, no? Well, it makes me want to always do work. 

Well, that and the coffee is  yummy. 

I had an all bacon dinner here a couple months ago by Good Foods Catering : http://coffeebar-usa.com/all-bacon-dinner-by-good-foods-catering
and it just shows how versatile CB can be.
author: Kris O.

description:
Despite my difficulties in navigating to Coffee Bar, it still gets 5 stars.

The address listed for Coffee Bar on this Yelp page really throws off the directionally challenged (aka yours truly). I pulled up to 1890 Bryant and was puzzled by the gated entrance to what appeared to be a closed artist/loft space. Luckily, street parking is plentiful and the drivers aren't nearly as much of a hurry as they are around Union Square, so I was able to circle around confusedly for a little bit before I spotted Coffee Bar around the corner, on Florida. 

Coffee Bar is by far the most spacious coffee establishment I've had the privilege of patronizing. Two stories, plenty of tables, and high ceilings make for a refreshing change from the cramped (although cute!) coffee places I usually frequented. I also like that they're generous with the amenities - self-serve water fountain with plenty of clean glasses, Wifi that doesn't crap out on you every 5 seconds, lots of seating, and plenty of outlets. 

Lastly, and most importantly, they've got caffeinated drinks that are to die for. I ordered a Havana latte (latte with condensed milk) that was rich without being heavy, foamy without being bland/annoying, and bursting with deep complex flavor. Seriously, is this what everybody gets to drink in Cuba? Sign me up for the Communist Party!
author: Sherry W.

description:
Perfect for brunch on the weekend - kickin' it on the outdoor patio. Knowledgeable baristas serving Mr. Espresso coffee-- definitely something to be proud of.
 First of all, I can't gush enough about a fresh Guatemala brew with a Rip Van Wafel. DO IT. This pair is a match made in heaven.
or - if black coffee is not your bag, try the cortado (a barista favorite) : turbinado sugar melts into just the right amount of  frothy milk over espresso. Also ... be ready to be wowed by the latte art. lovely
author: Jama L.

description: Coffee Bar may be out of the way, but I think this fact adds to its charm. I walked in on a warm day mid-Feb to a slow moving single fan. But the internal heat was not enough to deter me from at least trying the venue. I ordered a drip coffee and a mushroom sandwich from an inviting cashier and scurried upstairs with my coffee and number. Although packed, there was enough customer churn to allow for a quick seat. And hallelujah, there are electrical outlets everywhere. As soon as I was settled, a scrumptious sandwich and generous side salad - lightly dressed - greeted me in exchange for the aforementioned number on a stick. After completing the meal, I connected to a mostly effective free wifi connection. All in all, a good place to get some work done... and to people watch if you like that sort of thing.
author: David K.

description:
I wish we had places like this in the south bay.

Maybe I'm not the best judge, because I live in such a culturally impoverished area, but anywhere where I can get either a good coffee or a good beer is a special place to me. There were plenty of stylist attractive people around, the atmosphere was pleasant and attractive, and what else do you need.

When I was there, they were doing this http://gamenight.homefrys.com/, which was awesome, but that's not a normal thing, so I won't go into detail about it! (If it was, I would drive up there twice a month, probably).
author: Carl W.

description:
Stopped in after the meal at Burma Superstar.  Since it's a Sat afternoon, I was surprised to find the place fully packed with most folks on laptops.  

I decided to try their drip coffee instead of the latte.  It was excellent.  Strong without being bitter.  The chocolate chip cookie was good too.  Next time, I am going to try their Dynamo Donuts that I read so much about.
author: Paul K.

description: Came here to get some work done, and it was the perfect place to do so. Great coffee/espresso combined with plenty of workspace left me 100% satisfied. The prices were also very good for the quality and ambiance. I will return.
author: John L.

description:
Wound up here with the hubby after a long bike exploration of the great SF! We each ordered cappuccinos and settled into one of the only open tables in this huge space! They were so busy, and with free wifi, I understand why. The coffee was amazingly smooth and dare I say, some of the best in the city. Their food looked really delicious as well, and I'm looking forward to trying it next time I visit.

Great coffee shop/work space. If you're in the neighborhood, check it out!
author: Emily S.

description:
Even though Coffee Bar is kind of in the middle of nowhere, it's worth the trek because it:
(1) is a coffee shop you can work at as long as you want, with outlets and space, and not feel like you are overstaying your welcome
(2) has huge windows and gets great light during the day
(3) makes good coffee but also offers an array of fresh-squeezed juices and pretty classy food
(4) is a nicely thought out concept, in terms of floor layout (you get your coffee on the first floor, then go up the stairs to sit down) and is aesthetically pleasing with its little pots of shrubbery and plants
(5) has an outdoor seating area for sunny days

Coffee is on the pricey side as this is one of those "gourmet coffee" establishments, but if that's your jive, you'll love this place. Baristas are nice here too, which is always a plus.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Loved my Havana Latte = $3.75. Loved the unpretentious barista and cashier. Loved how the sun shone on my back while enjoying my caffe latte art. There is some outdoor seating for a warm day.

Parking - unlimited hours on a couple of streets near by. It's a hit or miss.

Not sure how strong the wifi is or if there are enough outlets.  

Will be back!
author: Jboogie L.

description:
They still have good coffee and food but their service has turned to pure fecal matter.

Having recently taken on the role of motherhood, I always drink decaf these days.  And with the lovely weather we've been having, I've been wandering over to the Coffee Bar and grabbing a coffee and sitting outside on their patio.  I have had four orders in a row messed up.  Now I grant you they are very nice and fix it immediately. However, when I pointed out the fact that I'd had an order messed up FOUR times running, the barista says to me that you know, you get into a rush and just make what most people order.  Dude - it was 11:20 which is not lunch rush as I recall.  There were a few people in line and it wasn't out the door.  I repeated the order twice since the cashier was distracted the first time.   

I like to patronize local, but I think I'll keep going down the block to Starbucks.  At least they can keep an order straight.
author: Jana T.

description: Great spot! Wifi works great, had a decent mushroom sandwich, the jasmine green tea is very strong (I'm on 4th cup now, and it still tasted good). Plenty of space for folks with laptops. Overall a great spot!
author: Olga A.

description:
This really isn't the type of place I would have gone into if a friend hadn't suggested it. Why? Because it's so contemporary and full of laptoppers, and I prefer dinghy hippie cafes that are now extinct.

Their tasty arugula salad and tea selection charmed me into returning. The patio is lovely when the winds aren't too strong. And one Sunday some friends wanted a "quick brunch" --which is a huge San Francisco oxymoron-- but a brainwave led us here and they provided a satisfying snack for us all without the typical wait.
author: Jaina D.

description: First time here since it's close by to work. I was on my way to blue bottle but I was curious by the sign so I stopped by. Really cute place! Love the feel of the place! I ordered their latter and it's really good must try!
author: Serena W.

description:
Yeah, yeah, yeah this place is crawling with hipsters but are we all really surprised? This is SF... 

The space itself is actually really nice. And this part of the neighborhood is always pretty quiet so it makes for a peaceful spot both on the porch and inside.  While I'm not a devoted hipster, I think I could easily find myself wanting to read or study here if I needed to get out of my apartment. 

But beyond the ambiance, the coffee at this place is REALLY good.  Blue Bottle remains my favorite and deserve about 7 stars on the 5-star-Yelp-scale, but Coffee Bar easily earns it's 4 stars.  I've now tried both their cappuccinos and lattes and think the espresso beans are really unique and delicious.  The more specialty drinks (namely Vietnamese coffee and other drinks with condensed milk) look promising as well.  

The food menu seems to be pretty simple, but is always fresh and based on whatever they get in that day (or so they told me).  Looks to be only about 2-4 breakfast and lunch items per day.  The baked goods were also super good - I don't know if they make them in house, but damn, I was impressed. 

If you're a coffee enthusiast and are into more local shops in SF, this is a must-try.  I will definitely be coming back here (particularly since the parking seems to be pretty easy too).
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Their coffee is the best in sf!!! I'm obsessed with the vanilla bean latte. They infuse it with real vanilla beans. Great selection of espresso beverages. Think Vietnamese coffee, cold brewed coffee, caramel lattes with homemade caramel syrup. Delicious! Super busy during the week with people on their laptops.  You will be lucky to snag a table.
author: Victoria O.

description:
Luigi - the store lead at this location - wrote me a personal note apologizing for the technical difficulties. I support small businesses actively reaching out to their customers to provide better services so +1 star, for that.

Since my first visit there, I've returned a few times and the WiFi hasn't been perfect, but the time I wrote my review was definitely the worst time I've experienced it. Now, I'm more inclined to depend on it, than not depend on it, but still: bring your own WiFi hotspot, just in case. +1 more star, for that.
author: Terry A.

description:
So I really like this place....when its not crowded. Which isn't very often. The kitchen is generally slow and they only have one register.

Coffee Bar serves well for a sit down cafe experience. The coffee is great, the pastries are delicious and the food is decent. 

Just don't expect to pop in and out if you order food. Even if you call ahead...chunk out a 15 minute wait in line just to pick up your "to go" food.
author: Jay H.

description:
I am a fan of Coffee Bar. Tragically, I blame them for turning me into a coffee snob and ruining coffee for me anywhere else (except for Philz.) 

If you come here for coffee you have to try the Havana Latte - it's a transporting experience. Their home made caramel and vanilla are also worth writing home about (for an epic caramel or vanilla latte - but Havana is my favorite.)

Worth noting is their food here (in their Mission location.) Everything is simple and delicious and made on the premises. Most noteworthy is their breakfast burrito (they put poached eggs inside so you bite into it to experience oozy eggy dreamy deliciousness.)

The architecture is beautiful - it makes you want to order everything "for here". Please do.
author: D Z.

description: I wanted to order a salad and asked to switch chicken for tuna (I don't eat meat) and they wanted to charge me $5 extra. It was already a $13 dollar salad! Their excuse was there was no way to do it in their system. Ridiculous. The food is not that good.
author: Danielle G.

description: This place is cool.  A 2 story coffee/tea place where you can get some work done, or grab a drink with a friend.  I think this is related to the Coffee Bar on Montgomery in the Financial District (?), and if so, this location has a much more coffee shop type of vibe.  Definitely like this place.
author: Mel G.

description:
Brightly lit with natural light, high-ceilings, and lots of open space- this is a cute cafe to get your caffeine fix and some work done. Although my friends and I came after brunch, this place also offers a good selection of sandwiches, salads, soups, and breakfast options if you'd like to grab a bite to eat as well (their sandwich looked super tasty so I'll probably stop by soon to check those out). They have "bar-seatings" with lots of outlets available for you to park your laptop and communal seatings (bigger tables to share) if you're more friendly and willing to share your space. 
They play music in the background but nothing too distracting. If you need a quiet space, then I'd recommend to look elsewhere because this cafe brings out just about everyone- friends catching up over coffee, students/professionals studying/working on the wkend, or chillers who just need a place to sip on some tasty coffee and read a book. Enjoy!
author: Patricia K.

description:
Mission alley hideaway - a great spot!

First thing you notice, it's a cyclists locale, lots of bikes locked up outside.
Next thing, outdoor seating in the sun.

Inside, delicious food menu filled with creative sandwiches, salads and a soup of the day. Also available, coffee and baked goods.

Good to note, this place seems to have free wifi and lots of room to set up and do work or whatnot. Very chill space.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I've been here several times with clients and associates.  When dining in, you can't help but feel a little out of place if you don't have a laptop... specifically a Mac.  The food is very good, offers a lot of flavor, and nice presentation.  The have nice portions, but chances are you wont have any leftovers.  I LOVE their Shizam sandwich!!  It's an explosion in your mouth.  Not recommended if you don't like tomatoes.  The only problem, it's a "special" item so unless it's written on their board for that day, you're out of luck ordering it.  

The main problems with this place.. parking is an issue in this area.  That AND finding a seat can be a problem too.  More times than not there are a ton of people who order coffee and plant themselves on a seat in front of their computers.  They do have designated seats for those just there to eat and most recently increased the number of tables with those restrictions, thankfully.
author: Debbie S.

description: HAVANA Latte is absolutely amazing.  I'm an addict.
author: Deborah V.

description:
This place is great.  Great coffee, great service and great atmosphere, in a newly gentrified, urban kind of way where wood meets steel meets cool photography in an open 2-story loft layout.  

I've had a variety of sandwiches and salads here, all solidly good.  I love their Turbinado sugar concoctions... mmm.. I'm definitely a coffee junkie, my legal addiction, and coffee bar has a relaxed yet intense vibe if you know what I mean... like if Bob Marley and a hipster startup tech nerd had a child... hahaha...  I guess you'll just have to go there to see what I'm talking about.  

Extra kudos to the cute dogs that frequent the place... Teddy Bear Pomeranian, I'm hoping to run into you again... we had a moment...
author: Sarah C.

description:
Coffee Bar, you are clearly doing well so....

Please install darker shades and get air conditioning. It is hard to enjoy your delicious coffee and endless wifi while roasting in your South-facing Gitmo-esque cafe. Seriously it gets insanely hot in there and if you literally go across the street they have air-conditioning, comfy leather chairs and Clover-brewed coffee at Starbucks. Try to follow their way.

Or maybe not. More people were in your place than theirs, astoundingly. 

To the newbie, I would advise you to stay far from the windows and look for the electric plugs to be hidden under the tables. They also segregate the unemployed laptop community off on the edges of the room so the employed people can eat at the tables and babble on about the exciting start-up they work for.
author: Dave B.

description:
Went in before a climbing session for my morning coffee and a brekkie sandwich. They didn't have a menu out, so I simply asked for what I wanted: an egg sandwich, no meat, no cheese, on any kind of whole wheat bread. Dude behind the register was new, he called his boss over to help him put in the order. Here's their conversation:

Cashier: "She just wants some eggs on whole wheat toast; I'm not sure how to put that in, and I wasn't sure if we should charge her less since she's not getting the meat or the cheese or anything."

Manager: "Hmm. Here you go..."

Cashier: "OK, your total is $10.89."

Me: stunned silence as I hand over my money. 

I'm not saying they should have charged me less necessarily. When you customize food, you go off the price of the original order. But when I was delivered my food, I found that I not only opted out of the cheese and the meat, I also had apparently opted out of the avocado. And the sandwich came on white toast. 

So, I was a little bit pissed off. 

But, the macchiato was good and strong (Coffee Bar's only saving grace).
author: Allison S.

description:
I have been searching for my ideal spot to get some work done while enjoying a tasty cup of java. After spending some time in various coffee shops in the Valencia and Dolores area, I think I may had finally found my ideal location. I can tel you that I will be a regular here for the foreseeable future. The place is very bright with high ceilings, very friendly and courteous staff who serve yummy lunch items and coffee. Now their coffee is not the artisan "Blue Bottle/Ritual Roasters" variety. It is pretty good nevertheless but far from being the best cup of coffee in SF. That is why i reserved the final star for this joint. 
The place can get a bit crowded and on a beautiful sunny day, one can not blame all the folks for wanting to hang out here. I hope it remains a bit of a secret for a little longer...
author: Alireza R.

description:
This is the only cafe in the city where I can really get stuff done. 

I like their cappuccino and latte. They have decent sandwiches for sure. On the other hand, I had quinoa salad once and it was actually stale. I also bought one pound of their coffee beans. It's definitely *not* comparable to Ritual or Four Barrel at all.

However, they have such a great atmosphere to work that it really doesn't matter too much for me. I *love* the place. Ah also, there are usually cool, interesting people around you.
author: Ertan D.

description: The lattes are amazing here. Salads too! A little pricy but they give you pretty big portions (and it's very fresh/tasty). I don't come here often (usually if I decide to treat myself for a weekday lunch) but when I do, it's generally a great experience. The breakfast burritos are pretty tasty too!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
got the steakwich special - oh so good!  thinly sliced steak, grilled onions and roasted red pepers, melted brie, asparagus on ciabatta.  comes w/ a side salad.  pretty frickin amazing.  $11.

ordered an iced chai - terrible.  all i tasted was a powdery milk that wasn't very flavorful.  went back and ordered a vietnamese style coffee which was much better. not an extensive coffee menu though - don't expect any flavoring outside of their mocha cappucino.  

very open place, big windows for the sun to pour through, lots of space to sit and use their free wifi, many outlets, big communal tables, nice people working there.
author: Jamie E.

description:
LOVE.  THIS.  SPACE.  Wide open, good light, and two levels with a garden in front.  A little put off by the "30 minute limit" signs on some of the tables, but I know that they do that so that laptop gypsies don't camp there.  I just wanted to stay longer than 30 minutes with my good old fashioned paper notebook, and the only tables open were 30-minute ones.  Luckily, another space opened up a short while later.

I'm looking forward to going back again and again to try things...but know this:  their cookies are delicious and iced tea brisk and refreshing.  The service is great and restroom clean.
author: Jo S.

description: I wonder what dickwads would give this place one star. I come here every Wednesday for lunch and to work. Tons of seating, free wifi as well as the option to pay for premium wifi, excellent food, EXCELLENT service (seriously, these people always have a smile on their faces and are so courteous and professional - consistently the best service I've ever had at any establishment in San Francisco). They have a very fair seating policy during lunch time, and offer plenty of space for people to plug in and work. I love this place.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I am not a local here but drove from San Jose just to try and check this place out. I am VERY impressed with this place. I saw a lot of reviews saying the staff are rude and unfriendly. I came keeping a close eye on how my experience was with the intent to share how the staff treated me.

It was pretty busy when my friend and I walked in. There were two males working at the time I was ordering. I ordered 2 Neopolitan espressos one for myself, and one for my buddy. The barista did a great job preparing and making sure our shots came out great! And it tasted great as well!

Took our drinks upstairs and got a great spot at a long mini bar table that overlooks the front entrance and work area of the baristas. (Great view and atmosphere). After about 10 mins, I went downstairs and ordered the Kenya espresso for myself and a latte for my friend. At this time the barista switched shifts. He too did a great job preparing and making sure the shot came out correctly. The Kenya was good, but I preferred the Neopolitan blend more.

I sat there and took notes while my buddy was on the laptop flirting with some girl on facebook chat. After a couple hours we got hungry so I ordered 2 Frenchys w/salad and 2 orders of the tomato & cheese soup cup. The sandwich was very simple but delicious. The bread tasted really fresh. My friend thought the soup was ok, but I enjoyed it. We both agreed the salad was good.

I'm not from the area but from what I read about some of the reviews, "too many hipsters" or what not seemed really judgemental. I did not get that impression when i came there. Excellent place to go and hang out! I loved my first experience here and would definitely come back for more. Next time, without having to try out so much and get totally wired off espressos :)
author: Jimmy B.

description: After a great lunch with my mom, we decided to grab some coffee. Walk a couple of blocks down to coffee bar and was definitely mesmerized by the architect. The location was great but the cafe was literally a coffee brewery which was really cool. The spot is a little confusing because the front has such a wide open area that it is hard to tell where the line is. Employees were very welcoming and since it was my first time there they really helped me choose what I wanted. The menu is simple which is great but I am a coffee snob and the fact that they only had two types of milk (whole milk and almond milk) turned me off a bit. The latte I ordered was quickly made and was very artistic. However it was not good at all. I would have rather picked my usual cafe americano over the latte. I think it was the milk that threw me off because I usually drink nonfat or soy.
author: Allie B.

description:
Want to upgrade from your daily Philz coffee? This is the place to go to to get the best latte of your life in sf (at least thats how i felt). 

Their fair trade coffee lattes are made to perfection as the friendly barista craftily take their tender loving care into whipping up a mighty nice latte.

 Came on a game night and got the last Saison Dupont Belgium beer, score! They have a huge front patio area, inside is pretty spacious, friendly workers, and the area is nice and quite to get some work done while getting your caffeine fix.
author: Shirley L.

description:
I really enjoy coming to this place and spend sometime working. The staff is really nice and the best thing is the internet speed. 
Unfortunately, the wind and the low temperature in this place is awful. Last time I was sitting in the second floor next to the main door, the door wont close by itself and a strong wind will hit your face like you are driving a motorcycle.

This place could be a five-start once they figure out how to keep their customers warmed.
author: Fab S.

description:
I'm hesitant to write a review for this place because I want it all for myself, but I must!

Usually, the SF cafe-worker is faced with a choice: either get great coffee, but have a poor working environment (no outlets, no wifi, uncomfortable seating, judgmental  stares from the staff) or have a great working environment but poor coffee.  

No longer, says Coffee Bar!

One tip: you might want to bring something warm to wear, as sometimes they leave the door open and it gets pretty chilly.
author: Corey C.

description:
Granted, this place has got some pretty tasty sandwiches and salads, and the coffee ain't too shabby either, their roasters being Mr. Espresso from Oakland. But I've definitely had some tastier cups down the street at Stable and for sure over at Four Barrel when I can stand the crowds.

What really freaks me out about this place is the Mac Book Pro love fest that goes down seemingly 24/7 here. Seriously, if I don't have mine with me I feel like a lesser human being. And don't even think about bringing a Dell or Toshiba or even one of those older white Mac Books. They just don't go with the decor I guess. 

Outside of my laptop conundrum, I'll come here and chill on the patio with a fairly delicious cup of coffee. The seating isn't necessarily the most comfy outside, but there's a decent amount of sun on their patio, which is more than I can ask for from a lot of coffee houses in SF.
author: Monica C.

description: Big space and plenty of places to sit! Pretty good free parking in the area for SF. Delicious Vietnamese Iced Coffee
author: Page F.

description: I crave their almond croissant.  Fabulous teas selection.  Perfect ambiance for a productive work day.  Highly recommend
author: Irum M.

description:
Coffee Bar is my favorite spot in the city to work.  Despite the fact that it's hipster central and it's in the middle of nowhere, it's an awesome place to sit down, concentrate, and get sh*t done.  It has a very clean and relaxed atmosphere, tons of outlets, free wifi, and it's usually pretty quiet so you can concentrate.  Definitely gets crowded mid-day on the weekends but there are a ton of seats and an outdoor patio, so a spot usually opens up pretty quickly.  During lunch there is a time limit on wifi usage.

Food/drink:  Their lattes are really good and their chai is nice and spicy.  Can't comment on their beer or wine selection, but I know that they do have both available. Boyfriend likes their sandwiches, and I think their salads are just alright.  They serve small portions, just the way I like it.

P.S. They just opened a new location on Montgomery between Sutter & Bush in FiDi.
author: S. F.

description:
Coffee Bar has a really cool ambiance, with everyone working on their laptops, next to each other, almost like they're friends.

The food is pretty good. The sandwiches are a little overpriced, I always liked the pruscuitto with fig jam and brie on a baguette. But I also found out I could buy all the ingredients for about $20 (if I get the fancy stuff) and make plenty of sandwiches that taste the same.
author: Analisa S.

description: Great ambience to work in, and the food and drinks are perfect to work with.
author: Pat C.

description:
On the weekends, especially early in the morning, it's 5 stars.  Great coffees and chill atmosphere.  

during the week,when it's full of hipsters hogging tables all day and multiple screwed up orders, it's a zero.  

Here's a tip, coffee bar, you need to not charge people $5 for the whole day for the premium wifi--because it just encourages people to stay all day. 

Also, WTF about not having enough large coffee mugs for a "here" experience? What kind of coffee bar pushes me to a paper cup because they're too cheap to buy mugs when the dishwashers break them?  seriously, guys, fix this.  

Hence the average review. I love coming here on the weekend mornings to relax outside, but each time I try to come here and work for 90 mins with a cup of coffee I end up wishing I haven't.
author: Mel B.

description:
