Great atmosphere for casual business meetings or just getting out of the office for a while. It has also become my staple benchmark for cappuccinos and mochas around the world.  I highly recommend it to anyone.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I used to work right around the corner from this place.
I miss it. A lot.
The cappuccinos are a thing of beauty. Perfection in a little cup. The pastries while not always abundant - were delicious. These guys know how to make people happy - and that is where I want to spend my hard earned dollars thank you. Where someone cares about making me happy.  
I'll be back Coffee Bar - I promise.
author: Tom R.

description: Laptop friendly (free wifi & 40 plugs) and delicious food... Spacious and sunny... So far best cafe in Mission to work on weekdays!
author: Gercek K.

description: This is hands down the best cup of  NORMAL priced coffee in the city. Nice light/seating, hella good snax and fancy lunch stuffs, kind/cute counterfolk, wine and beer. What more could you ask for in a coffee spot?
author: A M.

description: The place is near my office and I'll often pop in for a Havana Latte.  Love the high ceilings and modern decor.  The coffee is delish and the buzz is palpable.  Great spot for a rendezvous with friends or clients.
author: Geoffrey C.

description: I've been on the search for an amazing wifi cafe where I can unapologetically  park my ass and work on my laptop for 6-8 hours straight. Coffee Bar is that place. There are tons of outlets, the food is good, the wifi is fast, and you don't feel bad for hanging out there all day.
author: Desdemona C.

description:
What a concept -- a real CAFE in San Francisco that:

1)  Stays open past 5:00PM
2)  Serves something other than coffee, cardboard muffins and uninspired sandwiches (try the Catalan-style sardines)
3)  Has an interior design aesthetic unrelated to a 100 year-old dirty shack
4)  Is LOCAL
5)  Serves good quality food, coffee, drink AND service

Thanks coffee-bar for challenging the bar dominant culture in San Francisco with something different and, gasp, more worldly!

Oh and their coffee rocks...hands down competitor to our good friends Ritual and Blue Bottle.
author: Adam G.

description: This is coffee as it was meant to be indulged. The rich dark chocolate flavors abound. The owners have recreated a beat generation cup of coffee within an industrial ambiance. If you know Trieste, Graffeo or the Med - you know what yo are in for. The pastries and sandwiches are equally addictive. Might have to join a 12 Step program....
author: Frederick P.

description:
The way traditional cappuccinos should be - one size, small, perfect foam. 

THE best soy lattes by the cute barista on Wednesday mornings.

AWESOME customer service.  

I would make it five stars if they get there croissants from Tartine instead of Pierre's.
author: Grace C.

description:
this is my newest favorite place. the portuguese wine is really really nice, and the atmosphere is laid-back, unpretentious yet hip. The big windows and the outdoor patio just add the perfect touch. 
Their food is good, and my friend, who's a real Parisian, says that their croissants are the best she's tried outside Paris.
author: S. A.

description:
Love this place, they make the most beautiful lattes !

They know how to steam the foam in a silky fashion....
author: Lisa M.

description: Their coffee is super strong. I love it. Great atmosphere. Beautiful people with cute dogs on the patio. Studious and hard working types on their Macbooks inside. I'll keep coming back.
author: David K.

description:
on those lazy weekend mornings, when i need a jolt of caffeine, i just want a chill place to get a good cup. even with all of the great options within blocks of my place (philz, ritual, atlas cafe), i always end up at coffee bar.

the highlights of coffee bar are the cool friendly staff, the open, airy space, good coffee, dynamo donuts and of course, the sunny patio.
author: Rob D.

description:
okay so i'm totally conflicted. here's why.

the staff is so rude. i accidentally spilled some creamer and when i apologized to the guy behind the counter, he just handed me a wet rag. holy sh**, seriously, he did that. but other than that one time, i just ignore the little hipster snobs. i just want my coffee.
there's never any parking. i just circled around the block for a half an hour to find parking. and there's no excuse for this but the coffee isn't that good and it's really inconsistent. but why should they change anything when no one ever complains and it's always busy? hmm. 

well, i'll tell you why. because the space is a beauty. i love sitting here. and i love that they have wifi and plugs. there's no other place that is big enough and that i like to work at more than coffee bar. there, i said it.  i like four barrel's space a lot but their seats are so uncomfortable.

all the cafes in my hood that have wifi and plugs smell weird and i can't get any work done. i hate small round tables and i hate flies buzzing near the door. 

it can get hot in here sometimes but in sf, that's a good thing. i love the succulents outside and the dogs and babies that occasionally stroll in from time to time. most of the other patrons are nice and will scoot over for you to make room at a table. that's nice. i like this hood, especially when it's sunny. being inside this sunlit warehouse makes me feel productive and happy. even with all that other neg stuff.

i'm telling you though if someone rented one of these warehouses in the neighborhood and built a comparable space with really yummy coffee and hired nice people, well, it would be a home run. if i had the money to invest, i'd do it.
author: b r.

description:
Downgrading until CB deals with the crowds problem.

The first step is acknowledging the problem - which CB has done.

The next step is making changes - CB proposes to limit internet access to 2 hours....I dig this idea.  If someone continues to need wifi making an additional purchase doesn't seem too much to ask.
author: Chris A.

description: My roomie and i literally camp here during the semester, because we get way too distracted otherwise. The workers are extremely sweet, friendly, and helpful, plus the espresso keeps me up...not to mention it tastes sweet and not bitter. While I wouldn't go here to hang out, it's a good place to get work done...the sheer number of open laptops is compelling. The vietnamese iced coffee is pretty awesome, but sometimes there's too much ice and not enough drink, which leaves me unsatisfied and $3.25 poorer. Kind of a bummer. On the flipside, they make really great soy cappuccinos. Not a bummer at all.
author: Helen I.

description:
oh coffee bar...how i miss thee.  i think about you every day.    

coffee bar was my san francisco coffee shop of choice.  great coffee.  great people watching.  good food selection.  natural light.  friendly staff.  easy parking.  plenty of electrical outlets for laptop use.

you were almost perfect.  your only flaw: you happen to also be the coffee shop of choice for my ex-boyfriend.  and i lost you in the break up.

i should have fought harder.  i can honestly say it was my loss.  you coffee bar, not the ex.  that was his loss.
author: Courtaney W.

description: Had a decent cup of coffee here. Line wasn't too long, ambiance is trendy, lots of metal surfaces, and service was polite.
author: Sam Z.

description: Happened to walk by this place while waiting for a friend. Was going to enjoy the sunshine and sit in their outdoor seating but once we got into the place we decided to sit indoors instead. The vibe was very mellow and modern. I found some seats upstairs while the hubby went to get our drinks. Tons of plugs for laptops and plenty of people typing away on their computers. There's apparently a non-laptop time during their lunch hours so the lunch patrons would have a place to eat. We only got a coffee and hot chocolate since we weren't going to stay very long. Husband wasn't excited about the coffee but I thought the hot chocolate was good. I finished it before he could even get a sip. It's a nice local alternative to a Starbucks cafe.
author: Mochi L.

description:
I hate to admit it, but I intended to stop at Starbucks to get my caffeine fix on my way work. I hate these Mondays! My coffee maker was in LA with visiting his mother for Mother's Day. These stops wreck my morning, but it's not like I'm going to learn to work that stupid machine or anything. Since there were no cars parked at the end of Miraposa and Florida. I parked closer to the Coffee Bar than Starbucks. Whatever! I read somewhere that they had decent coffee. No line. Great. I'll be back on my way in a few. 

The selection on the board was too much for me to process before I've been caffeinated, so I just ordered a Latte. It took a few minutes (longer that it takes when the coffee chains were backed up), but definitely worth the wait. Who am I kidding? I would have waited 10 minutes for a latte like this. It was beautiful. The perfect little back and forth swirl. I took a sip before I added anything and had to stop in my tracks. OMG! It tasted even better than it looked! A soupcon of brown sugar was all this cup could handle. I'm even in a good mood at work on a Monday. Go figure.
author: KM R.

description: Wifi, cute coffee and pastry and parking :) yay
author: Tiff W.

description: Great lattes.  Great breakfast food.  Really popular and can be crowded some time which makes the service lacking.  But really really great.
author: Jamie M.

description: Eh.. it's o.k.  Went to Coffee Bar before rock climbing over at Mission Cliffs.  Ordered a chai tea that was decent; only complaint was that it was lukewarm.  I was expecting a little more selection of coffees or teas for a place with the name Coffee Bar haha.  The place definitely is busy and hard to find a spot if you are with three or more people.
author: Alan N.

description: The food and coffee are good here and in nice weather, they have a great patio. But, everyone inside is on their laptop. And the people behind the counter could be a bit more forthcoming with the "please" and "thank yous". It is a bit of a pet peeve of mine but I do find that in a lot of the "hip" mission coffee/food/booze place the people taking your money are too cool to be polite..... Too bad. Overall, I really like this place but some improvements can be made.
author: Heidi C.

description: My best friend and I were on our way to Christian city church on York st and we stopped in for a quick cup of coffee at Coffee Bar. We really liked the warehouse feel of the place. It was clean and trendy. Every single laptop in the place was an apple. If you don't have a mac, don't step foot in the place, you'll get kicked out. :) the coffee was amazing. It didn't taste burned or too strong.. Just perfect!
author: Lindsay M.

description: The place looks modern.. but, surprisingly for so called a coffee bar, they don't have great selection of coffee, or tea for that matter. The music was kind of loud as well. I just thought that the place could be better. It was kind of disappointing.
author: Daisy S.

description: wifi - check. good service - check. awesome coffee - CHECK CHECK CHECK. the large latte is super awesome, there is lots of seating, free wifi, parking. what else could I ask for? um, NOTHING!
author: Holly C.

description: Decent place for a cup of coffee with your laptop.  Lunch menu is pretty good too. They claim to take Square payments, but only do for non kitchen orders, tho.
author: Richard L.

description: Great coffee. And the place is sweeeeet. Big fan of the industrial, warehouse/city style -great place to catch up on work or even hang with friends. Love the patio area outside. Location's kind of in the middle of no where.
author: Tania C.

description:
soooo bummed....i went here for lunch today. Got the Turkey sandwich to go.  I was really expecting a big juicy turkey sandwich but the thing was all of a half an inch thick including the bread. It didn't help that they forgot to put the cheese or greenery on the thing. Of course i didn't discover this til i got back to my office. So for 8 bucks i got a teeny tiny flat turky / mayo on whole wheat, what a waste of money. 
I'll probably give them another chance but i'll never walk out of there again without checking the food first to see if it is correct.
author: Nancy H.

description:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. My honey and I use it as the "office" sometimes spending 6 to 8 hours a day 3 to 4 days a week here. And no weird looks. Always friendly, helpful and quick to get your stuff to you. Great coffee, good tea, excellent homemade chai. 

The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the internet goes in and out constantly and the food, while good, could use some changing up occasionally.
author: Nathan G.

description:
Yeah, the reviews made me go to this place, plus the fact that I was taking classes across the street. 

I ordered the turkey sandwich, which was exactly that. Turkey. And some cheese. No lettuce, tomatoes, fixin's of any kind. Pretty disappointing. The salad on the side was okay, but just leaves and dressing. 

$11 for a sandwich and a bottle of water. Ouch.
author: B B.

description:
Have to agree with Dan P; not getting the arrogant experience from the staff. Again we each have are own; so I can only speak for myself.

I walked in commented the person behind the counter that I understand that they serve the worst cup of coffee in town and thats exactly what I need. 
that lead to a discussion about the best beans for what drink...along with some education of the clover system.....very helpful and cool with the dogs. Great crowd inside. Will go back again
author: Ryan P.

description:
i update my review only to 2-star a few specific aspects on coffee bar (the other positive things i wrote before still are true):

- the music is really quite loud much of time time making meetings or even just working by yourself distracting and hard to do - i now have a new meeting spot because it's too hard to hear people talk. i do understand the music-as-atmosphere thing but it should be at a consistent level and one that is not overpowering or up to the staff's preference

- not enough tables! it's always crowded, which, although good for them, is bad as a customer because almost every single time i arrive between 10am-5pm you have to wait for a place to sit - i used to frequent coffee bar 2-5 times per week for months so i have a lot of time-of-day experience with their business and it's only getting more crowded as time goes on. i liked the place much better when it was a local mellow place to work and grab coffee, now it feels like a trend-scene that's more concerned with the cool factor than customer comfort

- in a related note to above, now coffee bar does frequent evening things (films, dinners, etc) which means they kick out customers at like 5pm which bites! if you're like me (and most of the other laptop-bearing coffee bar customers) you go to a place like this to sit and work for the afternoon so it's lame being kicked out. again, more concerned about cool-factor than being a coffee shop

i write these things on yelp in hopes that the management will read and make positive changes.
author: lisa w.

description: This is a great coffee bar that should have more locations! The coffee here is truly great and the pastries are soooooo good!  I usually get a soy latte and a yummy doughnut! I love those doughnuts!
author: Cat K.

description: I use to be a regular back when I was working in the Mission, and it was my morning wake up drug. I miss their mochas, so good, but it all depended on who made it. I started noticing that there was only one barista who knew how to make the mocha just right without making it too bitter. If he wasn't there, I didn't want to order a mocha... but still did because it was my drug. Damn you Coffee Bar.
author: Wilfred C.

description: Love the atmosphere.  My friend and I used to go all the time, but we would never get anything done, since it is more a "scene" than a work spot.  It is a WAR to get a spot to sit, and if you are unlucky enough to get one of the couches underneath the windows, you had better have on a bikini and SPF 80-  you will be sweating within 5 minutes.  As a writer, I spend most of my time in cafes, and this spot was a bit expensive for what you got-  a lot of 'tude, and not much food.  Example:  with the sandwich we ordered, the "sandwich" was literally some meat between two pieces of bread, and some greens tossed in what appeared to be oil and vinegar.  Um, $9 for this?  Hmm....I had to pause.  Yes, the staff are cute.  Yes, there are cute people hanging out there.  But I go to cafes to work, not to date.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Really like the people, the salads and sandwiches are really good. Coffee is great and priced right. Only thing.. if you like any other "specialty" coffee drink besides a mocha, they don't make it. No syrups. No blended drinks. 

Oh, and I guess they do a wine bar after 5pm. still have to check that out.
author: Allison S.

description:
What a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. Not only is the place hip, but the coffee is damn good. These people have taken the time to figure out exactly how to make a perfect cappuccino. They use just the right amount of espresso to milk and foam. Not too large, just right. The organic milk  they use, I believe, is their secret weapon.  The Starbuck's across the street should take some lessons from these guys.

Update: Ok, Coffee Bar, I love you but I am afraid you might be slipping. It seems as though you've stopped using that beautiful Srauss milk AND your best barista moved to Portland? My coffees just haven't been the same lately. =( However, I will still throw myself in front of a train for your Portobello Mushroom sandwich.
author: Miranda B.

description: Great ambience, wonderful food and drink. Great place to be productive, though it gets crowded quickly. I'll be a regular here nonetheless.
author: Munaf A.

description: stumbled across this gem on my way home, such a find!  the space is gorgeous and quite spacious. great place to work.  the coffee is of course awesome but i was super impressed by their kitchen. i had the tomato soup, a lil on the sweet side but with cheese in it, totally delicious.  also had the tonno salad - tuna, eggs, arugula, mozzarella, and balsamic vinaigrette - delicious! had a wide selection of sandwiches, salads, baked goods.  cant wait to go back to go through the menu and get a glass of wine!
author: Cathy L.

description:
Coffee Bar is an incredible Gem in the area and a place I frequent from my photography studio and with fellow studio mates.  I also take my daughter there on the weekends and we are on our way shortly.  Lindsay is the only person that my shy daughter will order from and that was huge for me.  So I thank Lindsay for her beauty from within and on the outside, as my daughter loves Lindsay and so do I!
Their coffee is top notch and a good cup of coffee does not come squirting out of a machine, but is an artwork and the Coffee Bar is one of the few places to make the best coffee in The City.
author: Zabrina Carlson T.

description: I recently spent a few months in unemployment hell and was left sort of spinning with no where to turn.  I decided that craigslisting from my apartment would prove unproductive.  So, I claimed a small bit of balconey seating at Coffee Bar and made it my full time job to spend my free days there looking for work online.  The coffee is always warm and brewed (not burnt) to perfection!  The baristas (although now practically personal friends) are extremely fast considering their high volume of clientele and they are just super down to earth and wonderful people.  The food consists of only a few high quality ingredients and packs a punch of fresh and local flavors.  I love this place! And although I don't long for the days of unemployment agony, I do long for afternoons of good music, good eats and good people!
author: Nicole d.

description: I love their Cobb salad.  Excellent mix of greens, chicken, bacon and egg.  But don't be in a hurry at lunch time - it gets busy and it's a small staff.
author: Kurt M.

description: Love the clean aesthetic in here.  I came on a Sunday morning, and people were definitely heads-down on work/computers.  Not much chatting going on, which made me somewhat conscious of the fact that I was having a long conversation with someone ... not a very social atmosphere, but I would come back to work or just sit and read.
author: Melinda C.

description: man, i really do like this place.  their havanese latte is so good (well, what isn't good w/ condensed milk?)!!
author: Helen T.

description: CB is by my office so I stop in a couple times a week. Good, local coffee, legit food (breakfast and lunch) and fun events.  Staff can be kind of stuck up, but they grow on you after awhile. Outdoor seating is also a perfect break from the office.
author: Carmen C.

description: This place rocks! Friendly staff. The egg brie sandwhich is awesome.
author: Victor C.

description: Good stuff, good place to come & do work or grab lunch with a friend. Plus they have outdoor seating area. Sandwiches are really good- fresh ingredients, good bread, at least 1 veggie option (sometimes more), and come with a side salad that is dressed in a really nice light dressing. Coffee is strong and good. Cookies are pretty good, nothing amazing though.
author: Kristen L.

description: Met up with my cousin out here and I was really impressed by the quality of food, especially the Tuna Sandwich.  Who would have thought adding chopped olives to tuna salad would make it "over the top" good.  Not a bad cup of coffee and the atmosphere is hella chill and relaxing.  Great place to study for students with the free wi-fi and power outlets.
author: Alan N.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops!  It has a raw, industrial, concrete, modern design.  Try their almond croissant!!  It is rich, buttery, crispy, and just so sweet!  Add a capuccino...love it!
author: Daniel K.

description: Great place to watch laptops watching you watching them...The food and coffee are excellent.  The thought that goes into the sandwiches is just the surface of the gem that Coffee Bar is.  The Cyclops, third-eye, or black eye are my favorite coffees if I want radiation poisoning.  The sandwiches are my favorite.
author: Willard W.

description: This "dog friendly" cafe wasnt exactly what I was expecting. They only dog part about it was that they had an outside area. No snacks or water bowl or other doggys to play with for my little baby Pasta. But the drinks we had were pretty yummy. I had the Havana Latte, which was made with condensed milk...yumms. Jon had the Iced mocha which I didnt try, but he finished it so he must have enjoyed it. I do want to try the Africa Radio food they have on Fri nights...perhaps will return sans Pasta one day.
author: Trina A.

description: Nice place and great atmosphere.  It's my new hang as well the Couchsurfing.com meetings that I attend go here once a week as well.  I just wish that coffee places would also serve a full menu as well, or at least be able to eat well here.  If so I would hang in here forever ;)  The music could be a little overpowering sometimes.  There are a lot of power outlets as well and FREE WIFI rules.  It's not amazingly fast but good enough to write a Yelp review ;)
author: Mitch A.

description:
Ever thought you could catch a tan or sauna at your local cafe? Look no further than up the stairs and to your right at Coffee Bar on a sunny afternoon. You'll probably notice every seat in the house will be taken by a Mac, set of headphones and the look of "reserved for the next four hours" stamp on the foreheads of what must be every aspiring writer in the city. The exception will undoubtedly be two wide open seats on the couches by the window. Wow, you might think, I got lucky - there's even a power outlet to boot! ... don't get too excited. The sun will beat down on you mercilessly until your skin blisters and beads of sweat drip down the sides on your cheeks onto your keyboard. Be forewarned and dress for the beach, wear sunscreen and a wide-brimmed hat. Don't forget to clip a mini-umbrella to the side of your laptop, so you can read the screen. Otherwise, you'll feel like an ant beneath a very hot magnifying glass.

A cabana, some plantation shutters, even a sheet would be a great investment over those windows to make this cafe near perfect.
author: Cinnamon F.

description:
The one day of the year I actually drove to work, I decided that I mind as well take advantage of the extra mobility and go for a drive to lunch. So Joe and I hit coffee bar, a small yet trendy cafe located somewhere in between Potrero and the Mission in rather industrial setting. Outside in the sunny patio there are a few tables and chairs where we found a smattering of locals enjoying a quick coffee/ meal during their lunch break. Inside the cafe is industrial as well- with a modern twist- there is an upstairs area too, but the counter and food ordering station is downstairs near the entrance. We ordered some delicious sounding vegetarian dishes- myself going for the butternut and chard soup while Joe opted for the tomato and roasted pepper sandwich. I also ordered a latte, Joe decidingly swearing off coffee for the afternoon (yeah right). The coffee came out first, a beautiful creation indeed made from Mr Espresso beans, keeping the same style of milk froth swirling artistry as my two other coffee producing favorites (aka Blue Bottle and Ritual). And what's more is that the taste lived up to the look. Our food arrived soon after, the soup was not what I expected in the least. Normally when I think of butternut squash soup, a puree comes in mind. However this soup had a clear and fragrant broth filled with chunks of sweet squash, carrots, and chard. Joe's sandwich was also a hit, served alongside a deliciously dressed green salad. All throughout the meal, Joe was eyeing my latte, and by the end of it decided to get an espresso (actually to be completely correct, a macchiato) for himself. And I was even more delighted to find that he had ordered two slices of a blueberry bread (they serve pastries from Patisserie Phillipe) as an accompaniment. What a great way to sop up the last bit of frothed milk in my nearly empty cup!
My only complaint is that the prices are a bit steep, but then again this is San Francisco, so it's practically a given.
author: Kate A.

description:
Wow- terrible food! Cold potatoes - like seriously, not even warm. Dry toast under two sad slices of ham, and an egg - for $7?!  Really bad food!!


The coffee is the best in the city.
author: Stealth Y.

description:
I'm a zombie without good coffee. This is good coffee. 

Service was great. I'm a disabled gimp and the counter girl totally helped me out.  She was friendly too. 

My salad came quick. The size for the price is amazing. A lot bigger then a few of the places around the neighborhood. The chicken was too dry, however I love the dressing, just wish their was more. 

So yes I will go back, maybe not try the chicken again, but I will go back because the coffee, service, and dressing are amazing.
author: Stella L.

description: This is one of those places that irrefutable demonstrates how superior locally owned, independent establishments are to corporate chains. I came here for the first time for a friend's graduation party. He had done much of his studying here for in the past few months, and all of the employees seemed to know him by name and come by to chat with him. I have not yet sampled their coffee or tea, but they do have a decent beer selection. Their food is delicious and reasonably priced. While it was very loud due to several parties happening last night, the space seemed really accomodating. It's pretty sizable, tastefully decorated, and comfortable. There is free wi-fi. They have a DJ spinning live music thursdays and fridays, which is pretty awesome. I'll definitely be back here often!
author: Zach C.

description: This place is a work-from-home persons delight. It has ample plugs, delicious food and coffee, and is a place you can settle down for a few hours and work your heart out.
author: April B.

description:
haven't been here in ages, but it seems like its the same place - fabulous, even as a place to study, especially during the day. 

Pros:
-amazing drinks
-huge tables w/ ample seating
-free Wifi
-great modern decor so you don't feel as depressed while studying
-parking (but its metered from what i remember)

Cons:
-parking (but it metered from what i remember)

And i haven't been recently enough to comment on the crowd but its good to see that business is going well!
author: Grace G.

description: This place is so cool!  The space is great - lots of seating inside (though it does get crowded), and an outdoor area with tables that will make your friends with dogs happy.  My mocha was delicious, and the pastries seem very good too, judging by the croissant sample I tried.  I live across town, but I will definitely try to stop by again.
author: DD B.

description: This place is amazing. The staff is super friendly, you'll feel yourself at home instantly. There is a sunny open place if you prefer to sit down outside and a very huge, spacey, classy interior where you can sit down and work or just show your latest mac for the others while typing randomly. Unlimited, fast free wifi comes by default. Highly preferred - the sunny, beautiful interior and nice people around will make you inspired and keep you motivated if you're looking for a coffe to work. The music selection is also superb. They have live music shows so sometimes they're shutting down internet around 6pm.
author: Tamas K.

description: Love this place.  Great coffee and fun place to escape to to get work done.
author: Rob H.

description:
My expectations and first impressions of Coffee Bar were in the 5 star range but after going a few times I have to put my heart in check and speak straight from the mind. I can't give it the 5 stars I want to--not yet. I give it 3 stars with lots of room to grow. 

Coffee Bar has a lot going for it. The coffee is top quality, food is decent and the space is luxuriously airy. The ambiance is modern and bare, strong and simple. The space makes me feel confident and hopeful in that way that only high ceilings, giant windows, and designerly flair can.

But Coffee Bar is very young and has a long way to go to reach its potential. While the coffee is nice and fancy in that Blue Bottle way, they have gotten someone in my party's order wrong almost every time. An extra hot latte was served tepid, a latte came instead of a mocha, orders were forgotten and delayed... that kind of inconsistency could push me into into the warm, welcoming arms of the green mermaid.

The food is made from quality ingredients but the minimalism of the decor carries over a bit too much onto the menu. For the highish-for-what-you're-getting prices a salad could be more exciting than organic baby greens and olive oil. I can make that at home. Give me something I can't find elsewhere.

My final gripe is the awkward metamorphosis that takes place at sundown. Coffee Bar transforms from a comfortable place to sit and read or chat over coffee into a wine bar with thumpy-bumpy music and a different menu. I'm not generally against the thumping and the bumping--it has it's place--but its a terrible characteristic of a cafe.

So what does Coffee bar want to be anyway, a cafe or a bar? The identity crisis can't be good for business. If I were a fancy consultant I would say: "Pick one business model, make it work, then think about expanding. Quit shooting yourself in both feet by cultivating two different businesses under the same roof." (End digression)

So 5 first impression stars minus a faulty coffee service star and another for the simplistic menu and identity crisis. That leaves us with 3 very warm, constructive and hopeful stars. I hope Coffee Bar earns back the other two.
author: Sean D.

description: Wonderful place. The espresso roast is dark and flavorful. The latte art is really nice. The texture was wonderful. I'm not sure if I like it better than ritual, but maybe. I'm more of a medium to light roast kind of espresso drinker, so the ritual has an edge there, but the espresso here has a much bigger body and a bolder flavor. The sandwich I ate was great. The turkey, avacado and mustard all blended nicely together. The toasted sourdough was great too. The salad that came with the sandwich was light and tasty as well. I also ate a cherry bran muffin that was quite good. The service here is great and the space is beautiful. Plenty of seating to boot. A must visit in SF.
author: Erik S.

description:
Stepping into Coffee Bar is liking walking into an Apple commercial. It's full of hip young professionals with unruly hair, 5 o'clock shadows, and Macintosh laptops. Now, that's my kind of eye candy.

The decor is minimal and modern but with enough edge to avoid banality. The lunch items are tasty and sophisticated--a welcomed alternative to the seaweed infested fare at Atlas Cafe down the street. The staff, for the most part, is friendly and very accommodating.

I'd like to see more lunch entrées on the menu, and more seating would be nice.

Note: Don't come here between 12pm and 1:30, because you won't find a seat.
author: Chanpory R.

description:
I enjoy the ample, comfortable seating and laid-back attitude at this large, open-spaced hybrid of a coffee house and a wine bar. The selection of wines and beers is, I'm told, narrow but well chosen, and the fact that one can get a Clover coffee for $3 is a draw as well.

The pastries are better than those at the average coffee house, and the food is simple and satisfying; the prosciutto sandwich with goat cheese and fig jam has emerged as my de facto food choice at this point.

If I need to spend a considerable amount of time lost in thought, Coffee Bar has proven to be a fairly convenient option. Parking is typically easy to find nearby, and from what I can tell, the seating area is never overwhelmed by patrons.
author: Eugene P.

description: This is an excellent place for hanging out or working, and I enjoy their selection of food, treats, and beverages.  I had a great roasted veggie sandwich with loads of goat cheese.  For dessert, I shared Anthony's cookies, which were divine!!  They serve tasty espresso drinks plus beer and wine :)  The atmosphere is chill, and they play super music.
author: Sarah W.

description:
update 4/4/08

hmm... been back a couple times now and noticed that the service is a little bit, well, less awesome.  perhaps the newness energy has worn off?  the barista was having a bad day and she made it known.  after a great first experience, this is certainly disappointing to see.  

the red chard and butternut squash soup was way too salty - and i love my food salty!  just not tongue tingling inedible salty :(  i decided that i had to counter it with something sweet.  unfortunately, the chocolate chip cookie from jasmine rae tasted like underbaked dough.

wah, what happened??
-----
wow, what impeccable timing... i noticed this new coffee shop  this morning when i was parking my car (the entrance is partially hidden behind a couple of wooden fences which unaware passerby's will probably miss, especially in this industrial neighborhood) and made a mental note to check it out.  i came into the office, checked my email, and see that the same coffee shop... er, coffee bar, is featured in my daily candy sf AND sf weekly yelp.

i am really excited about this place... can it be?  finally, a nice spot close enough to my office where i can hang out during lunch?

i walk into the airy space and was immediately impressed.  very sleek, clean, and modern, yet extremely welcoming.  its not cozy like traditional coffee shops with their rich brown tones, low lighting, wooden tables, and overstuffed armchairs.  its more urban, almost industrial, and feels like you've stepped into a friend's brand new loft.  the cashier and barista station greets you to the left as you enter, opposed by a wide metal staircase to your right leading to a spacious seating area upstairs with communal tables, four tops, and counter seating over looking the first level.  

i love the "living room" area (where i enjoyed my cappuccino and a very good organic peanut butter and fig jam sandwich) furnished with two understated gray couches, metal coffee tables, and a bookcase full of magazines and books... and lots and lots of natural light.  

there is nothing i love more than natural light.  swoon.  i could have happily sat there the whole day.                 

they have an early birds menu served all day which includes assorted baked goods, granola, fruit salad, breakfast-y sandwiches like the above mentioned pbj, nutella/banana, honey, offered on multi grain bread for under $5.  their lunch salads are $6, hot or cold lunch sandwiches with mixed greens for $8.  they also serve beer (lots of belgium beer selections!) and wine, with a $3 trumer pils happy hour.

the staff is so nice and went out of their way to make sure i was taken care of.  the barista asked if my cappuccino was okay, the chef asked if my sandwich was toasted enough to my liking, the cashier said bye to me when he got off his shift, and one of the owners (jesse?) even introduced himself to me.  you can tell that they are proud and excited about their new business, which is great to see.

i will definitely be back!  yay for a great new place in the neighborhood!
author: Helen L.

description:
I'd been wanting to try this place for ages and ages. When I finally got here, it absolutely lived up to everything I expected. I'd give it 5 stars, but that's reserved for my one true SF coffee love, Philz. I'm sorry. 

Anyway. I wanted to order one of everything to try, but after waffling about for a while I finally just got a cappuccino because a) it seemed like the easiest point of comparison (like how, whenever I try a new Thai place, whatever else I order, I get pad thai too despite the fact that I don't particularly love pad thai), b) it didn't force me to choose between the several amazing-sounding Clover coffees, and c) I was in need of serious caffeine.

It was excellent. It didn't open doors to whole new worlds for me (like Philz), but it really was perfect. The pastry case and food menu looked great, too, but I didn't have anything to eat.

The space is incredible -- stark and hip, but relaxed, airy, and warm -- but clearly suited to a certain moods and certain activities. Although I did notice that the small outside seating area had a more sociable vibe to it.

If I was ever in this neighborhood, I'm sure I'd be hanging out here a lot.
author: Nicole A.

description: Delicious, creative sandwiches. Nice outdoor seating for sunny days. They have vegetarian sandwich options!
author: Joy X.

description: Awesome space, light and airy, modern industrial decor. Lots of people working on their laptops. Animal Collective and Q-Tip for music while I was there. Great artfully crafted food and coffee. I had the El Diablo (mocha with chipotle espresso) which was delicious. Also a very smooth latte.  As someone else pointed out, a quality of espresso equal to Vivace in Seattle. For food I tried out the Cobb Salad and loved it. Great value, great quality- I would go back for that salad alone. Yum. I wish I lived closer so that I could make Coffee Bar a regular hangout. As it is, I will find reasons to go back, alternating between it and Revolution Cafe nearby, depending on my mood.  Although the edge clearly goes to Coffee Bar.
author: James H.

description: Actually 3 and 1/2 stars.  They carry pastries of Patisserie Phillipe and Dynamo Donuts! both big pluses!  Coffee type offerings are fine, space is big and staff are welcoming.  Haven't had a larger meal here except for one lunch, which was very good.  Vegitarian Sandwich.  Some of the laptop nerds are a bit insufferable, looks like a college cafeteria during lunch time, but otherwise it's a recommended stop when in the area.
author: Ron T.

description: I love Coffee, and I love it well. I feel like it loves me back, too. Especially when I give it a little shimmy with some soy milk and let it come sit outside with me on a big open patio. If I lived in San Francisco, I bet I'd be meeting Coffee here pretty often....we could indulge in the free wifi together and relish the abundant indoor and outdoor seating. I think I was destined to love Coffee Bar aside from the fact that they have friendly baristas and good brew--- plus the snazzy window-framed photographs that are so freakin' amazing. Brown paper rolls for menus, genius. I'll be back. Someday...
author: Mo S.

description: An excellent place to work, study, or socialize during the day.  The seating area is spacious, well lit, clean, and has a great atmosphere.  The sound system is tight and is often playing great hip-hop.  The wireless internet is fast and free and power outlets are plentiful.  The food, although not inexpensive (you're paying a bit for the hang time), is well prepared and delicious.  You must check out either Thursday or Friday evening when Coffee Bar hosts the nomadic Radio Africa & Kitchen - truly a unique SF dining experience!
author: Rajeev S.

description:
I really enjoyed this place and consider it a modern day library with good food. I figure I will plant myself here to work most weekends so make a place for me!  I'd like to try some of the evening events too but don't know if I'm cool enough.
 I'd of awarded 5 stars except the coffee is actually not that great.  The food is very good and I recommend anything with bacon. 
So much fun to plug in, people watch, eat good food in an airy space!
Great Place to Hang
author: K O.

description: Loved the coffee (CLOVER!), space, and the food.  This place is amazing, and I can't believe I haven't been here sooner.
author: Brandon B.

description: The Coffee Bar is completely unassuming, if not downright unadorned from the outside.  Once you pass through the front doors, streaming sunlight lights the industrial inspired open loft space.  Friendly baristas make you feel welcome and at home.  Simply a great space to relax or to focus on some computer work with free wireless.
author: Matt P.

description: A mere short walk from my job...this is a much much better option than starbucks (sorry but i just can't deal with the corporate monopoly you have on my caffeine intake)...the lattes are just delicious. (i think i'll get one today), there's wi-fi, great sandwiches and pastries, and get this: LAVENDER SODA! the staff is friendly as well. They also serve wine and beer.
author: Anita C.

description:
The space is awesome, would def come back for their salad or sandwiches and pretend to work on my Mac like most people there. As I don't drink coffee my partner tells me that the coffee is actually really good and they have quite a selection here. 
As I was waiting in line, the girl in front of us persuaded me to get one of their gourmet donuts ( I think it was $ 3.25 not sure, but def more than $3) I decided on the salted caramel donut. I was quite disappointed, while the donut had a decent consistency the flavors was quite off. Not only it was salted caramel it also had a bitter orange flavor to it that made the after taste quite unpalatable.
Although even if the donut was tasty I thought $3 bucks for a donut is a bit much, just because it's "gourmet" it shouldn't cost you an arm & a leg.
On a side note, there's a Starbuck a block away from this place and it was packed!!! what wrong with you people? support local shops, buy their coffee but not the donuts.
author: Andres K.

description:
it seems coffeehouse afficinados (wannabes?) are a bunch of whiners!!!!!
see also reviews of blue bottle cafe. what's up with you, couldn't score or what's the reason for being so unhappy? 
oh, john b., everybody feels very sorry for you. of course, it must be very tragic for you that the  coffee bar website is not updated!? did your girlfriend tell you what a dick you are? oh, she left you, sorry, i forgot.....

anyway, another great coffee place!!!!! i can't find anything wrong with the coffee bar. it's pretty much perfect. and i love not only the clover but especially the coffee made with it!
the space is awesome (converted truck loading ramp!), interior well thought out, the patio simple and great!

i almost forgot, the coffee gets 10 out of 10!!!!

oh,
author: bmwcafe c.

description: My macchiato was perfection.  Great place to have a glass of wine with the girls.  I'm coming back.
author: sarah n.

description:
Great atmosphere, nice people but TERRIBLE, STALE baked goods! Nice try with the old "warm-up-that foccacia so it seems fresh" move. At room temperature, it was rock solid.  A piece of breakfast bread i bought the other day was inedible. Come on, guys!

BTW: Ordinarily, I'd email my complaint to a restaurant directly - at least give them a chance to improve things. But with a poorly-designed website with no email link... Coffee Bar: You're asking for it.
author: amy s.

description: Coffee Bar has been a mainstay for me since soon after it opened.  They have excellent coffee, taking great pride in providing a quality product.  They are also very welcoming in providing a space for San Francisco's many office-less workers.  Patrons tend to do their part by buying coffee and meals and making room to share space with those they don't know.
author: Katherine M.

description: I had the pleasure to go twice in one week. First, I had the turkey w/ provolone on multi-grain bread. Tasty! The next time, I delighted on their baked artichokes w/ aioli & herbs....mmmmm. Both times, I had their mocha decafs (yes, decaf, long story made short... caffeine makes my belly ache badly). The mocha was heavenly and even gives Caffe Trieste some competition!
author: G Z.

description:
it's all white and clean-cut here, it feels like i'm inside a Mac.

and that makes this place a guilty-pleasure, because I'm a PC.
author: Andrew P.

description: The place was not at its actual address.  It was down the street on Mariposa and Florida. Parking is difficult around two pm but well worth it. I was quite suprised of the ambience.  Very chill atmosphere with very modern  decor.  Many people with their laptops. I loved that they had many outlets to plug in laptops or whatever device you may have.  In the background,  music with no words, kinda like background beats. You hear a lot of chattering but not annoying at all.  I had a Radio Africa Chai never heard of it before so I thought I would try it.  Delicious!   It tastes different from any other Chai i have ever had.  It is smooth with lots of spices!  YUM!  It This place is really cool to meet people, have a drink, or even study.
author: Erma C.

description:
this is a great place to work or to meet-up with a friend for a glass of wine. they have great salads, the coffee is delicious, and the folks working there are really easy going and helpful.

i love their large, family style tables - they make the somewhat solitary work of reading and writing feel much less alienating.

the music can get a little loud sometimes - but it's a big space so it is no real problem.

this place is hard to beat and is definitely one of my favorite coffee shops in the city.
author: nicole a.

description: This is probably my favorite cafe in the city.  It gets great sun and air and is just the most relaxing place ever.  Wait but I didn't really want anyone else to know about this place... oops.
author: Kurosh H.

description: Coffee Bar is *the* place for young designers and techies to sit down and co-work with their friends. There's great coffee, free wifi, plenty of power outlets, plenty of tables, lots of light. What more could you need? Well, they have a nice selection of food and when you're tired of coffee there's plenty of beer and wine choices. The atmosphere is excellent, just don't bring a PC! It's not like you would anyway right?
author: Will A.

description:
If it was possible to give negative stars...I would!

I have been frequenting Coffee Bar for a number of years as it used to be in my work building.  I want to like Coffee Bar; I have given them many many chances.  I would like to support them as I know they use local bakeries (that I generally like).  The food is decent, but definitely overpriced.

My moment of ANGER today is after my 4th drink in a row that is luke warm in addition to not being drinkable at all.  Today, I asked for a "burning hot" chai, as I know they never make their drinks hot enough.  A regular warm drink should necessitate a drink sleeve; after asking for EXTRA hot drinks....not once have I needed a drink sleeve.  The drinks are luke warm.

Today, however, was my breaking point.  In addition to my drink being luke warm, which was not a surprise, it was absolutely undrinkable.  It must have been 3/4 Chai and 1/4 milk (or some ratio that had way too much chai).  I had a colleague try my drink to give an objective opinion, and she too made a face (you know the one....like when something is too sour).

I left the shop knowing the drink was bad and didn't say anything about my $4 drink because the customer service is so snooty and consistently rude (and I'm a regular, they should know me by now).

Did I mention that I hate Starbucks?  But, from now on I will frequent my new favorite coffee shop in this part of the mission.....the Starbucks on Bryant and Mariposa, where even though its a Starbucks, at least the people are friendly and their customer service is reliable.
author: Elysa F.

description: The "Just Right" balance of a convenient, comfortable, classy cafe with that oh-so San Francisco quirk.  Alfresco eating of a $10 Nicoise salad with a $9 glass of white on my lunch break from my non-profit gig while people talk about their latest Shanghai trip or Burning Man plans is a special experience.  The service and food are top notch.  In fact, the service is beyond stellar.  A four star hotel would be proud of this staff.  It's a little weird that they have sf parking styled signage about the correct timing of your laptop usage, but whatever... this is San Francisco.  And yes, the Coffee drinks are up to par.
author: marc d.

description: Enjoyed the space, the staff and the coffee, but the extra star is for Jasmine Rae Bakery's doughnut muffin. Yes, you read that right. Jasmine's bakery is right upstairs from Coffee Bar and this muffin is incredible. www.jasmineraebakery.com
author: Dan G.

description: Yummy coffe and food....little slow though.
author: Brandon M.

description: This has become my virtual cone of silence. It is where I'm able to get work done that requires persistent focus. I get there early Tuesdays and Thursdays, when parking and seating are plentiful. Take a spot in the single row of chairs at the upstairs counter, plug-in, fire up the wi-fi, head phones in and am good to go. As coffee spaces go, Coffee Bar provides everything I need and nothing I don't, all awash in natural light from the big windows that make up the front wall of the place and the necessary fuel for the day: coffee, snacks, lunch and plenty of fizzy water. There's enough foot traffic to keep me distracted while I think and plenty of power plugs to keep me working through out the day. It also happens to be a weigh station for many of my friends who pop-in for a coffee or lunch, just long enough for me to say hi and catch up for a couple min. then back to work. Oh yeah, and while I don't drink coffee, I hear there's is among the best in the city.
author: Derek D.

description: I loved Coffee Bar when a friend introduced me to it over the summer.  And so I have come back, including this Saturday.  However, I was really turned off by the rudeness of the guy who made my coffee.  Out of nowhere, he mocked me when I asked him a simple question.  Dude, do you really think you're that cool?  Part of a really good coffee bar is the service at the counter.  If you are a prick, then there are 100 other cool coffee places in the City.  Cheers.
author: Michele B.

description: This is a great coffee shop with a warm, welcoming feeling. The food is tasty too and they don't care if you stay all afternoon. Only two minor complaints; there are a million laptops and not enough outlets, but, the people who come here are nice enough to let you plug their laptop with yours into an outlet splitter if you're a boyscout and bring one. Also it's a little hard to get here from public transportation.
author: Rachel B.

description:
the girl who is always at the counter is hot, i believe her name is lindsey.

best chocolate chip cookies ever!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
i like it. lots of sitting space whether its at a table, booth, couch or outdoor, there's seating. gives you this warehouse feel with awesome art work and fresh flowers. the music is good. and cause the place is big with high ceilings, it muffles out all the talking. there were also some metal mini tables to use on the couch, i want one for myself!

the food was delicious. while it may be on the expensive side, i thought my tuna melt was yummy. 

there's free wifi, and lots of plugs around the place. seemed like many people like to bring their laptops or books and work on whatever it is. apparently, this is the place to do your meetings. cause throughout the time i was there, there would be people coming in siting together and discussing business or something. 

also, parking is great, lots all around.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Hip, beautiful, web2.0-enabled, caffeine-addict?  This is definitely your place.  Attracts a very upmarket crowd - mostly artist and web2.0 entrepreneur types from the surrounding loft spaces.

Everything is great - the coffee, food, tunes, couches, etc.  The WiFi is a bit slow, but there are power outlets everywhere, unlike eg Ritual Roasters. Light, airy, appealing.

But... maybe too upmarket?  I guess if I were one of the wealthy and beautiful I wouldn't feel that way, but as one of the scruffy underemployed...
author: Nick C.

description: Legend has it that there is a magical place in the fantastic land of San Francisco where one can go to enjoy the purest of coffee, wine, beer, food, sunlight and music amongst comfortable seating and strong WiFi communication signal.  Thus didst the scrolls decree, and thus does this Coffee Bar exist.  Well worth a visit.  Plus, a talented Minstrel doth indeed provide excellent musical atmosphere on Saturday afternoons.. a very jazzy, funky, soulful groovy situation... a choice way to spend some coppers and time !
author: critical Francis ..

description: Overall, great espresso drinks but lackluster drip-brewed coffee.  Like all cafe/coffee shops, the experience level of a given barista can be quite variable, but I've never had a poor experience here. The location in SOMA is good for picking up coffee pre-work, with parking being easy to come by (industrial/hipster high-rise area).  Also of note is that there is a good deal seating room up on the landing.  What else can you say about a coffee bar?
author: TJ D.

description: Located in the Mission-Potrero area this coffee house offers good a great latte that is a work of art, a nice assortment of breakfast pastries and some pretty inviting sandwiches.  I ordered the roasted turkey and it came with a small side salad.  The when I arrived to meet a friend the place was pretty packed, but we were able to find a seat.  Other reviewers mentioned free wifi, which was apparent as many patrons had their laptops out.  The decor was minimal but comfortable.  There was ample parking (on a Sunday) in the area, which is rare for SF.  As others had mentioned, though the address is on Bryant, it is more on Florida.
author: Perry W.

description: pretty interesting coffee place. located in the heart of the mission, this place is quite unique with this very chill and inviting atmosphere. a lot of people come here to work and just hang out. the place has both coffee and alcohol (hence the bar) and it also has food. bartender is very friendly and so are the people there. the con is that (or at least when i was there) there is only one person manning the bar and register so if hes busy.. get ready to wait a good 5 mins.. i know it doesnt sound like a lot but when u're waiting for a simple cup of coffee.. it can be.
author: edward k.

description: That clover machine makes the smooothest, richest cuppa cup - I'm forever spoiled.   Plus the space is the lightest and brightest, but still warm.  The seating elevated over the prep area allows one to become mesmerized observing such zen coffee shop tasks as slicing bread, pouring pretty lattes, and looking good in the sunshine.
author: Natalie S.

description: This is the greatest coffeeshop in San Francisco.  There are lots of clean wide spaces, plugs and natural light.  This is the premier place to go if you're looking to hang out and work all day.  There's some nice eye candy here too, especially if you are into nerdy independent contractor types (like me).
author: Dana M.

description: Their coffee is good and inexpensive.  They even serve wine and beer - which is the bees knees.  The atmosphere has that converted warehouse feel to it - which I really like.  I love the outdoor sitting area where there are always plenty of dogs hanging out - which is cool.
author: Jenn D.

description: Stop letting your customers double park their cars all over the damn intersection goddamnit! I am TRYING to go to work! So annoying!
author: Thlel Yan D.

description: Just discovered this place while doing a short stint at Theater Artaud. It is my ideal cafe!...unfortunately, I live in the East Bay. It's so beautiful inside, sunny and airy. It's cozy in the fog and bright on a sunny day. Local residents seem to populate the place, most of which are likely artists from the live-work lofts in the area. That makes sense because this cafe feels like an artist's loft. It generates a warm, sophisticated, "arty" feeling which is complete with magazines for browsing like ArtForum and Dwell. I walked in, ordered a cafe au lait, grabbed an ArtForum to peruse and sat on a couch in the sun like a cat. Heaven in SF. I'd come here from the east bay just to hang out anytime.
author: Alotta F.

description:
Though SF is a city of many coffeehouses, every one is either too loud, too small, too crowded, lacks decent eats, doesn't offer free wifi, has only a few outlets, has crappy food options or a staff who gives me attitude when I order my fancypants coffee drinks (what can I say? I like my triple vanilla lattes). But after years of trolling the city looking for the perfect spot, I finally discover Coffeebar. It's *just* right. Its many charms include:
**Great space -- Outside, there's a lovely patio, perfect for sunny days. Inside, the bi-level loft is bright and airy thanks to huge windows.
**Super-nice, friendly, helpful and sincere staff. Thank you for not giving me attitude when I order my frou-frou lattes.
**Free wifi -- and loads of outlets.
**Excellent coffee and chai drinks -- they take it seriously here.
**Good eats -- Sandwiches, salads, and (my personal favorite) a bowl of granola (with no raisins fouling it up) with yogurt and fresh fruit.
**A decent beer and wine menu, great for after work.
author: Jen R.

description: Heavenly coffee, nice staff, good food, & awesome light and airy space -- I want to move right in.
author: Sumi Y.

description:
Coffee Bar is great.  The location is very nice and the space is very inviting.

It is definitely in the top few places for working on your laptop. 

The oatmeal is really good but that is the only food I have had.  For some reason I have not really enjoyed my coffee there yet.  I have had a soy latte, iced coffee and a regular coffee.  Something about it was just a little off to me and I am not sure why.  For reference my favorite coffee is Ritual Roasters and Blue Bottle.

I would highly recommend Coffee Bar especially for groups and for working on a laptop.
author: James S.

description:
great space, coffee, artwork, staff.  our home away from the office a few blocks away.

lately it's getting a little too over-run with trendy-wanna-bes there to watch adam sandler movies on hulu.  seriously, wtf?  but can't blame the place for it tho there should be seating priority applied on actual coolness so that i could always get a seat displacing these lamer work-o-phobics and their uniquely similar hairstyles and piercings and get some work done.
author: Jules C.

description: Coffee Bar is great--the space is beautiful.  The tables are spacious and the atmosphere is really cool.  Great place to spend an afternoon or evening.  Also love that they host Radio Africa on Thursday and Friday.
author: Caren H.

description:
I live right down the street, and was quite happy when Coffee Bar moved in. It's closer than Starbucks, has a cool decor, nice employees (and owner), and possibly most important, good coffee. It's an excellent informal place to meet up for a quite business meeting (I work from home), or just hang out and chat.

Beer, wine and food just round it all out.
author: Justin S.

description:
My favorite coffee shop in the area.  Great coffee (there's a Clover here, though it's currently out of commission), all the usual espresso drinks, chai and hot chocolate if you don't like coffee, and a daily menu of rotating selections (like Vietnamese iced coffee or a Neapolitan espresso).  The baristas, in addition to being experts, are all very friendly (despite being far cooler than you, which isn't their fault).

The space itself is (industrially) beautiful.   High ceilings and two-level seating, cool lighting fixtures and huge prints in arched window frames.  Lots of bar space (perfectly designed with outlets underneath) for lone laptop-luggers and plenty of tables of different sizes.  I also like the energy here, though I admit you can get blinded sometimes by the sea of Mac zombies (not hating, as I'm one of them).

The cafe food is tasty but overpriced; there's also a dinner menu on Thursdays and Fridays courtesy of Radio Africa Kitchen, though I've yet to try it.  Take note that the upstairs seating closes early on Thursdays and Fridays to make room for the aforementioned restaurant, so prepare to leave at around 6 or snag one of the few bar spots downstairs.
author: S P.

description: Little pretentious?  Sure.  Worth it?  Maybe.  While the food is fairly expensive--$8 for a sandwich, $2 for a cookie (which was delicious), the drinks are priced similarly to Starbucks'.  I've been told that the "Clover" is amazing, but my chai had absolutely no flavor.  Meanwhile, the space itself is extremely trendy, but very enjoyable.  Between the design elements and the clientele's accents and wardrobe, I got the distinct feeling I was in Europe.  I felt a little cheated that I had to go back to the office, and couldn't just set up there with my laptop for the rest of the afternoon.
author: Lego S.

description: One of my new favorite coffee shops in the city. I like the industrial feel as it suits the area They have fantastic coffee, I go for the Clover each time, The space itself is very comfortable with lots of natural lighting and a loft-like seating area that makes working difficult with all the good people-watching. I have not indulged in much of the food yet but what I have had was decent. Free wi-fi and cool music round it out as a great spot to hang.
author: Scott T.

description:
checks all the key boxes:

outside space
beer and wine
free wireless
airy space
good food

seriously, why don't more coffee shops follow this model?
author: James R.

description:
i had a boring turkey sandwich and kim had the tuna salad sandwich, which turned out to be better that i expected. she offered me a bite and it was not what i thought it was going to taste like - better. it had olives in it, tasted like there was a lot of it. so if you don't like olives, do not order this. 

it was a perfect day to dine outside.
author: Rosalee C.

description: Seeing as there are already 272 reviews, I think it's probably all been said.  I'll just add to the stack and say there is nowhere I would rather enjoy a huge frothy mocha on any weekend morning.  The place is well attended, nicely decorated, the musical playlist is suitable.  Great urban vibe.
author: Nathaniel I.

description: Loved the atmosphere, the decor, the care that's put into everything they serve and everything we sit on, etc.  Great service and food.  Got free wi-fi.  You should check it out
author: Ingrid Y.

description: SO happy we met, Coffee Bar!  Your chocolate chip cookies are delish, your ham and brie sandwich was to die for and that iced latte couldn't have been better... YUM!
author: Jason R.

description:
Since when did working in a Coffee house give a person the sense of godliness?! This place drips of pretentiousness, from the layout of the floor plan to the idiotic attitude exuded by the employees.

I wanted to like this place but it just wasn't possible. The food is okay, not great. The coffee is good but definitely not worth the abuse. 

Here's the deal, I ordered lunch (a lunch special--grilled sandwich) for take out. The attitude began. First, the grumpy cashier then the kitchen "runner" (I can't call him a waiter since all he did was deliver food and didn't take orders or help in anyway). My order was placed just before a large line formed therefore I thought that I was "safe" from having to wait long for my food. In and out with room to spare, I thought. Nope, I began to question the "runner" when a person who had ordered three people after me got his plate (of the same sandwich) before me. Okay, a mix up. I stopped the "runner" and asked if he had another order for the sandwich with my name on it in the back. He half acknowledged me and mumbled something about it coming up next. Okay great! Three more deliveries later (including a coworker who ordered after me) and still no sandwich! You've got to be kidding me. So, I stopped the "runner" again and inquired. This time I got a full rebuff! I admit I was P.O.'d at this point but I didn't yell at him or anything. He replied with "I don't know!" and "Thanks for your patience!" in the most sarcastic tone he could muster! 

Unbelievable, you work in a coffee house for god's sake! You do you think you are?!! Please don't frequent this establishment.
author: Buz K.

description: I went here specifically for a Radio Africa catering event. I have to say "Bravo" for the organization and execution of the event. The food was good and the atmosphere was great. It was a fix Menu which had a lot of goodies and you could choose wine or coffee pairing. We did the wine and I must admit it wasn't the best pairing. But nevertheless thumbs up.
author: Conny F.

description: Ate here for lunch with the office. My prosciutto sandwich was great. Toasted with a thick goat cheese and fig marmalade. I had ordered a side salad, not realizing that every sandwich comes with a rather large side salad. I felt the salads could have used a bit more. Maybe some shaved fennel in the arugula salad with some anchovies and more lemon juice. Maybe some grape tomatoes, cucumbers, soybeans or walnuts on the greens salad. I dunno, they were a bit bland, but I did enjoy the ingredients that were present. The place a very modern and clean atmosphere.
author: Alex L.

description:
Love this place!
- The cafe folks are so cool and very nice
- the coffee is spectacular
- food is great too for a quick lunch
- there are outlets galore for laptop folks (i'm not one, but any place that welcomes them is a place for me)
- the sun shines through the big big windows
- i can get a ton of work done or catch up with friends
- bathroom's always super clean
- street parking can be tricky at times, but no meters is always good
- inside is open and airy, hip but not contrived or trying too hard, just perfect
author: Judy J.

description: I can have breakfast, lunch, and dinner at this place and not get tired of it.  I usually go off the specials menu -there's always something appetizing - and then I remember they actually have a full menu, too! Only occasional problem is not enough seats! :-)
author: shelley p.

description: I have been to this place several times and at different times.  The Coffee Bar has great ambiance, best looking coffee shop  i have ever seen.  But I am not sure what it wants to be, is it a coffee shop, restaurant, bar, or all of the above?!  The Coffee is mediocre, once when I asked the cashier about what coffee beans they are serving the response was: "I don't know whatever I got!"  The girls at the counter are eye candies but they provide very poor service if not down right rude.  The place is kept clean and I like the WiFi service.  Great place to meet up with friends and co-workers.
author: Mak J.

description: What a cool place! My cubano was amazing. I want to give C. B way more stars but here goes: My sandwich looked great but was kind of dry (tuna) and my salad dressing was overdressed. I applaud a place with 500 outlets for computers but maybe it would be nice to have a small spot carved out for those that simply want the experience of enjoying the cafe without having to wait 10 minutes for someone to finish up on there computer and leave. Thats my beef. Otherwise this place is awesome!
author: lissy L.

description:
I've been trying not to give this place any publicity for selfish reasons, so i could continue to get a seat...  Silly-- b/c there is actually lots of room.  And i want this place to survive the recession--- so here are my 5 well-deserved stars.  Great space and CLOVER coffe.  Why does anyone go to the Starbucks across the street?  are they deranged?

OH-- parking is impossible on weekdays and easy on weekends.
author: Troy B.

description:
I work in the building these guys are in. The address is deceiving, Coffee Bar is actually on the corner of Florida and Mariposa, kitty-corner from Circolo.  It has been under construction for 6 months or so, and they've really done a nice job with the place.

I can't give a detailed food review yet, as I've only had coffee there, but the coffee is quite good.  And the attitude of the people there is great! Friendly, proud of their coffee and food, they make you feel very welcome.  Contrast this to a lot of coffee places where you're treated like you're yuppie scum just because you can afford a $3 coffee by a barrista who would rather be on the dole than actually working for a living.  But I digress.

Let's talk about the space:  There is a large outdoor garden in the front, probably a bit larger than Atlas's back yard; but it is open on 3 sides and feels very big and not like you're in an urban pit.

The decor inside is industrial chic, playing homage to the neighborhood with a huge photo mural (framed like a set of windows) of the muni bus yards a block away.  There are other large photo murals of the shipyards and other industrial settings in SF.

The layout is great; with plenty of room so you don't feel cramped, but done in a way where you don't feel like you're in isolation either.

The steel and concrete space felt surprisingly cozy; reminds me of Slow Club (also down the street).  

Coffee Bar is located in the heart of NEMIZ, the North-East Mission Industrial Zone, and it's great to see how they've integrated themselves into the neighborhood.

UPDATE: I've been there several times now, and every time the coffee is great, and the staff is really nice.

The food looked good, I'll be sure to update this review after I eat there a couple times.
author: Rusty H.

description:
I've come here three times now, once in the morning and twice in the evening.  The coffee here is really fresh and delicious.  My boyfriend is now addicted to clover coffee.  The baristas also take care to make sure you're espresso drink is prepared to your particular taste which is a nice touch.  The vibe is very non-pretentious  and non-hipsterish which gives this place a huge boost above other popular coffee places like Ritual.
Last night we finally tried some of the food and wine here - we had the tuna w/ big beans (I don't know the official fancy name), the cheese plate, and two glasses of red wine.  All the portions were generous and we left feeling very satisfied.  Major thumbs up to the big bean dish which was particularly exciting to me because you can only usually find this dish in Mediterranean restaurants and it is one of my favorite things to eat. 
The space is quite large and really nice to sit relax and have a long conversation or to get some work done. They have free wireless.  
I'm very happy that a place like this has opened in this area and I wish the owners much success!
author: Sarah G.

description:
i've only been to coffee bar during the day so this review is only for the coffee part.  the coffee is amazing - it is by far the best coffee in the city and i'm a black coffee drinker that frequent places like ritual roasters and blue bottle.  there's nowhere to hid in my coffees.  

and the venue itself is a converted warehouse that has an industrial but homey feel with lots of natural light.  i have since been back for the coffee and am looking forward to checking out the wine bar.
author: michelle k.

description: I attended a Global Discoveries wine event there so I can't really review this for what it is. The wine tasting event was held by Vinfolio. It was a good setup for the wine tasting but I didn't try the coffee or the food there. I like the lofty feel to the place where it's wide open space with high ceiling. It's just in the middle of nowhere kind of place and it's not near my neighborhood. It will be interesting to bring my laptop and a friend out there to geek out one of these days since there's free wifi and parking isn't so bad.
author: Yenly M.

description:
my favorite things to eatat cb are the tangy rocket salad and the cold turkey sandwich on ciabatta.  the espresso drinks are consistent and delicious.

this is a wonderful spot for working or studying.  

the manners of the staff people vary incredibly.  but i disregard that... the photography and lighting more than make up for it.
author: threeholepunch y.

description: They have a Clover machine (http://cloverequipment.com/whyclover/why_clover.aspx) and know how to use it.  What else is there to say?  The Clover coffee beats the pants off Blue Bottle's made-to-order drip coffee (which is no different from getting the first cup out of your office pot), and Coffee Bar's espresso drinks are pretty god too.  Friendly staff and nice outdoor seating help too.  The food, however, is only mediocre, and the swarm of laptop-toting worker bees detracts from the environment a little.
author: Akshay S.

description: I like the concept, and the space is seriously cool.  But the portions are a bit small, and last time I went there, I was having problems with the wireless, and when I asked for help one of the guys who worked there, he cut me off before I finished my sentence, barked something and walked away.  Not ok.  Not going back.
author: julia p.

description: I love hanging out here and doing my homework.  They have wonderful lattes and good food, I especially like the portobello sandwich.  I dig the atmosphere of this place.  The music they play is mostly good, but not always, it depends on who's working.
author: ABC D.

description: To sum my experience up, I hate coffee yet I still go to this unique Coffee Bar weekly. Very hip group of 20 and 30 something on laptops while listening to music and indulging in the goodness that the Coffee Bar has to offer. Plenty of seating/table space and outlets to keep your laptops connected to their free wifi. For work, people watching, Radio Africa or just a cup of Joe (Tea in my case), Coffee Bar hits the spot. Check out this Soma Gem.
author: Venney B.

description:
We came here to escape a rainy day while waiting for Universal cafe to open.  It was crowded, and everyone looked as if they had been planted there for hours and still weren't planning to move.  Luckily we found a couple of bar seats, and we promptly wolfed down a spinach/gruyere brioche and a cheddar/bacon brioche.  Both were delish, as was the mocha my bf had.  

The decor is great, I wish I could have taken some of the c-tables home as well as that light fixture on the back wall.  

Can't wait to come back and try some other things on the menu.  FYI, the food menu is upstaiirs on some side tables.  The coffee menu and pastries are downstairs.
author: mochi b.

description:
really the perfect cafe concept for me.  *amazing* coffee for ~$1 more.  Wine available.  Free WiFi.  Great light.  Lots of electrical outlets.  Wine available.  

The different seating areas (tables, single-seat bar, sofa) mix really well so that the mingling of people's uses of the place (~1/2 on laptops, some 1:1 meals, on largish group drinking together) is better than at most cafe's; everyone seemed to be enjoying their own space.  

oh, plus, they serve wine and beer!
author: george o.

description: This is one of my fav places to hang out and get stuff done. Not to mention they have prob some of the best coffee in town. Good drip coffee (not made to order though unless you get Clover) and good espresso drinks. I asked the owner for a long macchiato and he knew what it was (bonus star for that). Food here will leave you wanting more (its good but won't cut it for an appetite like mine). All-in-all, great place to read, hang out, work, surf the web, and most importantly get your coffee fix.
author: Luigi H.

description: Great little coffee place. I come here to get a clover coffee that I drink black, it's just that good. Even though there is a comfy Starbucks a block away, I come here because the coffee is just that much better. If you are looking for something cheap to eat, seriously go to Safeway. The fresh made sandwiches are cheap and tasty. If you want a nice place to hide with a coffee and don't mind paying a little extra for a nice bite to go with your beverage of choice, then come here. Oh and I love the guys that work here. Even when I come in all surly in the morning, they are sweet and efficient in making sure I get a nice cuppa joe.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Only a buck ninety for a tall delicious iced coffee.
author: Zach K.

description: Very good Vietnamese coffee, but I dare you to get there early enough to get a table.  Every table I saw already had a hipster working on their laptop camped out there, the signs that say 'no laptops between 11am-3pm' are not strong enough.  I wish I had an electric cattle prod, to remove the laptop users, but probably that would not have been strong enough either.
author: Mark G.

description: it's a little hipster i suppose, but the food is really yummy, no one's ever been very pretentious with me (and although i might like to fancy myself somewhat hip, i am definitely not a hipster) and on a sunny day i love to sit outside.  and did i mentioin?  the food is yummy.  i was big on the sandwiches...until i tried the salads.  and they're better for me too, right?
author: Sarah P.

description:
great space.  A lot of very spacious open seating in a modern feel, outdoor space too.   they texture milk really well here.  the coffee itself isn't my favorite style, but it's very good.
